Quiz Attempt #119747

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the Income (inRs. lakh) and percentage (%) profit of a company over the six years from 2017 to 2022. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Year-wise Income and Profit of a CompanyYearIncome (inRs. lakh)Profit (%)20171207.5201816015201913022.5202017017.5202119020202215027.5Question: Approximately what was the average expenditure during the year from 2017 to 2022? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Rs. 110 lakh
  • B.Rs. 130 lakh
  • C.Rs. 120 lakh
  • D.Rs. 140 lakh
Correct Answer: Rs. 130 lakh

Expenditure in 2017 = 120 × 100100+7.5 ≈ 112

Expenditure in 2018 = 160 × 100100+15 ≈ 139

Expenditure in 2019 = 130 × 100100+22.5 ≈ 106

Expenditure in 2020 = 170 × 100100+17.5 ≈ 145

Expenditure in 2021 = 190 × 100100+20 ≈ 158

Expenditure in 2022 = 150 × 100100+27.5 ≈ 118

Average expenditure = 112+139+106+145+158+1186 ≈ 130

Question 2
The following table shows the Income (inRs. lakh) and percentage (%) profit of a company over the six years from 2017 to 2022. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Year-wise Income and Profit of a CompanyYearIncome (inRs. lakh)Profit (%)20171207.5201816015201913022.5202017017.5202119020202215027.5Question: The positive increase in profit in comparison to the previous year was minimum in the year: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.2018
  • B.2020
  • C.2021
  • D.2022
Correct Answer: 2021

In 2018 : 15 – 7.5 = 7.5

In 2020 : It was negative

In 2021: 20 – 17.5 = 2.5

In 2022: 27.5 – 20 = 7.5

Thus, it was minimum for year 2021.

Question 3
The following table shows the Income (inRs. lakh) and percentage (%) profit of a company over the six years from 2017 to 2022. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Year-wise Income and Profit of a CompanyYearIncome (inRs. lakh)Profit (%)20171207.5201816015201913022.5202017017.5202119020202215027.5Question: Approximately what was the expenditure in 2018? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Rs. 120 lakh
  • B.Rs. 160 lakh
  • C.Rs. 140 lakh
  • D.Rs. 180 lakh
Correct Answer: Rs. 140 lakh

Expenditure in 2018 = 160 × 100100+15 ≈ 140 lakh

Question 4
The following table shows the Income (inRs. lakh) and percentage (%) profit of a company over the six years from 2017 to 2022. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Year-wise Income and Profit of a CompanyYearIncome (inRs. lakh)Profit (%)20171207.5201816015201913022.5202017017.5202119020202215027.5Question: If the percentage profit in 2021 was 25% instead of 20% than what would have been the expenditure in that year? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Rs. 130 lakh
  • B.Rs. 148 lakh
  • C.Rs. 120 lakh
  • D.Rs. 152 lakh
Correct Answer: Rs. 152 lakh

New Expenditure in 2021 = 190 × 100100+25 ≈ 152 lakh

Question 5
The following table shows the Income (inRs. lakh) and percentage (%) profit of a company over the six years from 2017 to 2022. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Year-wise Income and Profit of a CompanyYearIncome (inRs. lakh)Profit (%)20171207.5201816015201913022.5202017017.5202119020202215027.5Question: The median income of the company in the six years from 2017 to 2022 was: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Rs. 155 lakh
  • B.Rs. 150 lakh
  • C.Rs. 160 lakh
  • D.Rs. 155.33 lakh
Correct Answer: Rs. 155 lakh

First we will arrange the data in ascending order

120, 130, 150, 160, 170, 190

Median = 150+1602 = 155

Question 6
Match List I with the List IILIST I (Knowledge dimension)(a) Factual(b) Conceptual(c) Procedural(d) MetacognitiveLIST II (Meaning)(i) How to do something, methods of inquiry and criteria for using skills(ii) The basic elements students must know to be acquainted with a discipline(iii) Knowledge of cognition and one’s own cognition(iv) The inter-relationships among the basic elements within a larger structure to function togetherChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.(a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
  • B.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(iii)
  • C.(a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
  • D.(a)-(i), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iv)
Correct Answer: (a)-(ii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(iii)

The correct match is as follows.

(a) Factual - The basic elements students must know to be acquainted with a discipline

Factual knowledge refers to information that is true and can be verified. It includes basic facts, details, and data that are essential for understanding a particular subject or discipline.

 

(b) Conceptual - The inter-relationships among the basic elements within a larger structure to function together

Conceptual knowledge involves understanding the underlying principles, theories, and concepts that organize and connect factual information. It focuses on the relationships between different ideas within a broader framework.

 

(c) Procedural - How to do something, methods of inquiry and criteria for using skills

Procedural knowledge pertains to knowing how to perform specific tasks, procedures, or methods. It includes knowledge of strategies, techniques, and processes used to accomplish goals or solve problems.

 

(d) Metacognitive - Knowledge of cognition and one’s own cognition

Metacognitive knowledge refers to awareness and understanding of one's own cognitive processes, including knowledge of how to plan, monitor, and regulate one's thinking and learning strategies. It involves knowing about one's own knowledge and cognitive abilities.

Question 7
Arrange the stages of Piaget’s theory of cognitive development in ascending orderA. Concrete operational stageB. Pre-operational stageC. Sensorimotor stageD. Formal operation stageChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, C, D, A
  • B.C, B, A, D
  • C.A, B, C, D
  • D.D, C, A, B
Correct Answer: C, B, A, D

Piaget emphasized the role of active exploration and interaction with the environment in shaping cognitive development, highlighting the importance of assimilation and accommodation in constructing mental schemas.

 

According to him, children progress through four distinct stages, each representing varying cognitive abilities and world comprehension: the sensorimotor stage (birth to 2 years), the preoperational stage (2 to 7 years), the concrete operational stage (7 to 11 years), and the formal operational stage (11 years and beyond).

 

1. Sensorimotor Stage (Birth to 2 Years)

The first stage is the sensorimotor stage, and during this stage, the infant focuses on physical sensations and on learning to coordinate their body.

 

2. Preoperational Stage (2 – 7 Years)

Piaget’s second stage of intellectual development is the preoperational stage. It takes place between 2 and 7 years. At the beginning of this stage, the child does not use operations, so the thinking is influenced by the way things appear rather than logical reasoning.

 

3. Concrete Operational Stage (7 – 11 Years)

By the beginning of the concrete operational stage, the child can use operations (a set of logical rules) so she can conserve quantities, she realizes that people see the world in a different way than he does (decentring) and he has improved in inclusion tasks. Children still have difficulties with abstract thinking.

 

4. Formal Operational Stage (11 Years and above)

The formal operational period begins at about age 11. As adolescents enter this stage, they gain the ability to think in an abstract manner, the ability to combine and classify items in a more sophisticated way, and the capacity for higher-order reasoning. Adolescents can think systematically and reason about what might be as well as what is (not everyone achieves this stage). This allows them to understand politics, ethics, and science fiction, as well as to engage in scientific reasoning. Adolescents can deal with abstract ideas: e.g. they can understand division and fractions without having to actually divide things up and solve hypothetical (imaginary) problems.

Thus, correct answer is option (B).

Question 8
Which of the following are the requirements of a good teaching?A. Responsive human environment to foster explorationB. Appropriate responsiveness to the child and the groupC. Knowledge of subject matterD. Maintaining interpersonal relationshipE. Strict adherence to a rigid teaching planChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, C & E only
  • B.A, B, C & D only
  • C.B, D & E only
  • D.C & E only
Correct Answer: A, B, C & D only

Let us consider each given statement one by one.

A. Responsive human environment to foster exploration: This requirement emphasizes creating an environment where students feel encouraged to explore and learn actively, which is crucial for effective teaching.

 

B. Appropriate responsiveness to the child and the group: This involves understanding the needs of individual students as well as the dynamics of the group, allowing for tailored instruction and support.

 

C. Knowledge of subject matter: A good teacher should have a deep understanding of the subject they are teaching to effectively convey concepts and facilitate learning.

 

D. Maintaining interpersonal relationship: Building positive relationships with students fosters trust, engagement, and a conducive learning atmosphere, making this an essential requirement for effective teaching.

 

E. Strict adherence to a rigid teaching plan: This option is not a requirement of good teaching. While having a plan is important, strict adherence to it may limit flexibility and responsiveness to students' needs, hindering effective teaching.

 

Thus, correct answer is option (B).

Question 9
Given below are two statements:Statement I:Mentimeteris a tool used for creating interactive videos in education.Statement II:Kahootis a tool used for assessment in education.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

 

Statement I: Mentimeter is not primarily used for creating interactive videos. It is a tool used for creating interactive presentations and engaging students through live polls, quizzes, and surveys.

 

Statement II: Kahoot is a tool commonly used for assessment in education. It allows educators to create quizzes, surveys, and discussion questions to assess students' understanding and engagement in a fun and interactive way.

Question 10
Which assessment will be given to learners during the course of instructions rather than after it is completed?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Diagnostic assessment
  • B.Formative assessment
  • C.Summative assessment
  • D.Placement assessment
Correct Answer: Formative assessment

Formative assessment is designed to be ongoing and occurs during the course of instruction. It provides feedback to both teachers and learners about students' understanding and progress while the learning is still in progress. This type of assessment helps instructors adjust their teaching methods and provides learners with opportunities for improvement as they continue their learning journey.

Question 11
Which among the following is NOT a characteristic of the closed ended questions in survey research?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.They allow unusual responses that the survey researcher may not have contemplated
  • B.They are easy for interviewers and/or respondents to complete
  • C.They reduce the possibility of variability in the recording of answers
  • D.There is a loss of spontaneity in respondents answers
Correct Answer: They allow unusual responses that the survey researcher may not have contemplated

Closed-ended questions offer respondents a limited set of predetermined response options to choose from. This characteristic is contrary to option (A), which suggests that closed-ended questions allow for unusual responses not contemplated by the researcher. In contrast, closed-ended questions are designed to restrict responses to predefined categories or options, making them more structured and easier to analyze.

Question 12
The question of whether the results of a study can be generalized beyond the specific research context, relates to(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Measurement validity
  • B.Internal validity
  • C.External validity
  • D.Ecological validity
Correct Answer: External validity

Option C is correct.

External validity refers to the extent to which the findings of a study can be generalized or applied to settings, populations, or contexts beyond the specific research context. In other words, it assesses the degree to which the results obtained in one study can be considered representative of the broader population or real-world situations.

When considering external validity, researchers examine whether the findings hold true across different populations, settings, times, and conditions. This involves assessing the relevance and applicability of the study's results beyond the immediate research context.

Question 13
Arrange the following steps pertaining to quantitative research in correct order:A. Analyse dataB. HypothesisC. Process dataD. FindingsE. Research DesignChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, C, D, E, A
  • B.B, E, C, A, D
  • C.C, D, A, B, E
  • D.E, B, C, A, D
Correct Answer: B, E, C, A, D

Option B is correct.

The first step in quantitative research is typically to formulate a hypothesis or research question. This step involves identifying the variables of interest and making a tentative prediction about the relationship between them.

After formulating the hypothesis, researchers design the study, including decisions about the research method, sampling strategy, data collection instruments, and procedures. This step ensures that the study is structured to test the hypothesis effectively.

Once the data collection is complete, the next step is to process the collected data. This involves organizing, cleaning, and coding the data in preparation for analysis.

After processing the data, researchers use appropriate statistical techniques to analyse the data and test the hypothesis. This step involves applying statistical tests to examine the relationships between variables and determine whether the findings support the hypothesis.

Finally, researchers interpret the results of the data analysis and present their findings. This step involves summarizing the key findings, discussing their implications, and drawing conclusions based on the evidence collected during the study.

Question 14
In which of the following sampling methods, the sample is also known as an accidental sample or a haphazard sample?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Purposive sampling
  • B.Quota sampling
  • C.Stratified random sampling
  • D.Convenience sampling
Correct Answer: Convenience sampling

Option D is correct.

Convenience sampling is a non-probability sampling technique where the researcher selects individuals who are readily available and accessible to participate in the study. In convenience sampling, the sample is often referred to as an accidental sample or a haphazard sample because participants are chosen based on their convenience rather than through a systematic or random process.

In convenience sampling, the researcher may select individuals who are easily accessible, such as friends, family members, or individuals in close proximity to the researcher. This method is often used for its ease and practicality, particularly in situations where time, resources, or access to the population of interest are limited.

While convenience sampling can be quick and cost-effective, it may not always result in a representative sample of the population, as individuals who are easily accessible may not be representative of the broader population. Therefore, convenience sampling is considered less rigorous than probability sampling methods in terms of generalizability and minimizing bias.

Question 15
The graphical representation of a frequency distribution is called:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Bar chart
  • B.Line chart
  • C.Histogram
  • D.Pie chart
Correct Answer: Histogram

Option C is correct.

A histogram is a graphical representation of a frequency distribution. It displays the distribution of numerical data by dividing it into intervals or "bins" along the horizontal axis and representing the frequency or count of observations falling within each interval using vertical bars. The height of each bar corresponds to the frequency of data points within the interval.

Histograms are commonly used to visualize the shape, center, and spread of a dataset. They provide a visual summary of the distribution of data, including information about the frequency and concentration of values within different ranges.

Question 16
The term ‘Correlation’ in mass-communication refers to the function of(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Information gathering
  • B.Socialization
  • C.Interpretation
  • D.Investigation
Correct Answer: Interpretation

Option C is correct.

In mass communication, the term "correlation" typically refers to the function of interpretation. Interpretation involves making sense of information, analysing its significance, and understanding its implications. In mass communication, correlation often involves interpreting the relationships between different pieces of information, identifying patterns or trends, and understanding how they relate to each other.

Question 17
The coming together of computing, telecommunication and media in a digital environment is technically known as(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Integration
  • B.Amalgamation
  • C.Merger
  • D.Convergence
Correct Answer: Convergence

Convergence refers to the integration of computing, telecommunication, and media in a digital environment. It describes the phenomenon where previously distinct technologies, industries, or services merge into a unified whole, often facilitated by advancements in digital technology. This convergence has led to the seamless integration of various forms of communication, entertainment, and information delivery through digital platforms.

Question 18
Which of the following are codes of reception in communication?A. BystanderB. DominantC. NegotiatedD. OppositionalE. ChannelChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, D only
  • C.C, D, E only
  • D.A, D, E only
Correct Answer: B, C, D only

Stuart Hall introduced reception theory, also known as Audience Theory, in 1973. This theory focuses on how people interpret and make meaning of media content, like movies, books, or games. According to this theory, audiences don't just passively absorb the messages they receive; instead, they actively engage with the content and create their own interpretations based on their social context and personal experiences.

 

In reception theory, there are 3 main types of audience responses:

 

1. Dominant Reader: These are audiences who accept the intended message of the content without questioning it. For example, if a movie portrays a character as a villain with certain visual cues like a sinister appearance, audiences will interpret that character as evil without much thought.

 

2. Negotiated Reader: These audiences acknowledge the intended message but may interpret it differently based on their own beliefs or circumstances. They might accept certain aspects of the content while questioning or reinterpreting others. For instance, if a video game features violence, a negotiated reader might enjoy the game but feel uncomfortable with the violence portrayed.

 

3. Oppositional Reader: These audiences reject or challenge the intended message of the content. They might disagree with the portrayal of certain ideas or characters, finding them morally or socially unacceptable. For example, if a movie glorifies smoking, an oppositional reader might criticize it for promoting harmful behavior.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 19
Which of the following are features of mass communication?A. Structured institutional systemB. Complex process of reproductionC. Commodification of messagesD. Personalized way of communicationE. Space-time constraintChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, D only
  • C.C, D, E only
  • D.B, D, E only
Correct Answer: A, B, C only

Let us consider each option one by one as a feature or non-feature of mass communication.

 

A. Structured institutional system: Mass communication involves organized institutions such as media companies, broadcasting networks, or publishing houses that produce and distribute messages to a large audience.

 

B. Complex process of reproduction: Mass communication involves the reproduction and dissemination of messages across various channels and platforms, which often entails complex processes of production, distribution, and consumption.

 

C. Commodification of messages: Mass communication often involves the commodification of messages, where content is produced and distributed for commercial purposes, such as advertising or selling products and services.

 

D. Personalized way of communication: Mass communication is not personalized; instead, it aims to reach a large and diverse audience rather than individuals on a one-to-one basis.

 

E. Space-time constraint: Mass communication often transcends space and time constraints, allowing messages to be disseminated widely and quickly across geographical locations and time zones. Therefore, it does not necessarily operate within space-time constraints.

 

Therefore, correct answer is option (A).

Question 20
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Because of technological strides in recent times, words and times as related to communication.Statement II: The technological convergence has contributed to the control of mass-communication by a few corporates.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Both Statement I and Statement II are true.

 

Statement I: This statement suggests that technological advancements have significantly impacted communication, which is true. Technologies like the internet, social media, and mobile devices have revolutionized how people communicate, influencing the speed, reach, and modes of communication.

 

Statement II: This statement indicates that technological convergence has led to the control of mass communication by a few corporations, which is also true. Technological convergence refers to the integration of various media platforms and technologies, which has allowed large corporations to dominate the media landscape, controlling the production, distribution, and dissemination of information and entertainment content.

Question 21
The average of 5 consecutive odd numbers in descending order is 95. Find the fourth number in descending order:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.95
  • B.97
  • C.99
  • D.93
Correct Answer: 93

Let five numbers be 2x – 1, 2x – 3, 2x – 5, 2x – 7 and 2x – 9

Average = 2x-1+2x-3+2x-5+2x-7+2x-95 = 95

Solving it, we get x = 50

Fourth number = 2x – 7 = 93

Question 22

  • A.Southwest
  • B.Northwest
  • C.Southeast
  • D.Northeast
Correct Answer: Northwest

The new arrangement will be:

Thus, direction of North will be Northeast.
