Question 24
Find the number that can replace question mark (?) in the series given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)5, 9, 3, 11, 1, 13, -1, ?
  • A.-13
  • B.-12
  • C.10
  • D.15
Correct Answer: 15

Next number = 13 + 2 = 15

Question 25
An articleis sold at a certain price.By selling the article at 2/3rd of that price, there is a loss of 10%. Find the gain percent atitsoriginal price.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.35%
  • B.25%
  • C.33%
  • D.30%
Correct Answer: 35%

Let original selling price = Rs. 100

New SP = 2003

CP = SP×100100-Loss% = 2003×100100-10

= 200027

Gain = SP – CP

= 100 - 200027 = 70027

Gain% = 70027200027 × 100 = 35%

Question 26
If the statements “No saints are materialists” is given as false which of the following statements could be immediately inferred to be true?A. All saints are materialistsB. Some saints are materialistsC. Some saints are not materialistsD. All materialists are saintsChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A & D only
  • B.B only
  • C.C & D only
  • D.A & B only
Correct Answer: B only

Given statement is type ‘E’ and it is false. Therefore, type ‘I’ will be true.

Question 27
Which of the following statements is logically equivalent to the statement “No saints are materialists”? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.No materialists are saints
  • B.Some materialists are saints
  • C.All non-materialists are non-saints
  • D.Some non-materialists are non-saints
Correct Answer: No materialists are saints

Option A is the conversion of given statement.

Question 28
Which of the following statements are so related that they can neither be true nor be false together? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. No saints are materialistsB. All saints are materialistsC. Some saints are not materialistsD. Some saints are materialistsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A & C only
  • B.B & D only
  • C.A & D only
  • D.C & D only
Correct Answer: A & D only

In case of contradictory statements, they are so related that they can neither be true nor be false together. Therefore, option C is the correct answer.

Question 29
The most effective way to increase government revenue would be to raise the corporate income tax, since opinion polls show wide spread support for this approach. ‘Which of the following fallacies is committed in the above statement? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Appeal to emotion
  • B.Slippery slope
  • C.Appeal to inappropriate authority
  • D.Appeal to majority
Correct Answer: Appeal to majority

Appeal to majority fallacy assumes that something is correct simply because a majority of people support it. The argument suggests that raising the corporate income tax is the most effective way to increase government revenue because public opinion polls show widespread support for it. However, public opinion doesn't guarantee the effectiveness of a policy. The argument fails to consider potential drawbacks or explore alternative approaches to raising revenue.

Question 30
According toNyaya(Classical Indian School of logic) the fallacy of irregular middle school is called (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Anaikantika
  • B.Asiddha
  • C.Satpratipaksa
  • D.Badhita
Correct Answer: Anaikantika

The fallacy of the irregular middle is called Savyabhichära or Anaikäntika.

Anaikantika as a term translates to "not invariably" and refers to the fallacy of the irregular middle term in Nyaya logic. It occurs when the middle term (hetu) in a syllogism is not consistently or universally connected to the major term (sadhya).

Question 31
Which of the following affects the downloading speed of a web page the least?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Number of hyperlink in the web page
  • B.Number and size of images in the web page
  • C.Processing power of the server computer that stores the web page
  • D.The bandwidth of internet connection which is used to access the web page
Correct Answer: Number of hyperlink in the web page

Option A is correct.

The downloading speed of a web page can be affected by various factors, including the number and size of elements on the page, the processing power of the server, and the bandwidth of the internet connection.

Hyperlinks are text or image links that allow users to navigate between different pages or sections within a website. While hyperlinks contribute to the overall content of the web page, they typically have minimal impact on downloading speed. This is because hyperlinks are usually small in size compared to other elements like images or videos, and their presence on a web page does not significantly increase the amount of data that needs to be transferred.

Images are often larger in file size compared to text or hyperlinks, and they can significantly impact downloading speed. The more images and the larger their size, the longer it will take for the web page to load, especially on slower internet connections.

The processing power of the server can affect the speed at which it can generate and deliver web pages to users. A more powerful server can handle a higher volume of requests and process data more quickly, leading to faster loading times for web pages.

The bandwidth of the internet connection determines the maximum amount of data that can be transferred per unit of time. A higher bandwidth allows for faster data transfer speeds, resulting in quicker loading times for web pages.

Question 32
To calculate gross pay, hours are multiplied by the hourly rate. What MS EXCEL formula would you put in cell C4 and then you are able to copy that cell down to the rest of the column C? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)ABC1Hourly Rate (inRs)23NameHoursGross pay4Arjun265Rishi376Ishan367Ajay288Arun309Nitin30
  • A.=B1*$B$4
  • B.=$B1*B4
  • C.=B1*B4
  • D.=$B$1*B4
Correct Answer: =$B$1*B4

The correct formula will be “=$B$1*B4”

Question 33
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Compared to word processors, simple text-editors such as Notepad andEmacshave limited editing featuresStatement II: Files created with simple text-editors cannot be opened with the word processorsIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is true. Simple text-editors like Notepad or Emacs offer basic editing functionalities such as typing, deleting, and saving text. They lack advanced features such as formatting options (e.g., bold, italics), spell check, tables, and advanced layout capabilities which are commonly found in word processors like Microsoft Word or Google Docs.

Statement II is false. Files created with simple text-editors can be opened with word processors without any issues. Word processors have backward compatibility and can read plain text files (.txt) created by simple text-editors. Although the formatting features may not be preserved, the text content itself can be opened and edited.

Question 34
Given below are two statements:Statement I:(167)10=(10100111)2Statement II:(11010110)2=(214)10In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

(10100111)2 = 1 × 20 + 1 × 21 + 1 × 22 + 0 × 23 + 0 × 24 + 1 × 25 + 0 × 26 + 1 × 27

128 + 32 + 4 + 2 + 1 = 167

Similarly, (11010110)2 = (214)10

Thus, both the statements are correct.

Question 35
Which of the following components are a part of the central processing unit (CPU) of the Von Neumann model for a computer system?A. Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU)B. Hard Disk Drive (HDD)C. Memory Address Register (MAR)D. Solid State Drive (SSD)E. Control Unit (CU)Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A & C only
  • B.B, C & D only
  • C.A & C only
  • D.A, C & E only
Correct Answer: A, C & E only

Option D is correct.

In the Von Neumann architecture, the Central Processing Unit (CPU) typically consists of the following components:

The ALU is responsible for performing arithmetic and logical operations on data. It performs operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, AND, OR, NOT, etc. This component is essential for carrying out computational tasks within the CPU.

The MAR is a component of the CPU responsible for holding the memory address of the location to be accessed from the main memory (RAM). It is used during the fetch phase of the instruction cycle to retrieve instructions or data from memory.

The Control Unit is another essential component of the CPU. It coordinates the activities of the CPU, including fetching instructions from memory, decoding them, and executing them by issuing control signals.

Hard Disk Drive and Solid State Drive refer to storage devices, specifically secondary storage devices, which are not part of the CPU in the Von Neumann architecture. Instead, they are peripheral devices used for long-term storage of data.

Question 36
Given below are two statements:Statement I: The concentration of Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) in the atmosphere has increased in the past few years.Statement II: CFCs already present in the atmosphere will persist for many years.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Option D is correct.

Statement I is false. The production and use of CFCs have been reduced worldwide due to their harmful effects on the ozone layer and the environment. Since the implementation of the Montreal Protocol in 1987, which aimed to phase out the production and use of ozone-depleting substances including CFCs, there has been a decrease in the atmospheric concentration of CFCs. Efforts to reduce CFC emissions have led to a decline in their atmospheric levels, rather than an increase.

Statement II is true. Although the production and use of CFCs have been reduced, CFC molecules already present in the atmosphere can persist for a long time. CFCs are stable compounds and have long atmospheric lifetimes, ranging from several decades to over a century. As a result, even though new emissions have been minimized, the CFCs already released into the atmosphere will continue to contribute to ozone depletion and environmental damage for many years.

Question 37
Methane(CH4)A. Is a green gasB. Is a polycystic Aromatic HydrocarbonC. Is a component in determining Air Quality Index (AQI)D. Helps in formation of OzoneE. Is a Volatile Organic CompoundChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, & C only
  • B.A, D & E only
  • C.A & E only
  • D.C, D & E only
Correct Answer: A, D & E only

Option B is correct.

Methane (CH4) is a greenhouse gas. It is one of the primary gases responsible for the greenhouse effect, contributing to global warming and climate change.

Methane (CH4) is not a polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH). PAHs are a class of organic compounds with multiple fused aromatic rings, while methane is a simple hydrocarbon with one carbon atom bonded to four hydrogen atoms.

Methane is not typically included as a component in determining the Air Quality Index (AQI). AQI primarily considers pollutants such as particulate matter (PM2.5 and PM10), ground-level ozone (O3), nitrogen dioxide (NO2), sulfur dioxide (SO2), and carbon monoxide (CO).

Methane (CH4) contributes to the formation of ozone (O3) in the atmosphere. Methane reacts with oxygen radicals (O·) in the atmosphere, producing water vapor and the hydroxyl radical (OH·). Hydroxyl radicals are crucial for the formation of ozone in the troposphere through a series of complex reactions involving nitrogen oxides (NOx) and volatile organic compounds (VOCs), including methane.

Methane (CH4) is classified as a volatile organic compound (VOC). VOCs are organic chemicals that can easily evaporate into the air at room temperature. Methane is a significant VOC due to its natural and anthropogenic sources and its role in atmospheric chemistry.

Question 38
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and other is labelled as Reason RAssertion A: Children are much more valuable than adults to environmental toxinsReason R: For each kilogram of body weight children drink more water, eat more food and breathe more air than adultsIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both A and Rare true and R is the correct explanation of A
  • B.Both A and R are true and R is NOT the correct explanation of A
  • C.A is true but R is false
  • D.A is false but R is true
Correct Answer: Both A and Rare true and R is the correct explanation of A

Option A is correct.

Assertion A is true. Children are more vulnerable to environmental toxins than adults due to several factors, including their smaller body size, higher metabolic rates, developing organ systems, and behaviors such as hand-to-mouth activity and increased contact with environmental surfaces. These factors can result in higher exposures to toxins relative to their body weight, making them more susceptible to adverse health effects from exposure to environmental pollutants.

Reason R is also true and correctly explains A. Children have higher rates of water consumption, food consumption, and respiration per unit of body weight compared to adults. As a result, for each kilogram of body weight, children take in more environmental toxins through ingestion, inhalation, and dermal contact than adults, leading to increased exposure and potential health risks.

Question 39
Which of the following are physical parameters to decide the water quality?A.phB. TemperatureC. Total Suspended Solids (TSS)D. HardnessE. ConductivityChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C & D only
  • B.A, B, D, E only
  • C.C, D, E only
  • D.B, C, E only
Correct Answer: B, C, E only

Option D is correct.

pH is a measure of the acidity or alkalinity of water. While it is important for understanding water quality, it is not considered a physical parameter but rather a chemical parameter.

Temperature is a physical parameter that directly affects water quality. It influences various chemical and biological processes in water bodies, such as solubility of gases, metabolic rates of aquatic organisms, and rates of chemical reactions.

Total Suspended Solids (TSS) refers to the concentration of solid particles suspended in water. It is a physical parameter used to assess water quality, as high levels of TSS can indicate pollution and impact aquatic habitats and ecosystems.

Hardness is a measure of the concentration of dissolved minerals, primarily calcium and magnesium ions, in water. It is considered a chemical parameter rather than a physical one.

Conductivity is a physical parameter that measures the ability of water to conduct an electrical current. It is influenced by the concentration of dissolved ions in water and can indicate the presence of dissolved solids and salts. High conductivity levels can suggest pollution or contamination.

Question 40
Which of the following is NOT a National Action Plan on Climate Change? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.National Solar Mission
  • B.National Mission on Indian Ocean
  • C.National Mission for Green India
  • D.National Water Mission
Correct Answer: National Mission on Indian Ocean

Option B is the correct answer.

 

The National Action Plan on Climate Change (NAPCC) was released by the Government of India in June 2008. It outlines a national strategy that aims to enable the country to adapt to climate change and enhance the ecological sustainability of India's development path. It stresses that maintaining a high growth rate is essential for increasing living standards of the vast majority of people of India and reducing their vulnerability to the impacts of climate change.

 

There are 8―National Missions‖ which form the core of the National Action Plan. They focus on promoting understanding of climate change, adaptation and mitigation, energy efficiency and natural resource conservation. These are:

1. National Solar Mission

2. National Mission for Enhanced Energy Efficiency

3. National Mission on Sustainable Habitat

4. National Water Mission

5. National Mission for Sustaining the Himalayan Eco-system

6. National Mission for a Green India

7. National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture

8. National Mission on Strategic Knowledge for Climate Change

Question 41
Which of the following commissions suggested the establishment of National Universities in India? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Kothari Commission
  • B.RadhakrishnanCommission
  • C.Knowledge Commission
  • D.Planning Commission
Correct Answer: Knowledge Commission

Option C is the correct answer.

 

National Knowledge Commission submitted its report in 2009 and provides the following recommendations:

The higher education system needs a massive expansion of opportunities, to around 1500 universities nationwide, that would enable India to attain a gross enrolment ratio of at least 15 per cent by 2015.

The present regulatory system in higher education is, as a whole, is over-regulated but under-governed. We believe that there is a clear need to establish an Independent Regulatory Authority for Higher Education (IRAHE).

The expansion of the system of higher education is not possible without enhanced levels of financing. This must necessarily come from both public and private sources.

Establish 50 National Universities that can provide education of the highest standard.

The endeavor to transform higher education must reform existing institutions.

The system of affiliated colleges for undergraduate education, is no longer adequate and needs to be reformed. Indeed, there is an urgent need to restructure the system of undergraduate colleges.

An expansion of higher education, which provides students with choices and creates competition between institutions is going to be vital in enhancing accountability.

It recommended setting up of a National Science and Social Science Foundation (NSSF) for producing research work that can fetch a Nobel Prize for an Indian scientist.

Question 42
From the fourth five year plan onwards, the focus on technical education was to(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Improve its quality and standard
  • B.Encourage its unrestricted expansion in public sector
  • C.Weed out non-performing institutions
  • D.Restrict the entry of private players in the world
Correct Answer: Improve its quality and standard

Option A is correct.

From the fourth five-year plan (1969-1974) onwards, there has been a significant emphasis on improving the quality and standard of technical education in India. This shift in focus was essential due to the increasing demand for skilled manpower in various sectors of the economy, including industry, infrastructure, and technology.

Several factors contributed to the emphasis on improving the quality and standard of Technical Education:

With the rapid industrialization and technological advancements during this period, there was a growing need for a skilled workforce capable of meeting the demands of emerging industries and sectors.

The government recognized the crucial role of technical education in driving economic growth and development. Therefore, there was a strategic emphasis on enhancing the quality and standard of technical education to support the nation's overall economic objectives.

To keep pace with global developments and technological advancements, there was a need to modernize and upgrade the technical education infrastructure, curriculum, and teaching methodologies.

Recognizing the importance of quality assurance in technical education, efforts were made to establish regulatory bodies, accreditation mechanisms, and quality control measures to ensure that technical institutions maintained high standards of education and training.

Question 43
Some of the major recommendations of the Kothari Commission in higher education are:A. Avoid introducing new coursesB. Select teachers at the national levelC. Restrict the expansion of higher educationD. Provide autonomy to the universitiesE. Abolish the continuous evaluation systemChoose the correct answer from the options given below (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, D, E only
  • C.B, C, D only
  • D.A, D, E only
Correct Answer: B, C, D only

Option C is correct.

Some of the major recommendations of the Kothari Commission in higher education are:

Avoid introducing new courses was not a major focus of the Kothari Commission. In fact, the commission emphasized the need for diversification and expansion of higher education to meet the demands of a growing population and changing societal needs. Therefore, this recommendation is not part of the major recommendations of the Kothari Commission.

The Kothari Commission recommended the establishment of national bodies for the selection and training of teachers to ensure high standards of teaching across the country. This recommendation aimed to improve the quality of higher education by ensuring that qualified and competent teachers are appointed in universities and colleges.

The Kothari Commission recommended the expansion of higher education to cater to the increasing demand for educational opportunities. It emphasized the need for greater access to education, especially for marginalized and underprivileged sections of society. Therefore, restricting the expansion of higher education was not a major recommendation of the commission.

One of the key recommendations of the Kothari Commission was to grant autonomy to universities to facilitate academic freedom and promote innovation and excellence in higher education. Autonomy allows universities to develop their own curriculum, set academic standards, and make decisions regarding faculty appointments, student admissions, and other administrative matters.

The Kothari Commission did not recommend abolishing the continuous evaluation system. In fact, the commission emphasized the importance of introducing continuous and comprehensive evaluation methods to assess students' progress and learning outcomes effectively. Continuous evaluation was seen as a way to promote holistic development and reduce the emphasis on rote memorization.

Question 44
Match List I with the List IILIST I (Ancient field of study)(a)Siksha(b)Nirukta(c)Kalpa(d)ChhandasLIST II (Meaning)(i)Metre(ii) Phonetics(iii) Etymology(iv) Religious PracticeChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.(a)-(iii), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
  • B.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
  • D.(a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
Correct Answer: (a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)

Option C is correct.

List I consists of ancient fields of study while List II provides their corresponding meanings:

Siksha is the study of phonetics, which deals with the articulation and pronunciation of sounds in speech.

Nirukta is the branch of Vedic studies that deals with etymology, the study of the origin and historical development of words.

Kalpa refers to the ritualistic and procedural aspect of religious practices. It involves the study of rules and regulations for conducting religious ceremonies and rites.

Chhandas is the study of metre in Vedic poetry. It deals with the patterns of syllables and rhythm used in composing verses.

Question 45
Which of the following universities were established in the year 1916?A. Delhi UniversityB. Banaras UniversityC. Mysore UniversityD. S.N.D.T UniversityChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B & C only
  • B.A & D only
  • C.A & C only
  • D.B, C & D only
Correct Answer: B, C & D only

Following are the years of establishment of given universities:

A. Delhi University - 1922

B. Banaras University - 1916

C. Mysore University - 1916

D. S.N.D.T University – 1916

Therefore, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 46
Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps, for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are and what they ought to be. We weep at what exceeds our expectations in serious matters; we laugh at what disappoints our expectations in trifles. We shed tears from sympathy with real and necessary distress; as we burst into laughter from want of sympathy with that which is unreasonable and unnecessary. Tears are the natural and involuntary response of the mind overcome by some sudden and violent emotions. Laughter is the same sort of convulsive and involuntary movement, occasioned by mere surprise or contrast. The serious is the stress which the mind lays upon the expectations of a given order of events and the weight attached to them. When this stress is increased beyond its usual intensity and strains the feelings by the violent opposition of good and bad, it becomes the tragic. The ludicrous is the unexpected relaxing of this stress below its usual intensity, by an abrupt transposition of ideas that takes the mind by surprise and startles it into lively sense of pleasure.According to the passage which of the following is not true in case of tears and laughter? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.They are both involuntary reaction
  • B.They are both the result of violent emotions
  • C.They are both natural emotions
  • D.They are both reaction to experiences of the world
Correct Answer: They are both the result of violent emotions

According to the passage:

Tears are described as "the natural and involuntary response of the mind overcome by some sudden and violent emotions."

Laughter is described as "the same sort of convulsive and involuntary movement, occasioned by mere surprise or contrast."

While tears are associated with "sudden and violent emotions," laughter is associated with "mere surprise or contrast." Therefore, tears are linked to violent emotions, but laughter is not described as resulting from violent emotions in the passage. Thus, option (B) is not true according to the passage.

Question 47
Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps, for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are and what they ought to be. We weep at what exceeds our expectations in serious matters; we laugh at what disappoints our expectations in trifles. We shed tears from sympathy with real and necessary distress; as we burst into laughter from want of sympathy with that which is unreasonable and unnecessary. Tears are the natural and involuntary response of the mind overcome by some sudden and violent emotions. Laughter is the same sort of convulsive and involuntary movement, occasioned by mere surprise or contrast. The serious is the stress which the mind lays upon the expectations of a given order of events and the weight attached to them. When this stress is increased beyond its usual intensity and strains the feelings by the violent opposition of good and bad, it becomes the tragic. The ludicrous is the unexpected relaxing of this stress below its usual intensity, by an abrupt transposition of ideas that takes the mind by surprise and startles it into lively sense of pleasure.The author implies that animals lack the ability to (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Perceive emotional changes in humans
  • B.laugh or weep
  • C.evoke sorrow or laughter in humans
  • D.respond strongly to external stimuli
Correct Answer: laugh or weep

The passage explicitly states, "Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps," suggesting that laughing and weeping are unique to humans and not exhibited by other animals. Therefore, option (B) is the correct answer.

Question 48
Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps, for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are and what they ought to be. We weep at what exceeds our expectations in serious matters; we laugh at what disappoints our expectations in trifles. We shed tears from sympathy with real and necessary distress; as we burst into laughter from want of sympathy with that which is unreasonable and unnecessary. Tears are the natural and involuntary response of the mind overcome by some sudden and violent emotions. Laughter is the same sort of convulsive and involuntary movement, occasioned by mere surprise or contrast. The serious is the stress which the mind lays upon the expectations of a given order of events and the weight attached to them. When this stress is increased beyond its usual intensity and strains the feelings by the violent opposition of good and bad, it becomes the tragic. The ludicrous is the unexpected relaxing of this stress below its usual intensity, by an abrupt transposition of ideas that takes the mind by surprise and startles it into lively sense of pleasure.It can be inferred from the passage that the ludicrous is most nearly opposite to the (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Serious
  • B.Surprise
  • C.Pleasure
  • D.Unexpected
Correct Answer: Serious

In the passage, the author contrasts the serious with the ludicrous, describing the serious as "the stress which the mind lays upon the expectations of a given order of events and the weight attached to them," while the ludicrous is described as "the unexpected relaxing of this stress below its usual intensity." This suggests that the ludicrous is the opposite of the serious, as it involves a relaxation or reduction of the stress and intensity associated with serious matters. Therefore, option (A) is the correct answer.

Question 49
Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps, for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are and what they ought to be. We weep at what exceeds our expectations in serious matters; we laugh at what disappoints our expectations in trifles. We shed tears from sympathy with real and necessary distress; as we burst into laughter from want of sympathy with that which is unreasonable and unnecessary. Tears are the natural and involuntary response of the mind overcome by some sudden and violent emotions. Laughter is the same sort of convulsive and involuntary movement, occasioned by mere surprise or contrast. The serious is the stress which the mind lays upon the expectations of a given order of events and the weight attached to them. When this stress is increased beyond its usual intensity and strains the feelings by the violent opposition of good and bad, it becomes the tragic. The ludicrous is the unexpected relaxing of this stress below its usual intensity, by an abrupt transposition of ideas that takes the mind by surprise and startles it into lively sense of pleasure.The author develops the passage primarily by (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Disproving a theory
  • B.Citing authorities
  • C.Presenting counter example
  • D.Defining terms
Correct Answer: Defining terms

Throughout the passage, the author defines and elaborates on various terms and concepts related to human emotions and reactions, such as laughter, weeping, tears, serious, tragic, and ludicrous. The author provides explanations and descriptions to help readers understand these terms and their distinctions. Therefore, option (D) is the correct answer.

Question 50
Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps, for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are and what they ought to be. We weep at what exceeds our expectations in serious matters; we laugh at what disappoints our expectations in trifles. We shed tears from sympathy with real and necessary distress; as we burst into laughter from want of sympathy with that which is unreasonable and unnecessary. Tears are the natural and involuntary response of the mind overcome by some sudden and violent emotions. Laughter is the same sort of convulsive and involuntary movement, occasioned by mere surprise or contrast. The serious is the stress which the mind lays upon the expectations of a given order of events and the weight attached to them. When this stress is increased beyond its usual intensity and strains the feelings by the violent opposition of good and bad, it becomes the tragic. The ludicrous is the unexpected relaxing of this stress below its usual intensity, by an abrupt transposition of ideas that takes the mind by surprise and startles it into lively sense of pleasure.We shed tears whenA. Something is tragicB. Something is ludicrousC. Something is surprisingD. Seriousness exceeds our expectationsChoose the correct answer form the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.C & D only
  • B.A & B only
  • C.A & D only
  • D.A, B & D only
Correct Answer: A & D only

In the passage, it is stated that "We shed tears from sympathy with real and necessary distress," indicating that tears are shed when something is tragic or when there is real and necessary distress. This aligns with statement A "Something is tragic."

 

Additionally, the passage mentions that tears are shed "at what exceeds our expectations in serious matters," suggesting that tears are shed when seriousness exceeds our expectations. This corresponds to statement D "Seriousness exceeds our expectations."

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (C).

Quiz Attempt #119748

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of children in 5 different villages (V1 to V5) and percentage (%) distribution of children attending school from these 5 villages. Total number of children in all the 5 villages is 5800 and total number of children attending school from these 5 villages is 3600. Based on the data in the table answer the questions that follow.Village wise percentage distribution of children:VillagePercentage Distribution ofNumber of Children (5800)Number of Children Attending School (3600)V116%15%V224%28%V311%14%V418%21%V531%22%Question: What is the total number of children who do not attend school from the village V2 and V3 together? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.528
  • B.508
  • C.518
  • D.628
Correct Answer: 518

Required number = 35% of 5800 – 42% of 3600

= 518

Question 2
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of children in 5 different villages (V1 to V5) and percentage (%) distribution of children attending school from these 5 villages. Total number of children in all the 5 villages is 5800 and total number of children attending school from these 5 villages is 3600. Based on the data in the table answer the questions that follow.Village wise percentage distribution of children:VillagePercentage Distribution ofNumber of Children (5800)Number of Children Attending School (3600)V116%15%V224%28%V311%14%V418%21%V531%22%Question: The number of children attending school from village V1 is approximately what percent of the total number of children from that village.­­­­­­­ (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.58
  • B.60
  • C.53
  • D.54
Correct Answer: 58

Required percentage = 15% of 360016% of 5800 × 100 ≈ 58%

Question 3
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of children in 5 different villages (V1 to V5) and percentage (%) distribution of children attending school from these 5 villages. Total number of children in all the 5 villages is 5800 and total number of children attending school from these 5 villages is 3600. Based on the data in the table answer the questions that follow.Village wise percentage distribution of children:VillagePercentage Distribution ofNumber of Children (5800)Number of Children Attending School (3600)V116%15%V224%28%V311%14%V418%21%V531%22%Question: What is the average number of children who do not attend school from village V2, V3 and V5 together? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.512
  • B.508
  • C.540
  • D.532
Correct Answer: 508

Required average = 24+11+31% of 5800-28+14+22% of 36003

= 3828-23043 = 508

Question 4
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of children in 5 different villages (V1 to V5) and percentage (%) distribution of children attending school from these 5 villages. Total number of children in all the 5 villages is 5800 and total number of children attending school from these 5 villages is 3600. Based on the data in the table answer the questions that follow.Village wise percentage distribution of children:VillagePercentage Distribution ofNumber of Children (5800)Number of Children Attending School (3600)V116%15%V224%28%V311%14%V418%21%V531%22%Question: The total number of children from villages V4 and V5 together is approximately ________ % more than the total number of children who do not attend school from the same two villages. (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.118
  • B.124
  • C.122
  • D.120
Correct Answer: 120

Total number of children from villages V4 and V5 = 49% of 5800 = 2842

Total number of children who do not attend school from V4 and V5 = 2842 – 43% of 3600

= 1294

Required percentage = 2842-12941294 × 100 ≈ 120%

Question 5
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of children in 5 different villages (V1 to V5) and percentage (%) distribution of children attending school from these 5 villages. Total number of children in all the 5 villages is 5800 and total number of children attending school from these 5 villages is 3600. Based on the data in the table answer the questions that follow.Village wise percentage distribution of children:VillagePercentage Distribution ofNumber of Children (5800)Number of Children Attending School (3600)V116%15%V224%28%V311%14%V418%21%V531%22%Question: What is the ratio of the total number of children from village V4 to the number of children attending school from the same village? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.22:21
  • B.29:28
  • C.29:21
  • D.21:23
Correct Answer: 29:21

Require ratio = 18% of 580021% of 3600 = 29 : 21

Question 6
Which of the following are the examples of scaffolding?A. Providing hints and clues to solve a problemB. Allowing the students to figure out the problem on their ownC. Providing the students with all the answers and solutions to a problemD. Asking leading questions to guide the students thinkingChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B & C only
  • B.A & D only
  • C.B & D only
  • D.A, B, C & D only
Correct Answer: A & D only

Scaffolding in education refers to providing support, guidance, and assistance to students as they learn and develop new skills or knowledge. It involves gradually reducing support as students become more capable and independent learners.

 

(i) Providing hints and clues to solve a problem, and (ii), asking leading questions to guide students' thinking, are examples of scaffolding because they provide support and guidance to students as they work through a problem or task.

 

(iii) Allowing students to figure out the problem on their own, is not an example of scaffolding as it involves minimal to no guidance or support from the teacher.

 

(iv) Providing students with all the answers and solutions to a problem, is also not an example of scaffolding as it does not involve guiding students through the learning process or helping them develop their problem-solving skills.

Question 7
Which of the following are the humanistic approaches to learning?A. It emphasizes on self-motivation for better learningB. Its emphasis is on learning at the higher levelC. It fosters curiosityD. It increases learner’s reactivityE. It believes that learning becomes effective when it is need-basedChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A & D only
  • B.B, C & E only
  • C.A, B, C, D and E only
  • D.B & D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D and E only

The term 'humanistic' originates from 'humanism', which has been derived from the Latin word 'Homo' means 'human being'. Thus, literally speaking, humanism is the philosophy in which the human being occupies a central place. The humanistic approach makes use of creativity, belongingness, self-development, co-existence, mental health, values. etc. It is comparatively a new approach to learning.

 

The important characteristics of the humanistic approach are given below:

It is concerned with the welfare of all human beings.

This approach emphasises on learning in natural environment of human love, peace, cooperation, freedom, equality rather than of physical values, money, wealth. etc.

It believes in co-existence.

It considers the best learning as based on truth, good and beautiful.

It believes that learning becomes effective when it is need-based.

Its emphasis is on learning at the higher level i.e., self-transcendence and self-actualization.

Learning is experience-based.

It emphasises on self-motivation for better learning.

It increases the learner's self-direction and independence.

It helps students take more responsibility for determining what they are learning.

It increases learner’s reactivity.

It develops an interest in the arts.

It fosters creativity.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 8
Which of the following is an example of innovative approach to evaluation system? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Non-reference testing
  • B.Peer evaluation
  • C.Standardized testing
  • D.Traditional grading
Correct Answer: Peer evaluation

Peer evaluation is an innovative approach to evaluation that involves students providing feedback and assessing the work of their peers. It promotes collaborative learning, encourages self-reflection, and fosters a deeper understanding of the subject matter. In peer evaluation, students often evaluate each other's projects, presentations, or performances based on predetermined criteria. This approach not only provides valuable feedback to students but also develops their critical thinking and communication skills.

Options (A), (C), and (D) are more traditional methods of evaluation, while option (B) represents a more innovative and student-centered approach.

Question 9
Inswayamprabha, channel no.08 (Physical sciences, Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry and related subjects) is named as? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Vageesh
  • B.saaraswat
  • C.Aryabhatt
  • D.Prabandhan
Correct Answer: Aryabhatt

Swayam Prabha is a project of the Ministry of Human Resources Development that provides 34 Direct to Home (DTH) channels for educational purposes. The channels are accessible 24/7 throughout all of India. On Swayam Prabha, a range of instructional materials are offered. Swayam Prabha's main goal is to deliver high-quality material even in locations without internet access.

Channels 01-10 are managed by CEC, New Delhi and are given below.

Therefore, option (C) is correct.

Question 10
Which of the following ICT tools are associated with mind mapping?A.MindmieisterB. X-mindC. C-mapD. Screencasto-maticChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B & D only
  • B.A, B and C only
  • C.A, C & E only
  • D.D & E only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only

Mind mapping is a visual representation technique used to organize information, ideas, and concepts in a hierarchical structure.

 

Several ICT (Information and Communication Technology) tools are associated with mind mapping:

 

A. Mindmeister

B. X-mind

C. C-map

 

These tools specifically cater to creating mind maps and are commonly used for brainstorming, planning, note-taking, and organizing thoughts.

 

Option D, Screen cast-o-matic, is not associated with mind mapping. It is a screen recording tool used for capturing screen activities and creating screencasts.

 

Therefore, option (B) is the correct answer.

Question 11
Identify the disadvantages of closed ended questions in survey researchA. It is difficult to make forced choice answers exhaustiveB. There is a loss of spontaneity in respondent’s answersC. They are time consuming for interviewers to administrateChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A & B only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.A & C only
  • D.A, B & C only
Correct Answer: A & B only

Option A is correct.

The disadvantages of closed ended questions in survey research are

Closed-ended questions limit respondents to predefined answer choices, which can make it challenging for researchers to anticipate and include all possible responses. This limitation can lead to the omission of important perspectives or options, potentially biasing the results of the survey.

Closed-ended questions restrict respondents to selecting from predefined answer options, which may not fully capture the nuances or complexities of their opinions or experiences. This can result in a loss of spontaneity and depth in respondents' answers, as they are confined to choosing from predetermined categories rather than expressing their thoughts in their own words.

They are time-consuming for interviewers to administrate is not necessarily a disadvantage of closed-ended questions. In fact, closed-ended questions are often designed to be more time-efficient for both respondents and interviewers, as they typically involve selecting from predefined answer choices rather than generating open-ended responses, which can be more time-consuming to analyze.

Question 12
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Review of literature helps the researcher with the interpretation of his/her findingsStatement II: Review of literature is not of any help in learning different theoretical and methodological approaches to your research areasIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is true. A thorough review of existing literature related to the research topic provides researchers with insights, context, and perspectives that aid in the interpretation of their findings. By examining prior studies, theories, and methodologies, researchers can better understand the implications of their own research and place their findings within the broader scholarly discourse.

Statement II is false. Reviewing the literature is crucial for researchers to learn about different theoretical frameworks, methodologies, and approaches used in their research areas. By examining prior studies and scholarly works, researchers can identify and understand various theoretical perspectives and methodological approaches relevant to their research, which in turn informs their own research design and methodology.

Question 13
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Content analysis is an approach to the analysis of documents and texts that seeks to analyze them in qualitative termsStatement II: Content analysis is very transparent research methodIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Option D is correct.

Statement I is false. Content analysis can be conducted using both qualitative and quantitative approaches. While qualitative content analysis focuses on interpreting the content of texts in a descriptive and non-numerical manner, quantitative content analysis involves the systematic counting and categorization of words or phrases to identify patterns and trends within the data. Therefore, content analysis is not exclusively qualitative.

Statement II is true. Content analysis is considered a transparent research method because it allows researchers to clearly document their procedures, coding schemes, and analytical techniques. Transparency in content analysis ensures that the research process is open to scrutiny and replication by other researchers, enhancing the credibility and reliability of the findings.

Question 14
If you want to conclude that a given variable with a second variable you have to be able to rule out other possible casual variables. The principle of causation involved here is (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Casual ambiguity rule
  • B.Temporal precedence rule
  • C.Covariance rule
  • D.Internal validity rule
Correct Answer: Internal validity rule

Option D is correct.

Internal validity refers to the extent to which a study's design and methods allow for accurate conclusions about causal relationships between variables. When trying to establish a causal relationship between a given variable and a second variable, it's essential to ensure internal validity by ruling out alternative explanations for the observed relationship.

The principle where one needs to rule out other possible causal variables to conclude a relationship between two variables, aligns with the concept of internal validity. By controlling for potential confounding variables and ensuring that the observed relationship between the variables of interest is not due to other factors, researchers can establish internal validity and confidently conclude a causal relationship between the variables under investigation.

Question 15
Which of the following diagrams would be useful in depicting the median value in the data? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Bar chart
  • B.Box plot
  • C.Pie chart
  • D.Scatter plot
Correct Answer: Box plot

Option B is correct.

A box plot, also known as a box-and-whisker plot, is a graphical representation of the distribution of a dataset. It displays key statistics such as the median, quartiles, and range of the data. The median value is represented by the line inside the box of the box plot. The box plot provides a clear visual depiction of the central tendency of the data, making it useful for understanding the median value.

Question 16
The audiences of digital media are affected by (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Limited geographical area
  • B.Fragmentation
  • C.Passive messages
  • D.Identity-crises
Correct Answer: Fragmentation

Option B is correct.

Digital media has transformed the landscape of audience engagement in numerous ways. One significant impact is the fragmentation of audiences. With the proliferation of digital platforms and channels, audiences have become fragmented across various platforms, websites, social media networks, apps, etc. This fragmentation means that audience attention is spread across multiple sources of content, making it challenging for content creators and advertisers to reach and engage with their target audience effectively.

Question 17
In films close-ups are termed as (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Pro-active paradigms
  • B.Static paradigms
  • C.Visual paradigms
  • D.Altered paradigms
Correct Answer: Visual paradigms

Option C is correct.

Close-ups in films are a visual technique used to capture the details and emotions of a subject by framing them tightly within the camera shot. They are an essential component of visual storytelling, allowing filmmakers to convey specific emotions, reactions, or details that might not be apparent in wider shots. It can be considered as visual paradigms because they are a fundamental aspect of visual storytelling. They provide viewers with a focused and detailed view of the subject, influencing their perception and emotional engagement with the film.

Question 18
Which of the following are the distinguishable features of Buddhist concept of communication?A.UnindirectionalB. Process-orientedC. CompetitivenessD. Creation of meaningE. Behavior-centeredChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, D only
  • C.C, D, E only
  • D.B, D, E only
Correct Answer: B, D, E only

Each of the given features is analyzed below.

Unidirectional: The Buddhist concept of communication is not unidirectional; instead, it often emphasizes mutual understanding and active engagement between communicators.

 

B. Process-oriented: The Buddhist concept of communication is process-oriented, emphasizing qualities such as mindfulness, compassion, and non-violence in communication.

 

C. Competitiveness: Competitiveness is not associated with the Buddhist concept of communication. Instead, Buddhist communication often emphasizes collaboration, harmony, and mutual respect.

 

D. Creation of meaning: The Buddhist concept of communication does involve the creation of meaning through the interaction between communicators. It emphasizes understanding and insight rather than competition or one-way transmission of information.

 

E. Behavior-centered: The Buddhist concept of communication is behavior-centered, focusing on ethical behavior, mindful speech, and compassionate interactions.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 19
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: The study of mass communication process is characterized by a macroscopic view of messages.Statement II: Semiology seeks a microscopic view of deconstructing messages.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Statement I is true. The study of mass communication process is characterized by a macroscopic view of messages. This statement is generally true. Mass communication typically involves the analysis of messages on a large scale, considering how they are produced, distributed, and received by mass audiences.

Statement II is true. Semiotics, or semiology, does seek to analyze and deconstruct messages at a microscopic level, examining the underlying signs, symbols, and meanings within messages.

Question 20
Given below are two statements:Statement I:The words – communication, community and communion are etymologically relatedStatement II:As human society developed more and more simple systems of communication emerged.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Statement I: The words "communication," "community," and "communion" are indeed etymologically related. They all stem from the Latin word "communis," meaning "common" or "shared." Therefore, Statement I is true.

Statement II: With the advancement of human society, communication systems have become more complex rather than simple. Therefore, Statement II is false.

Question 21
In a certain coding language ‘KANPUR’ is coded as ‘JZMOTQ’. How ‘MUMBAI will be coded in that language?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.LTLAZH
  • B.NVNZBH
  • C.NVNCBH
  • D.LTLZBH
