Question 6
In which method of collaborating e learning the main purpose is to develop listening skills in the students?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.circle of voices
  • B.problem solving
  • C.Fishbowl strategy
  • D.Jigsaw strategy
Correct Answer: Fishbowl strategy

The Fishbowl strategy is a collaborative learning technique that focuses on developing listening skills among students. In this method, students are divided into two groups: the inner circle and the outer circle. The inner circle participates in a discussion or activity while the outer circle observes and listens.

Question 7
Which of the following individual difference(s) may not affect learning?A. Cultural backgroundB. HeightC Blood groupD. AgeE. ComplexionChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, D & E only
  • B.B, C & E only
  • C.B only
  • D.A, C & D only
Correct Answer: B, C & E only

Height, blood group, and complexion are not typically considered significant factors that directly impact learning outcomes.

Therefore, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 8
Which of the following are characteristics of mind-mapping?A. Built around a central topicB. Use of long sentences and paragraphsC. The branches of a particular topic from a connected moduleD. Use of images and symbols to represent ideasChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A only
  • B.B & D only
  • C.A, C & D only
  • D.B & C only
Correct Answer: A, C & D only

Mind-mapping involves the following characteristics:

 

1. Built around a central topic: Mind maps are structured around a central idea, theme, or topic from which various related concepts branch out.

 

2. The branches of a particular topic from a connected module: Mind maps organize information hierarchically, with subtopics branching out from the central topic or main idea. These branches can further extend into sub-subtopics, creating a connected structure.

 

3. Use of images and symbols to represent ideas: Mind maps often incorporate visual elements such as images, symbols, and icons to represent concepts and aid in memory retention and understanding. These visual elements help make connections between ideas and enhance overall comprehension.

 

Option B is incorrect because mind maps do not use long sentences and paragraphs. They emphasize concise keywords or phrases to convey information efficiently. Therefore, option B is not a characteristic of mind-mapping.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 9
Match List I with the List IILIST I (Chance no.)(a) CH-04(b) CH-05(c) CH-06(d) CH-07LIST II (Name)(i) PRABANDHAN(ii) KAUTILYA(iii) SAARASWAT(iv) VIDHIKChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(iii)
  • B.(a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
  • D.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(iii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)

Swayam Prabha is a project of the Ministry of Human Resources Development that provides 34 Direct to Home (DTH) channels for educational purposes. The channels are accessible 24/7 throughout all of India. On Swayam Prabha, a range of instructional materials are offered. Swayam Prabha's main goal is to deliver high-quality material even in locations without internet access.

Channels 01-10 are managed by CEC, New Delhi and are given below.

Therefore, option C is correct.

Question 10
Which of the following is the benefit of using rubrics for evaluation?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Greater ease of grading
  • B.Increased consistency in grading
  • C.Increased subjectivity
  • D.Greater test security
Correct Answer: Increased consistency in grading

Rubrics provide clear criteria and standards for assessment, ensuring that all students are evaluated based on the same expectations. This helps to minimize subjective biases and promotes fairness in grading. Thus, the correct answer is option (B), i.e., increased consistency in grading.

 

Option (A) Greater ease of grading is sometimes true, as rubrics can streamline the grading process by providing structured guidelines for assessment. However, this is not always the case, as creating and using rubrics effectively may require additional time and effort upfront.

 

Option (C) Increased subjectivity is incorrect because the purpose of rubrics is to provide objective criteria for evaluation, thereby reducing subjectivity in grading.

 

Option (D) Greater test security is unrelated to the use of rubrics for evaluation. Rubrics focus on assessment criteria and grading standards rather than test security measures.

Question 11
According to UGC Regulations, 2018 on plagiarism similarity of 42% refers to which of the following?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.0
  • B.1
  • C.2
  • D.3
Correct Answer: 2

The University Grants Commission introduced regulations for the prevention of plagiarism, discussing the “Promotion of Academic Integrity”, as well as “Prevention of Plagiarism in Higher Educational Institutions (HEI)” regulations for 2018.

 

The main motive of UGC behind these regulations is to create awareness regarding the conduct of research, thesis, and dissertation along with the prevention of any kind of misconduct which primarily includes plagiarism.

 

According to these regulations, following are the levels of penalty for plagiarism.

 

LevelsDescription

Level 0Up to 10% similarity- No penalty

Level 1Above 10% to 40 % similarity

Level 2Above 40% to 60 % similarity

Level 3Above 60% similarity

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 12
The questions of whether a measure that is devised for a concept really does reflect the concept that is supposed to be denoting, relates to(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Measurement validity
  • B.Ecological validity
  • C.Internal validity
  • D.External validity
Correct Answer: Measurement validity

Option A is correct.

Measurement validity refers to the extent to which a measure accurately and appropriately assesses the concept or construct it is intended to measure. It addresses the question of whether a measure actually reflects the concept or construct it is supposed to represent.

When we question whether a measure devised for a concept truly reflects that concept, we are essentially questioning its validity. We are concerned with whether the measure is capturing the intended meaning or characteristic of the concept accurately.

Question 13
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R:Assertion A; Surveys conducted over internet have witnessed a huge growth since the late 1990.Reason R: Internet users always constitute an unbiased sample of the populationIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both A and R are correct but R is the correct explanation of A
  • B.Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
  • C.A is correct but R is not correct
  • D.A is not correct but R is correct
Correct Answer: A is correct but R is not correct

Option C is correct.

Assertion A is correct. With the widespread adoption of the internet globally, surveys conducted over the internet have witnessed significant growth since the late 1990s. The internet provides a convenient and cost-effective platform for conducting surveys, reaching a large and diverse audience.

Reason R is not correct. While the internet has become increasingly accessible to a large portion of the population, it is important to recognize that internet users may not always constitute a representative or unbiased sample of the population. Certain demographic groups may be overrepresented or underrepresented among internet users, which can introduce bias into survey results conducted solely over the internet. Additionally, factors such as digital literacy, access to technology, and internet usage patterns can influence the composition of internet users and may not accurately reflect the broader population.

Question 14
Among the following types of sampling techniques, which one is also known as ‘Judgemental’ sampling?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Quota sampling
  • B.Convenience sampling
  • C.Cluster sampling
  • D.Purposive sampling
Correct Answer: Purposive sampling

Option D is correct.

Purposive sampling, also known as judgmental sampling, is a non-probability sampling technique where the researcher deliberately selects specific individuals or cases based on their expertise or judgment about the population being studied. In purposive sampling, the researcher selects participants who are deemed to be most informative or representative of the population for the research objectives. This approach is often used when the researcher has prior knowledge or understanding of the population and aims to select participants who can provide valuable insights or meet specific criteria relevant to the study.

Question 15
Variations in time series data would be best represented by a(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.line chart
  • B.pie chart
  • C.bar chart
  • D.scatter plot
Correct Answer: line chart

Option A is correct.

Time series data represents observations of a variable over successive periods of time. It is used to track changes or variations in the variable over time. In order to effectively visualize variations in time series data, a line chart is typically the most appropriate choice.

A line chart displays data points connected by straight lines, with the x-axis representing time and the y-axis representing the variable being measured. The continuous lines in a line chart make it easy to observe trends, patterns, and fluctuations in the data over time. This makes it particularly suitable for representing variations in time series data, as it allows for a clear visualization of how the variable changes over different time periods.

Question 16
The person studies the symbolic relationship between people and media technologies which they create and use is identified as:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Media influencer
  • B.Media sociologist
  • C.Media anthropologist
  • D.Media ecologist
Correct Answer: Media ecologist

Option D is correct.

Media ecology is a field of study that examines the symbolic relationships between people and media technologies, as well as the impact of media on culture, society, and human behavior. Media ecologists analyze how media technologies shape human perception, communication patterns, and social interactions within different cultural contexts.

Media ecologists explore the interactions between individuals, media technologies, and their environments, considering how these interactions influence human cognition, behavior, and societal structures. They examine the ways in which media technologies mediate human experiences and shape cultural norms and values.

Question 17
A political party broadcast is considered adalan(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.open text
  • B.close text
  • C.Lengthy text
  • D.Liberal text
Correct Answer: close text

Option B is correct.

In the context of broadcast media, such as television or radio, a political party broadcast is considered a close text.

Close text refers to a type of media content that is controlled and scripted by its creators, leaving little room for interpretation or interaction by the audience. In the case of a political party broadcast, the content is carefully crafted by the party's strategists and communication experts to convey specific messages and political narratives. The content is scripted, rehearsed, and tightly controlled to ensure that the party's key messages are delivered effectively to the audience.

Question 18
The Buddhist concept of interpersonal communication emphasizesA. Flexible moralityB. Total isolationC. Sensitive use of languageD. TruthfulnessE. Achievement of consensusChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, D only
  • C.C, D, E only
  • D.A, B, E only
Correct Answer: C, D, E only

In the Buddhist concept of interpersonal communication, following are emphasized:

 

1. Sensitive use of language: Buddhism emphasizes the importance of mindful speech, which involves using language with care and compassion, avoiding harsh or hurtful words, and speaking truthfully and with sincerity.

 

2. Truthfulness: Honesty and truthfulness are fundamental principles in Buddhism. Communicating truthfully is seen as essential for fostering trust, understanding, and ethical conduct in interpersonal relationships.

 

3. Achievement of consensus: Buddhism values harmony and mutual understanding in communication. The aim is often to achieve consensus through respectful dialogue and compassionate listening, rather than imposing one's views or dominating conversations.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 19
Given below are two statements:Statement I: The Hindu view of communication is based on the precept of that reality is undivided.Statement II: According to the ancient Hindu view language is a means to acquire knowledgeIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

 

Statement I is true. In Hindu philosophy, particularly in Vedanta, there is the concept of Advaita (non-duality), which asserts that reality is ultimately undivided or non-dual (advaita). According to this perspective, there is a fundamental unity underlying all of existence, and the apparent diversity in the world is ultimately illusory. This understanding of reality influences various aspects of Hindu thought, including communication, where the aim may be to convey deeper truths or insights that reflect the underlying unity of existence.

 

Statement II is also true. In Hindu philosophy, language (Vak) is considered a powerful tool for acquiring knowledge and understanding the nature of reality. The ancient Indian scriptures, such as the Vedas, Upanishads, and various philosophical texts, emphasize the importance of language in transmitting knowledge, insights, and spiritual teachings. Language is seen as a means to convey profound truths and philosophical concepts, as well as to engage in dialogue and inquiry into the nature of existence.

Question 20
Match List IwithList II.LIST I (Scholar)(a)Bharatha(b)Bharathrahari(c)Bhattnayaka(d) PaniniLIST II (Specialization/Concept)(i) Grammar(ii)Sadharikaran(iii) Rasa theory(iv) Speech theoryChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
  • B.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
  • D.(a)-(iv), (b)-(iv), (c)-(iii), (d)-(ii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)

The correct match is as follows.

(a) Bharatha - Rasa theory

The theory of rasa is attributed to Bharata, a sage-priest who may have lived sometime between the 1st century bce and the 3rd century ce.

 

(b) Bharathrahari - Speech theory

In account of explaining the process of communication, Bhartrhari maintains that a linguistic expression resides in human mind as speech potentials (Shabdabija) which passes through there stages end that are different sorts of speech. They are- Pasyanti, Madhyama and Vaikhari.

 

(c) Bhattnayaka – Sadharikaran

The theory of Sadharanikaran has quite significance in the understanding of the rasa aesthetic. The theory of Sadharanikaran has coined by Bhattanayaka to explain the process of rasa to be experienced by sahardya. Through principle of Sadharanikaran, Bhattanayaka tries to answer two much questioned issue i.e. how can a spectator derives rasa from the sentiment expressed by real character and from those of the actors who imitate the original characters in their form, dress, language and action.

 

(d) Panini – Grammar

Panini was a Sanskrit grammarian who gave a comprehensive and scientific theory of phonetics, phonology, and morphology.

Question 21
A person X can do a piece of work worthRs. 3000 in 6 days; But he engages an assistant Y and complete the work in 4 days. Find the share of the assistant Y in completing the work.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Rs. 800
  • B.Rs. 1000
  • C.Rs. 1500
  • D.Rs. 1200
Correct Answer: Rs. 1000

X can do the work in 6 days, so his efficiency is 16

Now, with the help of Y he finished the work in 4 days.

X’s share = 46 × 3000 = Rs. 2000

Y’s share = 3000 – 2000 = Rs. 1000

Question 22
A family consists of a husband and wife, their 3 daughters and 2 sons and their 2 wives. How many females and males respectively in this family?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.5 and 4
  • B.3 and 4
  • C.4 and 5
  • D.6 and 3
Correct Answer: 6 and 3

Wife, her 3 daughters and 2 daughters in laws ae females. Husband and his two sons are males. So, in total there are 6 females and 3 males in the family.

Question 23
What number would replace question mark (?) in the series given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)1, 6, 14, 40, 108, 296, 808, ?
  • A.2208
  • B.1104
  • C.1212
  • D.1804
Correct Answer: 2208

(1 + 6) × 2 = 14

(40 + 14) × 2 = 108

(108 + 40) × 2 = 296

(296 + 108) × 2 = 808

Similarly

(808 + 296) × 2 = 2208

Question 24
The house of a man is facing towards South. From the front door of the house, the man starts walking and after walking for 20 meters straight, he turns his left and walks for 50 metres. After this the man turns to his right and walks for 80 metres and stops there. Find the distance from the point where the man stops to the front door of his house.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.255m
  • B.505m
  • C.50 m
  • D.100 m
Correct Answer: 505m

Required distance = 1002+502

= 505 m

Question 25
In a certain coding language:(a) ‘ON’ is coded as 210(b) ‘OFF’ is coded as 540How ‘SET’ will be coded in that language?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.1600
  • B.1850
  • C.1700
  • D.1900
Correct Answer: 1900

ON = 15 × 14 = 210

OFF = 15 × 6 × 6 = 540

Similarly,

SET = 19 × 5 × 20 = 1900

Question 26
Which of the following statements are contrary to each other?A. All movies are thrillersB. Some movies are not thrillersC. No movies are thrillersD. Some movies are thrillersChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and C only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.A and D only
  • D.C and D only
Correct Answer: A and C only

Statement A and C are contrary to each other.

Question 27
If the statement “Some trucks are not polluting vehicles” is given as false then which of the following statements can be immediately inferred to be true?A. All trucks are nom-polluting vehiclesB. All trucks are polluting vehiclesC. Some trucks are polluting vehiclesD. All polluting vehicles are trucksChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and C only
  • B.C and D only
  • C.B, C and D only
  • D.B and C only
Correct Answer: B and C only

The given statement is of type ‘O’ and it is false. Therefore, statement of type ‘A’ and type ‘I’ will be true.

Question 28
Which of the following statements is logically equivalent to “All philosophers are realists”?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.No philosopher is non-realist
  • B.No realists are non-philosophers
  • C.No non-philosopher are non-realists
  • D.No non-realists are non-philosophers
Correct Answer: No philosopher is non-realist

Option A is obversion of given statement which is type ‘A’.

Question 29
“I have listened to the parliament speech of the President of the country XYZ once, from that I must conclude that he is a lousy speaker”. Which fallacy is committed in the above statement?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Begging the question
  • B.Hasty Generalization
  • C.Slippery slope
  • D.Ad Hominem
Correct Answer: Hasty Generalization

The fallacy committed in the statement is option (B) - Hasty Generalization.

Hasty Generalization fallacy draws a broad conclusion about someone or something based on an inadequate sample size. The statement judges the president's overall speaking ability ("lousy speaker") based on a single instance of listening to one speech. This is insufficient evidence to form such a general conclusion. The president might be a more effective speaker in other contexts or deliver different types of speeches more effectively.

Question 30
Given below are two statements:Statement I:Nyayasyllogism is only inductive and material.Statement II:The Aristotelian syllogism is only deductive and formal.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

The correct answer is option (D) - Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

 

Statement I: Nyaya syllogism is only inductive and material.

 

False: Nyaya syllogisms can be both deductive and inductive. They can also be formal (structured) and material (focusing on the content of the propositions).

 

Statement II: The Aristotelian syllogism is only deductive and formal.

 

True: Aristotelian syllogisms are a type of deductive and formal logic. They aim to draw guaranteed conclusions based on true premises and follow a specific structure with three propositions (major premise, minor premise, and conclusion).

 

Nyaya logic offers more flexibility in syllogisms compared to Aristotelian logic. It allows for arguments based on observation (induction) and considers the content of the propositions (material) in addition to the form.

Question 31
Which of the following is a benefit that businesses receive from using the internet?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Easier use of satellite radio
  • B.Faster connection with suppliers
  • C.Improved methods of manufacturing
  • D.The ability to call employees on the road
Correct Answer: Faster connection with suppliers

Option B is correct.

While the internet can facilitate access to various forms of media, such as radio streaming, the use of satellite radio specifically is not a direct benefit that businesses typically receive from using the internet.

Faster connection with suppliers is a significant benefit that businesses receive from using the internet. The internet enables businesses to communicate with suppliers quickly and efficiently, facilitating faster procurement processes, order placements, inventory management, and collaboration on product development. This can lead to improved supply chain management, reduced lead times, and increased responsiveness to market demands.

While the internet can facilitate communication and collaboration in manufacturing processes, the direct improvement of manufacturing methods is not inherently a benefit of using the internet. However, the internet can enable access to resources, information, and technologies that may contribute to improvements in manufacturing methods indirectly.

While the internet enables various forms of communication, such as VoIP (Voice over Internet Protocol) calling, the ability to call employees on the road specifically is not a primary benefit of using the internet. However, internet-based communication tools can facilitate remote communication with employees, including those who are traveling or working remotely.

Question 32
Consider the equation L+ M = N. Where L =(100011)2and N =(101000)2Whatis the value of Mas represented in decimal format?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.40
  • B.35
  • C.10
  • D.5
Correct Answer: 5

(100011)2 = 35

(101000)2 = 30

M = N – L

= 35- 30 = 5

Question 33
A web page offers a link for users to repeat another web page. The requested web page contains HTML code and JavaScript code. In the context identify the correct sequence of the following statements A-EA. The requested web page is displayed on the client computerB. The user clicks on the hyperlink and the web page is requested from the web serverC. The requested web page content is transmitted to the client computerD. The client computer processes the JavaScript code using the web browser softwareE. The web server locates the requested web pageChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, E, C, A, D
  • B.B, E, D, C, A
  • C.E, B, C, D, A
  • D.B, E, C, D, A
Correct Answer: B, E, C, D, A

Option D is correct.

The user clicks on the hyperlink: When the user clicks on the hyperlink to repeat another web page, it initiates a request for the web page from the web server.

The web server locates the requested web page: Upon receiving the request, the web server locates the requested web page within its file system or database.

The requested web page content is transmitted to the client computer: Once the web server locates the requested web page, it sends the content of that web page back to the client computer over the internet.

The client computer processes the JavaScript code using the web browser software: Upon receiving the content of the requested web page, the client computer processes the HTML and JavaScript code embedded within the page using the web browser software.

The requested web page is displayed on the client computer: After processing the HTML and JavaScript code, the web browser renders the web page and displays it to the user on the client computer's screen.

Question 34
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Shareware is limited-functioning freeware, and normally expires after a week or month.Statement II: Shareware code can be modified and redistributedIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is true. Shareware refers to software that is distributed for free, often with limited functionality or features. Users are typically allowed to use the software for a trial period, which could be a week or a month, after which they are required to purchase a license to continue using it. Shareware often includes trial versions or demos of commercial software products.

Statement II is false. Shareware typically comes with certain usage restrictions, and the source code is not always provided to users. While users may be able to redistribute the software in its original form according to the terms of the license agreement, modifying the code and redistributing it is not a common feature of shareware. Shareware licenses often restrict modification and redistribution rights to protect the interests of the software developers.

Question 35
Which of the following should always be regarded as security risks to computer systems?A. Chat roomsB. CookiesC. PharmingD. VirusE. VoIPChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and D only
  • B.C and D only
  • C.B and D only
  • D.A, D and E only
Correct Answer: C and D only

Option B is correct.

Pharming is a cyber attack aimed at redirecting website traffic to a fraudulent website, often through manipulation of DNS (Domain Name System) settings or poisoning. Pharming can lead to users unknowingly visiting malicious websites, where they may be exposed to phishing scams, malware downloads, or theft of sensitive information. Therefore, pharming is a significant security risk to computer systems.

Viruses are malicious software programs designed to infect computer systems and spread to other computers. They can cause various forms of damage, such as data corruption, system instability, and unauthorized access to sensitive information. Viruses are one of the most common and well-known security risks to computer systems, as they can spread rapidly and cause significant harm to both individual users and organizations.

Question 36
When a water body gets enriched with nutrients, the process is called(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Oligotropjication
  • B.Eutrophication
  • C.Mesotrophication
  • D.Dystrophication
Correct Answer: Eutrophication

Option B is correct.

Eutrophication is the process by which a water body becomes enriched with excess nutrients, particularly nitrogen and phosphorus. These nutrients can come from various sources, including agricultural runoff, sewage discharge, and runoff from urban areas. When these nutrients enter a water body, they stimulate the growth of algae and aquatic plants, leading to an overgrowth of vegetation.

Question 37
Which of the following statements are correct in respect of Green House Gases?A. They are generally of light green colourB. They absorb thermal radiations emitted by earthC. Watervaporis agreen housegasD. Green House Gases cause global warmingE. Ammonia(NH3)isagreen housegasChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C, D only
  • B.A, C, E only
  • C.B, C, D only
  • D.A, B, D, E only
Correct Answer: B, C, D only

Option C is correct.

Greenhouse gases do not have a specific color. They are gases present in the Earth's atmosphere, and their colors are not visible to the naked eye. Therefore, option A is incorrect.

Greenhouse gases, such as carbon dioxide (CO2), methane (CH4), and water vapor (H2O), absorb and trap heat energy radiated from the Earth's surface. This process, known as the greenhouse effect, is essential for maintaining Earth's temperature within a habitable range.

Water vapor is a greenhouse gas. It is the most abundant greenhouse gas in the Earth's atmosphere and plays a significant role in the Earth's climate system. Although its concentration varies spatially and temporally, water vapor contributes to the greenhouse effect by absorbing and emitting infrared radiation.

Greenhouse gases are responsible for trapping heat energy in the Earth's atmosphere, leading to an increase in global temperatures. This phenomenon, known as global warming, is primarily driven by human activities such as the burning of fossil fuels, deforestation, and industrial processes, which release greenhouse gases into the atmosphere at an accelerated rate.

While ammonia (NH3) is a gas, it is not considered a significant greenhouse gas in the Earth's atmosphere. Although it can absorb and emit infrared radiation, its concentration in the atmosphere is relatively low compared to other greenhouse gases such as carbon dioxide, methane, and water vapor.

Question 38
Which of the following air pollutants help in the formation of photochemical smog?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Carbon monoxide
  • B.Methane
  • C.Oxides of sulphur
  • D.Oxides of nitrogen
Correct Answer: Oxides of nitrogen

Photochemical smog is a type of air pollution formed by a series of chemical reactions triggered by sunlight. Here's what contributes:

Sunlight: Ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun provides the energy for these reactions.

Nitrogen Oxides (NOx): These are primary pollutants released from vehicle exhaust and industrial processes. They act as key players in the chemical reactions that create photochemical smog

Question 39
Through enrichment process, concentration of which uranium isotope is increased in the natural uranium?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.U-234
  • B.U-235
  • C.U-238
  • D.U-239
Correct Answer: U-235

Option B is correct.

Enrichment is the process of increasing the concentration of a particular isotope in a substance. In the context of uranium enrichment, it involves increasing the proportion of Uranium-235 (U-235) compared to the more abundant Uranium-238 (U-238) in natural uranium.

Natural uranium consists of approximately 0.7% Uranium-235 and 99.3% Uranium-238. However, for certain applications such as nuclear power generation or nuclear weapons production, higher concentrations of Uranium-235 are required.

During the enrichment process, various methods are employed to separate Uranium-235 from Uranium-238. These methods exploit the slight difference in atomic mass between the two isotopes. One common enrichment method is centrifuge enrichment, where centrifugal forces are used to separate the isotopes based on their mass difference.

By enriching natural uranium, the concentration of Uranium-235 is increased to the desired level, making it suitable for specific applications such as nuclear fuel for reactors or weapons-grade material for nuclear weapons.

Question 40
Three R’s used in the mitigation of solid wastes are:A. RecoverB. ReduceC. ReuseD. RestrictE. RecycleChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, D only
  • C.B, C, E only
  • D.C, D, E only
Correct Answer: B, C, E only

Option C is correct.

The three R's used principles in waste management and environmental conservation are:

Reduce involves minimizing the generation of waste in the first place. It focuses on reducing the amount of waste produced by consuming less, using products with minimal packaging, and adopting practices that generate less waste overall.

Reuse emphasizes finding ways to use items again instead of discarding them after a single use. It involves finding new purposes or extending the lifespan of products by repairing, refurbishing, or donating them for reuse by others.

Recycling involves collecting materials that would otherwise be considered waste and processing them to create new products. It aims to recover valuable resources from waste materials, such as paper, glass, plastic, and metals, by converting them into raw materials for manufacturing new products.

Question 41
Which was the first education commission of Independent India?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Sargent commission
  • B.Kothari commission
  • C.Radhakrishnancommission
  • D.Mudaliarcommission
Correct Answer: Radhakrishnancommission

Radhakrishnan Commission is the first education Commission of Independent India.

Question 42
The National Education policy document of 1986 revised in 1992 suggested:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Use of multimedia for distance education
  • B.Linking degrees with jobs
  • C.Abolition of AICTE
  • D.Focus on research only for degrees
Correct Answer: Use of multimedia for distance education

Option A is correct.

The National Education Policy (NEP) document of 1986, which was revised in 1992, introduced several significant reforms in the education system of India. One of the key suggestions made in the revised NEP was the utilization of multimedia for distance education.

This recommendation aimed to leverage advancements in technology to enhance the quality and reach of education, particularly in remote areas where traditional educational infrastructure might be lacking. By incorporating multimedia elements such as video lectures, interactive tutorials, and online resources, distance education programs could become more engaging and effective for learners.

While the NEP of 1986/1992 did propose various other reforms aimed at improving the education system in India, such as promoting job-oriented education and focusing on research.

Question 43
The committeeforethe evolution of the new education policy recommended that no university in India should have more than_____ affiliated colleges?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.50
  • B.60
  • C.75
  • D.100
Correct Answer: 100

Option D is correct.

The Committee for the Evolution of the New Education Policy, also known as the T.S.R. Subramanian Committee, was appointed to draft the New Education Policy (NEP) for India. One of the recommendations made by the committee was regarding the limitation on the number of affiliated colleges to universities.

The committee recommended that no university in India should have more than 100 affiliated colleges. This recommendation aimed to address issues related to the quality of education, administrative efficiency, and academic supervision. Limiting the number of affiliated colleges would allow universities to focus on providing better academic support, infrastructure, and resources to the colleges under their purview.

Question 44
Which of the following universities have their location in Bihar?A.VallabhiB.VikramshitaC.ShridhanyakatakD.OdantapuriChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and D only
  • B.B and D only
  • C.A and B only
  • D.B and C only
Correct Answer: B and D only

Option B is correct.

Vallabhi was an ancient city in Gujarat, India. It was renowned as a center of learning and had a famous university during the Gupta period. However, it is not located in Bihar.

Vikramshila University was an ancient center of learning located in present-day Bhagalpur district in Bihar, India. It was established by King Dharmapala of the Pala dynasty in the late 8th or early 9th century CE. Vikramshila was one of the two most important centers of Buddhist learning in India, the other being Nalanda.

There is no historical or well-known university by the name of Shridhanya Katak. This appears to be a fictional or unrecognized institution.

Odantapuri was an ancient Buddhist monastery and center of learning located in present-day Bihar, India. It was established by the Pala dynasty king Gopala in the 8th century CE. Odantapuri was one of the major centers of Buddhist learning in India, along with Nalanda and Vikramshila.

Question 45
Which of the following universities were established in the year 1857?A. Calcutta UniversityB. Bombay UniversityC. Madras UniversityD. Allahabad UniversityChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B and D only
  • B.A, B and C only
  • C.B, C and D only
  • D.A, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only

Option B is correct.

Calcutta University was established on January 24, 1857, the University of Calcutta is one of the oldest universities in India and the first institution in South Asia to be established as a multidisciplinary and secular Western-style university. Thus, option A is correct.

Bombay University founded on July 18, 1857, the University of Bombay (now Mumbai) is another historic university in India. It was established through a government resolution and was modelled after the University of London. Hence, option B is correct.

Madras University was established on September 5, 1857, the University of Madras is one of the oldest and premier universities in India. It was established as a result of a systematic educational policy implemented by the British in India. Thus, option C is correct.

Allahabad University was established on September 23, 1887, and not in 1857. It was founded on the principle of imparting higher education to students from all sections of society, irrespective of their caste or creed.

Question 46
Few of Man’s activities have zero environmental effect. For centuries, societies have suffered a wide variety of environmental damage, not least in terms of the air pollution that primitive, uncontrolled methods of combustion caused. People of Roman Britain, with fires in their huts, found the smoke a hazard to health and examination of human skulls shows a pitting that indicates a high frequency of sinusitis. The UK was the first country to widely experience massive industrial development based on coal. Between 1580 and 1680, imports of coal to London increased from 20 000 tonnes a year to 360 000 tonnes and London became a city of ‘great stinking fogs’. These were only really to disappear some years after the episode in December 1952 when cold temperatures and moist air resulted in the condensation of moisture on particles in the air from coal combustion. Over a radius of 20 miles the resulting fog rendered the atmosphere opaque and it was found that in the week ending 13 December 1952 there had been an excess of 2851over the usual weekly number of deaths. In response, the Clean Air Acts of 1956 and 1968 dealt mainly with smoke in cities. Two decades after the smog disaster the Control of Pollution Act (1974) was brought in and systematically began the long haul towards comprehensive improvement sin air quality aspartof overall environmental protection. Similar experiences were encountered across Europe and North America during the 20th century.Question: London became a city of ‘great stinking fogs’ as a result of:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Household fires
  • B.Cold Temperatures
  • C.Coal Combustion
  • D.Exclusive moisture in the air
Correct Answer: Coal Combustion

London became a city of 'great stinking fogs' primarily due to coal combustion. The massive industrial development in the UK heavily relied on coal as a source of energy. Between 1580 and 1680, the imports of coal to London increased significantly, leading to widespread use of coal for heating and industrial purposes. The combustion of coal released large quantities of smoke and pollutants into the air, contributing to the formation of dense fog and smog. This pollution, combined with cold temperatures and moist air, resulted in the notorious "great stinking fogs" that enveloped the city. These fogs not only caused poor visibility but also had severe health consequences, as evidenced by the excess deaths recorded during the smog episode in December 1952.

Question 47
Few of Man’s activities have zero environmental effect. For centuries, societies have suffered a wide variety of environmental damage, not least in terms of the air pollution that primitive, uncontrolled methods of combustion caused. People of Roman Britain, with fires in their huts, found the smoke a hazard to health and examination of human skulls shows a pitting that indicates a high frequency of sinusitis. The UK was the first country to widely experience massive industrial development based on coal. Between 1580 and 1680, imports of coal to London increased from 20 000 tonnes a year to 360 000 tonnes and London became a city of ‘great stinking fogs’. These were only really to disappear some years after the episode in December 1952 when cold temperatures and moist air resulted in the condensation of moisture on particles in the air from coal combustion. Over a radius of 20 miles the resulting fog rendered the atmosphere opaque and it was found that in the week ending 13 December 1952 there had been an excess of 2851over the usual weekly number of deaths. In response, the Clean Air Acts of 1956 and 1968 dealt mainly with smoke in cities. Two decades after the smog disaster the Control of Pollution Act (1974) was brought in and systematically began the long haul towards comprehensive improvement sin air quality aspartof overall environmental protection. Similar experiences were encountered across Europe and North America during the 20th century.Question: Between 1580 and 1680 imports of coal to London increased(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Marginally
  • B.Insignificantly
  • C.Negligibly
  • D.Substantially
Correct Answer: Substantially

Between 1580 and 1680, imports of coal to London increased significantly, as noted in the passage. Specifically, the passage states that imports of coal to London increased from 20,000 tonnes a year to 360,000 tonnes during this period.

Question 48
Few of Man’s activities have zero environmental effect. For centuries, societies have suffered a wide variety of environmental damage, not least in terms of the air pollution that primitive, uncontrolled methods of combustion caused. People of Roman Britain, with fires in their huts, found the smoke a hazard to health and examination of human skulls shows a pitting that indicates a high frequency of sinusitis. The UK was the first country to widely experience massive industrial development based on coal. Between 1580 and 1680, imports of coal to London increased from 20 000 tonnes a year to 360 000 tonnes and London became a city of ‘great stinking fogs’. These were only really to disappear some years after the episode in December 1952 when cold temperatures and moist air resulted in the condensation of moisture on particles in the air from coal combustion. Over a radius of 20 miles the resulting fog rendered the atmosphere opaque and it was found that in the week ending 13 December 1952 there had been an excess of 2851over the usual weekly number of deaths. In response, the Clean Air Acts of 1956 and 1968 dealt mainly with smoke in cities. Two decades after the smog disaster the Control of Pollution Act (1974) was brought in and systematically began the long haul towards comprehensive improvement sin air quality aspartof overall environmental protection. Similar experiences were encountered across Europe and North America during the 20th century.Question: The fog of London in the second week of December 1952A. Reduced the number of deathsB. Increased the number of deathsC. Rendered the atmosphere over a radius of 20 miles smoke freeD. Rendered the atmosphere over a radius of 20 miles opaqueE. Did not make any difference to the air quality or to the number of deaths.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, C and D only
  • B.B and D only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.D and E only
Correct Answer: B and D only

The fog of London in the second week of December 1952 increased the number of deaths and rendered the atmosphere over a radius of 20 miles opaque. This is stated in the passage, which mentions that there was an excess of 2851 deaths over the usual weekly number during that period due to the fog, and it rendered the atmosphere opaque over a radius of 20 miles.

Question 49
Few of Man’s activities have zero environmental effect. For centuries, societies have suffered a wide variety of environmental damage, not least in terms of the air pollution that primitive, uncontrolled methods of combustion caused. People of Roman Britain, with fires in their huts, found the smoke a hazard to health and examination of human skulls shows a pitting that indicates a high frequency of sinusitis. The UK was the first country to widely experience massive industrial development based on coal. Between 1580 and 1680, imports of coal to London increased from 20 000 tonnes a year to 360 000 tonnes and London became a city of ‘great stinking fogs’. These were only really to disappear some years after the episode in December 1952 when cold temperatures and moist air resulted in the condensation of moisture on particles in the air from coal combustion. Over a radius of 20 miles the resulting fog rendered the atmosphere opaque and it was found that in the week ending 13 December 1952 there had been an excess of 2851 over the usual weekly number of deaths. In response, the Clean Air Acts of 1956 and 1968 dealt mainly with smoke in cities. Two decades after the smog disaster the Control of Pollution Act (1974) was brought in and systematically began the long haul towards comprehensive improvement sin air quality aspartof overall environmental protection. Similar experiences were encountered across Europe and North America during the 20th century.Question: The control of Pollution ActA. was brought in almost 20 years after the Clean Air Act of 1956B. Stopped all industrial activityC. Aimed at improving air qualityD. Focused mainly on dealing with smoke in citiesE. Focused on environmental protectionChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and E only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.A, C and E only
  • D.A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and E only

The Control of Pollution Act (1974) was brought in almost 20 years after the Clean Air Act of 1956, as stated in the passage. It aimed at improving air quality, which aligns with its purpose as mentioned in the passage. Additionally, it focused on environmental protection, which is implicit in its goal of improving air quality and ensuring overall environmental well-being. Therefore, options A, C, and E are correct.

Question 50
Few of Man’s activities have zero environmental effect. For centuries, societies have suffered a wide variety of environmental damage, not least in terms of the air pollution that primitive, uncontrolled methods of combustion caused. People of Roman Britain, with fires in their huts, found the smoke a hazard to health and examination of human skulls shows a pitting that indicates a high frequency of sinusitis. The UK was the first country to widely experience massive industrial development based on coal. Between 1580 and 1680, imports of coal to London increased from 20 000 tonnes a year to 360 000 tonnes and London became a city of ‘great stinking fogs’. These were only really to disappear some years after the episode in December 1952 when cold temperatures and moist air resulted in the condensation of moisture on particles in the air from coal combustion. Over a radius of 20 miles the resulting fog rendered the atmosphere opaque and it was found that in the week ending 13 December 1952 there had been an excess of 2851over the usual weekly number of deaths. In response, the Clean Air Acts of 1956 and 1968 dealt mainly with smoke in cities. Two decades after the smog disaster the Control of Pollution Act (1974) was brought in and systematically began the long haul towards comprehensive improvement sin air quality aspartof overall environmental protection. Similar experiences were encountered across Europe and North America during the 20th century.Question: The passage highlights mainly:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023
  • A.the association between vehicular pollution and development
  • B.air pollution and human health
  • C.the industrial development of UK
  • D.the similarities in development of UK, Europe and North America
Correct Answer: air pollution and human health

The passage primarily discusses the environmental damage caused by air pollution, particularly due to primitive methods of combustion and industrial development based on coal. Therefore, option (B) air pollution and human health best summarizes the main focus of the passage.

Quiz Attempt #119751

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the income, expenditure and profit percentage of a company for six years from 2017 to 2022. Income and expenditure figures are inRs. million and the percentage increase in profit percent in year 2022 in comparison to previous year is 3313%. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Year-wise details of income, expenditure and profit percentage of a companyYearIncome (inRs. million)expenditure (inRs. million)Profit (%)2017103.824-12%2018-83.825%201995.7684-2020113.28-20%2021133.1110-2022121.6--Note: Some values are missing in the table (marked as ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if required.Question: Expenditure of the company in 2022 is (inRs. million)(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023
  • A.94
  • B.95
  • C.99
  • D.81

Question 2
The following table shows the income, expenditure and profit percentage of a company for six years from 2017 to 2022. Income and expenditure figures are inRs. million and the percentage increase in profit percent in year 2022 in comparison to previous year is 3313%. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Year-wise details of income, expenditure and profit percentage of a companyYearIncome (inRs. million)expenditure (inRs. million)Profit (%)2017103.824-12%2018-83.825%201995.7684-2020113.28-20%2021133.1110-2022121.6--Note: Some values are missing in the table (marked as ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if required.Question: Expenditure in 2020 is _________ % more than the expenditure in 2017. Question 3
The following table shows the income, expenditure and profit percentage of a company for six years from 2017 to 2022. Question 4
The following table shows the income, expenditure and profit percentage of a company for six years from 2017 to 2022. Income and expenditure figures are inRs. million and the percentage increase in profit percent in year 2022 in comparison to previous year is 3313%. Question 5
The following table shows the income, expenditure and profit percentage of a company for six years from 2017 to 2022. Income and expenditure figures are inRs. million and the percentage increase in profit percent in year 2022 in comparison to previous year is 3313%. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Year-wise details of income, expenditure and profit percentage of a companyYearIncome (inRs. million)expenditure (inRs. million)Profit (%)2017103.824-12%2018-83.825%201995.7684-2020113.28-20%2021133.1110-2022121.6--Note: Some values are missing in the table (marked as ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if required.Question: If the expenditure was increased by 20% in the year 2017 in comparison to the year 2016 and profit percentage in 2016 was 25% less than the profit percentage in 2017, then what is the income of the company in 2016?
