Buddhist communication theory often emphasizes mindfulness, compassion, and skillful means in interpersonal interactions, which can be nuanced and multifaceted.

Statement II is true. In Buddhist philosophy, communication is viewed as a social and moral act with significant ethical implications. Communication is seen as a means of cultivating positive relationships, fostering understanding, and promoting harmony within society. Buddhists emphasize the importance of right speech (samma vaca) as part of the Noble Eightfold Path, which involves refraining from harmful speech and cultivating speech that is truthful, kind, and beneficial.

Question 20
Match List I with the List IILIST I (Non-verbal communication)(a)Oculesics(b) Mimics(c)Pantomimics(d) GestureLIST II (Description)(i) Movement and position of the whole body to tell a story(ii) Movement of arms and hands only to tell something(iii) Eye movement(iv) Movement of face only to irritate someoneChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-IV,D-III
  • B.A-III, B-IV, C-I,D-II
  • C.A-II, B-III, C-IV,D-I
  • D.A-IV, B-I, C-II,D-III
Correct Answer: A-III, B-IV, C-I,D-II

Option B is correct.

Oculesics refers to the study of eye movement and its role in communication. It involves the interpretation of eye contact, gaze patterns, blinking, and other eye movements as non-verbal cues.

Mimics refers to facial expressions or movements of the face used to convey emotions, attitudes, or messages. This includes movements such as smiling, frowning, raising eyebrows, etc.

Pantomimics involves using body movements and gestures to convey meaning or tell a story without using words. It often involves exaggerated or theatrical movements to represent actions or emotions.

Gesture refers to the movement of hands, arms, or other parts of the body to convey meaning or express ideas. Gestures can include hand movements, pointing, waving, etc.

Question 21
Find the correct sequence of five (5) missing letters which will complete the following test series:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)d cc_ b a _ad _ ccb a _a
  • A.b a c b
  • B.c a c a
  • C.c b c b
  • D.c a c a
Correct Answer: c a c a

The series will be d c c c b a a a d c c c b a a a.

Question 22
If ‘TABLE’ is coded as ‘45’ in a certain coding scheme how the word ‘CHAIR’ will be coded?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.44
  • B.43
  • C.42
  • D.40
Correct Answer: 44

TABLE = 20 + 1 + 2 + 12 + 5 + (5) = 45

Similarly,

CHAIR = 3 + 8 + 1 + 9 + 18 + (5) = 44

Question 23
Two numbers are such that their product is equal to 21 and the sum of their square is 58. Find the difference between the two numbers.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.4
  • B.5
  • C.6
  • D.8
Correct Answer: 4

Let two numbers be a and b

ab = 21 ---------(i)

and a2 + b2 = 58 -------(ii)

Solving (i) and (ii), we get

a – b = 4

Question 24
A man purchased some oranges at 4 oranges forRs. 7 and sold them at 7 oranges forRs. 13. Thus, he gainsRs. 30 in all. The number of oranges he bought is:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.252
  • B.280
  • C.308
  • D.336
Correct Answer: 280

CP = 74

SP = 137

Profit = 137 - 74 = 328

Number of oranges bought = 30×283 = 280

Question 25
A train leaves station P at 6 AM and reaches station Q at 10 AM. At the same time (at 6 AM) another train leaves station Q and reach station P at 9.30 AM. The two trains cross each other at:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.8 AM
  • B.8.12 AM
  • C.7.40 AM
  • D.7.52 AM
Correct Answer: 7.52 AM

Let d be the distance between the stations P and Q.

Then, speed of 1st train = d4

Speed of 2nd train = d3.5

Let both the trains will me after t hrs.

As both the trains are running in opposite directions,

T = dd4+d3.5 = 1 hr 52 mins

Thus, the trains will meet at 7.52 AM

Question 26
Arrange the following group of items in order of decreasing extension.A. MammalB. AnimalC. TigerD. FelineChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, A, C, D
  • B.A, B, D, C
  • C.C, D, A, B
  • D.B, A, D, C
Correct Answer: B, A, D, C

Option D is correct.

To arrange the items in order of decreasing extension, we need to consider their hierarchical relationship and the breadth of their categories.

Animal is the broadest category as it encompasses all living organisms classified under the kingdom Animalia. It has the highest extension.

Mammals are a subclass of animals characterized by specific traits such as giving birth to live young, having mammary glands, and being warm-blooded. While more specific than "animal," mammals still encompass a wide range of species.

Felines are a family of mammals belonging to the order Carnivora. They include cats, lions, tigers, etc. The extension of this category is narrower than that of mammals.

Tigers are a species of feline. This category has the narrowest extension as it refers to a specific type of animal within the feline family.

Question 27
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A, and the other is labelled as Reason RAssertion ‘A’:Deductive arguments are either invalid or valid.Reason ‘R’:A valid deductive argument that has all true premises is called a “sound” argument.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
  • B.Both A and R are correct and R is NOT the correct explanation of A
  • C.A is correct but R is not correct
  • D.A is not correct but R is correct
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is NOT the correct explanation of A

Option B is correct answer. Both A and R are correct and R is NOT the correct explanation of A.

Question 28
“Switzerland is 48% protestant. HeidiGilsingis aswiss. Therefore, HeidiGilsingis 48% protestant”. Which fallacy is committed in this argument?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Hasty Generalisation
  • B.Fallacy of composition
  • C.Ad Hominem
  • D.Begging the question
Correct Answer: Fallacy of composition

The fallacy committed in this argument is option (B) - Fallacy of composition.

Fallacy of composition assumes that a property of a whole group applies to each individual member of the group. The argument wrongly assumes that because 48% of the Swiss population is Protestant, every individual Swiss person must be 48% Protestant. This is a clear case of applying a group characteristic (religious distribution) to a single member. Religious affiliation is an individual choice, and Heidi Gilsing's religion could be anything, not necessarily reflecting the national statistics.

Question 29
Identify the formal fallacy committed in the following argument. ”All household pets are domestic animals. Therefore some unicorns are not household pets”.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Existential fallacy
  • B.Denying the antecedent
  • C.Affirming the consequent
  • D.Drawing affirmative conclusion from negative premises
Correct Answer: Existential fallacy

Existential fallacy occurs when an argument with universal premises (all/none) reaches a particular conclusion (some/exists).

Question 30
Given below are two statements:Statement I:According to classical Indian School of logic (Nyaya), all fallacies are material fallacies.Statement II:Nyayasyllogism is deductive-inductive but not formal material.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Only Statement II is incorrect. The Nyäya syllogism is deductive-inductive and formal-material.

Question 31
Which of the following statements is correct about Internet of Things (IOT) that can create a smart environment by having an interconnected network of hardware devices, sensors, connectivity and required software?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Every IOT device or item must be connected using UTP cables
  • B.IOT environments cannot be monitored and controlled remotely
  • C.The Internet connectivity is not essential for an IOT setup to function
  • D.Modern smart mobile phones cannot be connected to an IOT setup
Correct Answer: The Internet connectivity is not essential for an IOT setup to function

Option C is correct.

The Internet connectivity is not essential for an IoT setup to function. This statement is true. While many IoT setups do utilize internet connectivity for communication and remote access, it is not an absolute requirement for all IoT devices. Some IoT devices may operate within a local network environment without needing internet access. Additionally, certain IoT applications may function entirely offline, relying solely on local communication between devices.

Question 32
Identify the correct sequence of the following computer storage components A-D in the descending order of their access speed (from fastest to slowest)A. Cache memoryB. Main memoryC. Magnetic diskD. CPU RegistersChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.C, B, A, D
  • C.C, B, D, A
  • D.D, A, B, C
Correct Answer: D, A, B, C

Option D is correct.

The sequence of computer storage components in descending order of access speed (from fastest to slowest) is as follows:

CPU registers are the fastest type of computer storage. They are small, high-speed storage locations within the CPU itself. Registers are used to store data that is being actively processed by the CPU. Accessing data from registers is extremely fast, measured in nanoseconds.

Cache memory is the next fastest storage component after CPU registers. It is a small amount of high-speed memory located directly on or very close to the CPU. Cache memory is used to temporarily store frequently accessed data and instructions to speed up processing. Accessing data from cache memory is faster than accessing data from main memory but slower than accessing data from CPU registers.

Main memory, or RAM (Random Access Memory), is the primary memory used by the computer to store data and instructions that are actively being used or processed by the CPU. While main memory is faster than secondary storage devices like magnetic disks, it is slower than cache memory and CPU registers.

Magnetic disks, such as hard disk drives (HDDs) and solid-state drives (SSDs), are slower storage devices used for long-term storage of data. Accessing data from magnetic disks is significantly slower than accessing data from main memory, cache memory, or CPU registers.

Question 33
In the following MS EXCEL spreadsheet you are given a list 100 customers. Column ‘A’ represents their names. ‘B’ is for customer category (0 means discounted price and 1 means full price), ‘D’ indicates price that customer pay. The example spreadsheet below is not the complete list and simply shown different categories.ABCD1Customer nameCustomer categoryPayment categoryPrice (Rs.)2RamanChild003DineshAdult154JashanAdult02:::::101AmitChild00Statement I: The formula= COUNTIFS (C2:C101, “0”) counts all customers who get discounted price.Statement II: The formula = COUNTIF (C2:C101, =”0”) counts all customers who get discountedprice.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Both the statements are true.

Question 34
Which of the following memory/storage devices are considered as offline storage?A. Hard disk drive (HDD)B. Blu-ray/diskC. DVD/CDD. USB memory stickChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.A, C and D only
  • C.B, C and D only
  • D.A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: B, C and D only

Option C is correct.

Offline storage refers to storage devices or media that are not directly accessible by the computer's CPU and require manual intervention to access data.

Blu-ray discs are considered offline storage devices. They are optical discs that store data in a digital format and require a Blu-ray drive to read/write data. Blu-ray discs are not directly accessible by the computer's CPU and require manual insertion and ejection.

DVD and CD discs are offline storage devices. They are optical discs that store data in a digital format and require a DVD or CD drive to read/write data. Like Blu-ray discs, DVD and CD discs are not directly accessible by the computer's CPU and require manual intervention.

USB memory sticks, also known as USB flash drives or thumb drives, are considered offline storage devices. They are external storage devices that connect to the computer via a USB port. USB memory sticks require manual insertion and removal and are not directly accessible by the computer's CPU.

Question 35
Match List I with the List IILIST I (Type of computer network)(a) LAN(b) MAN(c) WAN(d) WLANLIST II (Description)(i) The internet is an example of this type of network(ii) This type of network is found in a building but is connected without cables(iii) This type of network is found in a building but is connected with cables(iv) This type of network is found in a geographic region of the size of a metropolitan areaChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.(a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
  • B.(a)-(i), (b)-(iv), (c)-(iii), (d)-(ii)
  • C.(a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
  • D.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)

Option A is correct.

(a) LAN (Local Area Network) is found in a building but is connected with cables - LANs are networks that typically cover a small geographic area such as a single building or campus. They are usually connected using cables such as Ethernet cables.

(b) MAN (Metropolitan Area Network) is found in a geographic region of the size of a metropolitan area - MANs are larger than LANs and typically cover a city or metropolitan area. They connect multiple LANs within the same region.

(c) WAN (Wide Area Network) are networks that span large geographic areas, often spanning across cities, countries, or even continents. The internet is the largest WAN, connecting networks and devices worldwide.

(d) WLAN (Wireless Local Area Network) is found in a building but is connected without cables - WLANs are similar to LANs but use wireless technology, such as Wi-Fi, for connectivity instead of cables. They are commonly found in homes, offices, and public spaces.

Question 36
Former UN general Secretary Kofi Annan once stated that “perhaps the single most successful international environmental agreement date to has been the(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Rio Summit
  • B.Montreal protocol
  • C.Kyoto protocol
  • D.Paris agreement
Correct Answer: Montreal protocol

Option B is correct.

Kofi Annan, the former UN Secretary-General, indeed made the statement that "perhaps the single most successful international environmental agreement to date has been the Montreal Protocol."

The Montreal Protocol is an international treaty designed to protect the ozone layer by phasing out the production and use of substances that deplete it. It was agreed upon in 1987 and has been ratified by almost all countries around the world.

Question 37
Full form of PCB, an air pollutant is(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Poly chlorinated Biphenyl
  • B.Poly chlorinated Benzene
  • C.PerchloroBiphenyl
  • D.PerchloroBenzene
Correct Answer: Poly chlorinated Biphenyl

Option A is correct.

PCB stands for Poly chlorinated Biphenyl. PCBs are a group of synthetic organic chemicals that were widely used in various industrial applications such as electrical equipment, hydraulic systems, and heat transfer fluids due to their desirable physical and chemical properties.

However, PCBs are now recognized as persistent organic pollutants and have been banned or severely restricted in many countries due to their harmful effects on human health and the environment. PCBs are toxic and can persist in the environment for a long time, accumulating in soil, water, air, and living organisms.

Exposure to PCBs has been associated with various adverse health effects, including cancer, reproductive disorders, immune system dysfunction, and developmental abnormalities in children.

Question 38
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Biodiesel can be created from vegetable oils and animal fats.Statement II: Biodiesel viscosity is significantly lower than that of petroleum diesel.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is true. Biodiesel is a renewable fuel made from various feedstocks, including vegetable oils (such as soybean oil, canola oil, palm oil, etc.) and animal fats (such as tallow, lard, poultry fat, etc.). These feedstocks undergo a process called trans esterification to produce biodiesel.

Statement II is false. Biodiesel has a higher viscosity than petroleum diesel. Viscosity refers to the thickness or resistance to flow of a fluid. Biodiesel has a higher molecular weight and oxygen content compared to petroleum diesel, which results in higher viscosity. However, biodiesel's viscosity is still within acceptable limits for use in diesel engines.

Question 39
In waste water treatment, biological processes are employed to remove mainlyA. bacteriaB. Suspended solidsC. FungiD. ColloidalE. Soluble organic compoundChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.D and E only
  • C.B and D only
  • D.C, D and E only
Correct Answer: D and E only

Option B is correct.

In wastewater treatment, biological processes primarily target the removal of organic pollutants through the action of microorganisms.

While bacteria are involved in biological processes in wastewater treatment plants, they are not the main target for removal. In fact, certain bacteria play beneficial roles in breaking down organic matter in wastewater.

Suspended solids are typically removed through physical processes such as sedimentation and filtration, rather than biological processes.

Fungi are not typically targeted for removal in wastewater treatment processes.

Colloidal particles can be effectively removed through biological processes such as biofiltration or by coupling biological treatment with physical or chemical processes.

Soluble organic compounds are the primary target for removal in biological wastewater treatment processes. Microorganisms break down these organic compounds through biochemical reactions, converting them into simpler, less harmful substances such as carbon dioxide and water.

Question 40
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason RAssertion A:Hydrofluorocarbons(HFCs), replacements of ozone depleting substances chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) were also decided to be phased out during cophenhagen-1992 conference.Reason R: HFCs have shorter lifetime than CFCs and contains no chlorine and bromineIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both A and R are true but R is the correct explanation of A
  • B.Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
  • C.A is true but R is false
  • D.A is false but R is true
Correct Answer: A is false but R is true

Option D is correct.

Assertion is false. The Copenhagen conference, also known as the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), primarily focused on addressing climate change issues rather than ozone depletion. The phase-out of HFCs was not specifically addressed at the Copenhagen conference.

Reason is true. HFCs are indeed replacements for CFCs and other ozone-depleting substances. Unlike CFCs, HFCs do not contain chlorine or bromine atoms in their chemical structure. Additionally, HFCs have shorter atmospheric lifetimes, meaning they do not persist in the atmosphere as long as CFCs, contributing less to ozone depletion.

Question 41
Which of the following commission committee recommended the closure of substandard colleges before independence?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Raleigh commission
  • B.Hunter commission
  • C.Sadler commission
  • D.Hartogcommission
Correct Answer: Raleigh commission

Option A is correct.

The Raleigh Commission, also known as the Indian Universities Commission, was established in 1902 under the chairmanship of Thomas Raleigh. It was tasked with evaluating the state of higher education in India and proposing reforms.

One of the recommendations made by the Raleigh Commission was the closure of substandard colleges before independence. The commission identified that many colleges were operating below acceptable standards, lacking adequate infrastructure, faculty, and resources. Therefore, it proposed the closure of such institutions to improve the overall quality of higher education in India.

Question 42
Which of the following were visualised by the National Policy on Education,1986vis-à-vis higher education?A. Complete privatisation of higher educationB. Consolidation and expansion of institutionC. Training of teachersD. Development of autonomous collegesE. Strengthening of researchChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, C and C only
  • B.A, C and D only
  • C.B, C, D and E only
  • D.A, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C, D and E only

Option C is correct.

Consolidation and expansion of institutions aligns with the objectives of the NPE 1986. The policy emphasized the need for the consolidation and expansion of institutions to meet the growing demand for higher education. It aimed to establish more universities, colleges, and institutions to provide access to education to a larger population.

Training of teachers aligns with the objectives of the NPE 1986. The policy emphasized the importance of improving the quality of teaching and faculty development. It stressed the need for continuous training and professional development programs for teachers to enhance their teaching skills and pedagogical techniques.

Development of autonomous colleges aligns with the objectives of the NPE 1986. The policy advocated for the development of autonomous colleges to promote academic freedom, innovation, and accountability in higher education. Autonomous colleges were encouraged to develop their curricula, assessment methods, and governance structures to meet the diverse needs of students and communities.

Strengthening of research aligns with the objectives of the NPE 1986. The policy emphasized the importance of promoting research and innovation in higher education institutions. It aimed to strengthen research infrastructure, encourage interdisciplinary research, and promote collaborations between academia and industry to address national challenges and contribute to socio-economic development.

Question 43
The aim of National Education Policy,2020 is to increase the GrossEnrollmentRatio in higher education by 2035 to:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.35%
  • B.26.3%
  • C.50%
  • D.40%
Correct Answer: 50%

Option C is correct.

The National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 aims to increase the Gross Enrollment Ratio (GER) in higher education to 50% by 2035.

Gross Enrollment Ratio (GER) is the ratio of the total enrollment in a specific level of education (typically higher education) to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to that level of education, multiplied by 100.

The NEP 2020 envisions a significant expansion and restructuring of higher education institutions to achieve this target. It emphasizes increasing access, equity, and quality in higher education across all regions and sections of society.

Question 44
Given below are two statements:Statement I: The earliest part of the British policy on education was to withdraw from higher education.Statement II: The British policy completely supported the idea of mother tongue as the medium of instruction as against English.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is true. During the early colonial period, the British colonial administration in India was primarily focused on establishing elementary and secondary schools to provide basic education to the Indian population. There was limited interest in higher education, and initially, the British did not actively promote or invest in higher education institutions in India.

Statement II is false. The British colonial education policy in India favored English as the medium of instruction, particularly in higher education institutions. The British believed that English education would facilitate the spread of Western ideas, values, and administration, and would also serve their colonial interests. The promotion of English as the medium of instruction was aimed at producing a class of Indians who could assist the British in administrative and clerical roles.

Question 45
Who among the following ancient Indian thinkers propounded five steps for the realisation of the meaning of a religious truth (tattvakatha) which closely resembles notion of learning in Dewey’s theory of education?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Gotama
  • B.Vasubandhu
  • C.Kapila
  • D.Vachapatimista
Correct Answer: Vachapatimista

Option D is correct.

Vachapatimista, also known as Vachaspati Mishra, was an ancient Indian philosopher and commentator on Vedanta and Nyaya philosophy. He propounded a method for the realization of the meaning of a religious truth (tattvakatha) which closely resembles the notion of learning in Dewey's theory of education.

John Dewey, an American philosopher and educator, emphasized experiential and hands-on learning, where learners engage actively with their environment to construct knowledge. His theory of education focuses on the importance of reflection, experimentation, and problem-solving in the learning process.

Question 46
Read the following passage and answer the question that follows:One well-known description of parenting styles is based on the research of DianeBaumrind. Her early work focused on a careful longitudinal study of 100 (mostly European American, middle-class) preschool children. Through observation of children and parents and interviews with parents.Baumrindand the other researchers who built on her findings identified four parenting styles based on the parents' high or low levels of warmth and control.Authoritative parents (high warmth, high control) set clear limits, enforce rules, and expect mature behavior. But they are warm with their children. They listen to concerns, give reasons for rules and allow more democratic decision-making. There is less strict punishment and more guidance Parents help children think through the consequences of their actions.Authoritarian parents (low warmth, high control) seem cold and controlling in their interactions with their children. The children are expected to be mature and to do what the parent says, "Because I said so" There is not much talk about emotions. Punishments are strict, but not abusive. The parents love their children, but they are not openly affectionate.Permissive parents (high warmth, low control) are warm and nurturing, but they have few rules or consequences for their children and expect little in the way of mature behavior becauseTheyare just kids".Rejecting/Neglecting/uninvolved parents (low warmth, low control) don't seem to care at all and can't be bothered with controlling, communicating or teaching their children.Authoritarian, authoritative and permissive parents love their children and are trying to do their best; they simply have different ideas about the best ways to parent.Baumrind’sresearch only focused on (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.All children
  • B.High school children
  • C.Pre- school children
  • D.Middle school children
Correct Answer: Pre- school children

Option C is correct.

As per the passage, baumrind’s research only focused on pre- school children.

Question 47
Read the following passage and answer the question that follows:One well-known description of parenting styles is based on the research of DianeBaumrind. Her early work focused on a careful longitudinal study of 100 (mostly European American, middle-class) preschool children. Through observation of children and parents and interviews with parents.Baumrindand the other researchers who built on her findings identified four parenting styles based on the parents' high or low levels of warmth and control.Authoritative parents (high warmth, high control) set clear limits, enforce rules, and expect mature behavior. But they are warm with their children. They listen to concerns, give reasons for rules and allow more democratic decision-making. There is less strict punishment and more guidance Parents help children think through the consequences of their actions.Authoritarian parents (low warmth, high control) seem cold and controlling in their interactions with their children. The children are expected to be mature and to do what the parent says, "Because I said so" There is not much talk about emotions. Punishments are strict, but not abusive. The parents love their children, but they are not openly affectionate.Permissive parents (high warmth, low control) are warm and nurturing, but they have few rules or consequences for their children and expect little in the way of mature behavior becauseTheyare just kids".Rejecting/Neglecting/uninvolved parents (low warmth, low control) don't seem to care at all and can't be bothered with controlling, communicating or teaching their children.Authoritarian, authoritative and permissive parents love their children and are trying to do their best; they simply have different ideas about the best ways to parent.Authoritarian parents in their interactions with their children are all of the following EXCEPT? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Not openly affectionate
  • B.Cold and controlled
  • C.Expect to be obeyed
  • D.Do not love their children
Correct Answer: Do not love their children

Option D is correct.

As per the passage, authoritarian parents in their interactions with their children are all of the following except do not love their children.

Question 48
Read the following passage and answer the question that follows:One well-known description of parenting styles is based on the research of DianeBaumrind. Her early work focused on a careful longitudinal study of 100 (mostly European American, middle-class) preschool children. Through observation of children and parents and interviews with parents.Baumrindand the other researchers who built on her findings identified four parenting styles based on the parents' high or low levels of warmth and control.Authoritative parents (high warmth, high control) set clear limits, enforce rules, and expect mature behavior. But they are warm with their children. They listen to concerns, give reasons for rules and allow more democratic decision-making. There is less strict punishment and more guidance Parents help children think through the consequences of their actions.Authoritarian parents (low warmth, high control) seem cold and controlling in their interactions with their children. The children are expected to be mature and to do what the parent says, "Because I said so" There is not much talk about emotions. Punishments are strict, but not abusive. The parents love their children, but they are not openly affectionate.Permissive parents (high warmth, low control) are warm and nurturing, but they have few rules or consequences for their children and expect little in the way of mature behavior becauseTheyare just kids".Rejecting/Neglecting/uninvolved parents (low warmth, low control) don't seem to care at all and can't be bothered with controlling, communicating or teaching their children.Authoritarian, authoritative and permissive parents love their children and are trying to do their best; they simply have different ideas about the best ways to parent.Uninvolved parentsA. do not show warmth towards their children.B. are non-communicative with their childrenC. do not care for their childrenD. are affectionate towards their childrenE. do not bother about controlling their childrenChoose the correct answer from the opinions given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A & B only
  • B.A, B, C & E only
  • C.C, D & E only
  • D.B and D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C & E only

Option B is correct.

AS per the passage, uninvolved parents do not show warmth towards their children, are non-communicative with their children, do not care for their children and do not bother about controlling their children.

Question 49
Read the following passage and answer the question that follows:One well-known description of parenting styles is based on the research of DianeBaumrind. Her early work focused on a careful longitudinal study of 100 (mostly European American, middle-class) preschool children. Through observation of children and parents and interviews with parents.Baumrindand the other researchers who built on her findings identified four parenting styles based on the parents' high or low levels of warmth and control.Authoritative parents (high warmth, high control) set clear limits, enforce rules, and expect mature behavior. But they are warm with their children. They listen to concerns, give reasons for rules and allow more democratic decision-making. There is less strict punishment and more guidance Parents help children think through the consequences of their actions.Authoritarian parents (low warmth, high control) seem cold and controlling in their interactions with their children. The children are expected to be mature and to do what the parent says, "Because I said so" There is not much talk about emotions. Punishments are strict, but not abusive. The parents love their children, but they are not openly affectionate.Permissive parents (high warmth, low control) are warm and nurturing, but they have few rules or consequences for their children and expect little in the way of mature behavior becauseTheyare just kids".Rejecting/Neglecting/uninvolved parents (low warmth, low control) don't seem to care at all and can't be bothered with controlling, communicating or teaching their children.Authoritarian, authoritative and permissive parents love their children and are trying to do their best; they simply have different ideas about the best ways to parent.Authoritarian, authoritative and permissive parents have (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.similar parenting styles
  • B.highly aggressive parenting style
  • C.dissimilar parenting styles
  • D.highly mild parenting styles
Correct Answer: dissimilar parenting styles

Option C is correct.

As per the passage, authoritarian, authoritative and permissive parents have dissimilar parenting styles.

Question 50
Read the following passage and answer the question that follows:One well-known description of parenting styles is based on the research of DianeBaumrind. Her early work focused on a careful longitudinal study of 100 (mostly European American, middle-class) preschool children. Through observation of children and parents and interviews with parents.Baumrindand the other researchers who built on her findings identified four parenting styles based on the parents' high or low levels of warmth and control.Authoritative parents (high warmth, high control) set clear limits, enforce rules, and expect mature behavior. But they are warm with their children. They listen to concerns, give reasons for rules and allow more democratic decision-making. There is less strict punishment and more guidance Parents help children think through the consequences of their actions.Authoritarian parents (low warmth, high control) seem cold and controlling in their interactions with their children. The children are expected to be mature and to do what the parent says, "Because I said so" There is not much talk about emotions. Punishments are strict, but not abusive. The parents love their children, but they are not openly affectionate.Permissive parents (high warmth, low control) are warm and nurturing, but they have few rules or consequences for their children and expect little in the way of mature behavior becauseTheyare just kids".Rejecting/Neglecting/uninvolved parents (low warmth, low control) don't seem to care at all and can't be bothered with controlling, communicating or teaching their children.Authoritarian, authoritative and permissive parents love their children and are trying to do their best; they simply have different ideas about the best ways to parent.Given below are two statements:Statement I:Baumrind’sstudy mostly focused on American middle class school childrenStatement II: Authoritative parents allow greater democratic decision makingIn the light of the given statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Option D is correct.

As per the passage, statement I is false but statement II is true.

Quiz Attempt #119753

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
Read the following passage and answer the question that follows:Political freedom and economic justice are two sides of democracy; both are essential. We should lay stress on the improvements of the economic conditions of the people as well as on liberty and freedom. No society can claim to be democratic if it does not permit political liberty, freedom of conscience, freedom of choice between parties, and opportunities of peaceful and orderly changes of Government.In the context of the international situation, there are many misunderstandings. We can build peace even on the basis of misunderstandings. When once peace is built, misunderstandings will diminish.We, in our country, are now engaged in the enterprise of effecting a social and economic revolution. The word 'revolution' need not scare us. It does not mean barricades and bloodshed. It means only speedy and drastic changes. We are interested not only in our objectives but in our methods; not only in what we achieve but in how we achieve. Through peaceful, constitutional processes we won our independence and integrated our country; and now we are striving to raise the material standards of our people. Even if we meet defeat in our attempt to replace force by persuasion, the politics of power by the politics of brotherhood, we are convinced that the defeat will be only temporary, for goodness is rooted in the nature of things; kindness and love are as contagious as unkindness and hate.Given below are two statements:Statement I: In international arena, understandings are a preStatement II: Authoritative parents allow greater democratic decision makingIn the light of the given statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Option D is correct.

As per the passage, statement I is false and statement II is true.

Question 2
The following table shows the number of votes polled along with the percentage (%) of valid votes and ratio of valid votes of male and females among them during an election in a college for the last five years from 2018-2022. Some values are missing in the table (indicate by “-") that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table.answerthe questions that follows.Year-wise Details of Voters Polled in an ElectionYearNo. of voters polledPercentage of valid votes polledRatio of valid votes of males and females2018--5:320191000-5:42020200038%-2021-60%7:52022500040%-Question: In the year 2020, if the number of valid votes of females was 300 then what was the ratio of valid votes of males and females in the same year?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.15 : 19
  • B.13 : 11
  • C.23 : 15
  • D.13 : 5
Correct Answer: 23 : 15

Valid votes in 2020 = 38% of 2000 = 760

Valid votes for males = 760 – 300 = 460

Ratio = 460 : 300

= 23 : 15

Question 3
The following table shows the number of votes polled along with the percentage (%) of valid votes and ratio of valid votes of male and females among them during an election in a college for the last five years from 2018-2022. Some values are missing in the table (indicate by ") that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table.answerthe questions that follows.Year-wise Details of Voters Polled in an ElectionYearNo. of voters polledPercentage of valid votes polledRatio of valid votes of males and females2018--5:320191000-5:42020200038%-2021-60%7:52022500040%-Question: If the numberpfvotes increased by 600% from 2019 to 2023 and 76% of the votes were valid in 2023, then the number of valid votes polled in 2023 was:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.5320
  • B.5040
  • C.5410
  • D.4560
Correct Answer: 4560

Number of votes poled in 2023 = 1000 × 6 = 6000

Valid votes = 76% of 6000 = 4560

Question 4
The following table shows the number of votes polled along with the percentage (%) of valid votes and ratio of valid votes of male and females among them during an election in a college for the last five years from 2018-2022. Some values are missing in the table (indicate by ") that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table.answerthe questions that follows.Year-wise Details of Voters Polled in an ElectionYearNo. of voters polledPercentage of valid votes polledRatio of valid votes of males and females2018--5:320191000-5:42020200038%-2021-60%7:52022500040%-Question: If the average number of valid votes polled in 2019 and 2022 was 1270 then the number of valid votes polled by females in 2019 was(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.270
  • B.300
  • C.210
  • D.240
Correct Answer: 240

Let x% valid votes were poled in 2019.

Then, x% of 1000+40% of 50002 = 1270

or x = 54%

Valid votes in 2019 = 54% 0f 1000 = 540

Valid votes of females in 2019 = 49 × 540 = 240

Question 5
The following table shows the number of votes polled along with the percentage (%) of valid votes and ratio of valid votes of male and females among them during an election in a college for the last five years from 2018-2022. Some values are missing in the table (indicate by ") that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table.answerthe questions that follows.Year-wise Details of Voters Polled in an ElectionYearNo. of voters polledPercentage of valid votes polledRatio of valid votes of males and females2018--5:320191000-5:42020200038%-2021-60%7:52022500040%-Question: In 2021, if the difference between the number of valid votes polled by males and females was 300, then the number of votes polled in 2021 was(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.3690
  • B.3000
  • C.3120
  • D.3440
Correct Answer: 3000

212 × 60% x = 300

or x = 3000

Thus, number of votes polled in 2021 = 3000

Question 6
The following table shows the number of votes polled along with the percentage (%) of valid votes and ratio of valid votes of male and females among them during an election in a college for the last five years from 2018-2022. Some values are missing in the table (indicate by ") that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table.answerthe questions that follows.Year-wise Details of Voters Polled in an ElectionYearNo. of voters polledPercentage of valid votes polledRatio of valid votes of males and females2018--5:320191000-5:42020200038%-2021-60%7:52022500040%-Question: In 2018, if the ratio of number of votes to number of valid votes was5 :4, then the number of valid votes by females in 2018 is _________ % less than the number of votes polled in the same year.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.60
  • B.30
  • C.35
  • D.70
Correct Answer: 70

Let votes polled = 5x

Valid votes = 4x

Required percentage = 5x-38×4x5x × 100

= 70%

Question 7
Which of the following are the secondary laws of learning?A. Law of multiple responseB. Law of Associate shiftingC. Law of effectD. Law of AnalogyE. Law of ExerciseChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, C and E only
  • B.A, B and D only
  • C.A, B and E only
  • D.C, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only

Option B is correct.

Question 8
A collection of a students work in an area, showing growth, self-reflection and achievement is called:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Positive practice
  • B.Personal development
  • C.Anecdotal record
  • D.Portfolios
Correct Answer: Portfolios

Option D is correct.

Portfolios are a collection of a student's work in a particular area, typically gathered over time. They are designed to showcase a student's growth, self-reflection, and achievements in various aspects of their learning journey. Portfolios can include a variety of artifacts such as written assignments, projects, artwork, performances, reflections, self-assessments, and other evidence of learning.

Question 9
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Contiguity theory gives no place to effect in learningStatement II: Watson’s theory gave emphasis on the importance of frequency or exercise in learning.In the light of the above statements, choose most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. Contiguity theory, proposed by Aristotle, emphasizes the importance of the contiguity or proximity in time and space between the stimuli and responses for learning to occur. It focuses on the association between stimuli and responses without considering the effects or consequences of behavior on learning.

Statement II is also true. Watson, one of the founders of behaviorism, emphasized the significance of repetition or frequency of associations between stimuli and responses in learning. He believed that through repeated pairings of stimuli and responses, behavior could be conditioned or learned.

Question 10
Mr.Kim wants to create a live polling and feedback tool for his students. In this context which of the following would be most suitable:A.MentimeterB. Screen-casto-maticC.PadletD.PolleverywhereE. Book creatorChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, C and E only
  • B.A and D only
  • C.A, B and D only
  • D.C and E only
Correct Answer: A and D only

Option B is correct.

Mentimeter is an interactive presentation and polling tool that allows users to create live polls, quizzes, word clouds, and other interactive activities. It is suitable for engaging students in real-time during lectures or presentations and collecting feedback instantly.

Polleverywhere is a polling and audience response system that allows users to create live polls, surveys, and quizzes. It is suitable for engaging students in interactive activities and collecting feedback in real-time.

Question 11
What are the different steps followed by self-regulated learning?A. Setting goalsB. Analysing the taskC. Regulating learningD. Devising plansE. Enacting tactics and strategiesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.C, A, B, D, E
  • B.D, C, A, E, B
  • C.B, A, D, E, C
  • D.D, C, E, A, B
Correct Answer: B, A, D, E, C

Option C is correct.

Self-regulated learning involves several steps that learners engage in to effectively monitor, control, and regulate their learning process.

Analyzing the task: The first step in self-regulated learning involves analyzing the task or learning objectives. Learners assess the requirements, expectations, and challenges associated with the task to gain a clear understanding of what needs to be accomplished.

Setting goals: Once learners have analyzed the task, they set specific, achievable goals that align with the task requirements. These goals provide direction and motivation, guiding learners' efforts throughout the learning process.

Devising plans: After setting goals, learners develop strategies and plans for achieving their objectives. This involves identifying the resources, timeframes, and actions necessary to accomplish the goals effectively.

Enacting tactics and strategies: With plans in place, learners implement various tactics and strategies to carry out their learning tasks. They employ study techniques, organizational methods, and problem-solving approaches to facilitate understanding and retention of information.

Regulating learning: Throughout the learning process, learners continuously monitor their progress, evaluate their strategies, and make adjustments as needed. This involves self-reflection, self-assessment, and adaptive decision-making to optimize learning outcomes.

Question 12
Given below are two statements:Statement I: In Cohort studies, samples are drawn from a generally defined population over time.Statement II: In Trend studies, samples are drawn from specific well-defined population.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false

Option B is correct.

Statement I is false. In cohort studies, participants are selected based on a specific characteristic or exposure (e.g., smoking status, age group) and followed over time to observe the development of outcomes of interest. It is not necessary for samples to be drawn from a generally defined population, as cohort studies typically focus on specific groups of individuals with particular characteristics.

Statement II is also false. Trend studies, also known as cross-sectional studies, involve collecting data from a sample of individuals at a single point in time to assess the prevalence or distribution of various variables. While samples in trend studies are drawn from a specific population, they are not necessarily "well-defined." Trend studies focus on capturing a snapshot of a population's characteristics at a particular moment, rather than tracking changes over time.

Question 13
In APA style of referencing for a journal article which of the following would come in the end?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.last name of the author
  • B.title of the research article
  • C.page numbers
  • D.DOI number
Correct Answer: DOI number

Option D is correct.

In APA (American Psychological Association) style of referencing for a journal article, the DOI (Digital Object Identifier) number typically comes at the end of the reference entry.

The typical reference entry for a journal article looks like in APA style: Author(s). (Year). Title of the article. Title of the Journal, volume number (issue number), page range. DOI or URL.

The DOI or URL is included at the end of the reference entry. The DOI provides a unique alphanumeric string assigned to an online publication, allowing for easy identification and access. If the article has a DOI, it is preferable to include it in the reference as it provides a stable link to the article, ensuring that readers can access the article even if the URL changes.

Question 14
According to UGC Regulation 2018 on promotion of academic integrity, the Institutional Academic Integrity Panel will consist of(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.two members
  • B.three members
  • C.four members
  • D.five members
Correct Answer: four members

Option C is correct.

According to the UGC (University Grants Commission) Regulations 2018 on the promotion of academic integrity and prevention of plagiarism in higher educational institutions, the Institutional Academic Integrity Panel is responsible for overseeing matters related to academic integrity within the institution.

The Institutional Academic Integrity Panel typically consists of the following members:

Chairperson: A senior faculty member designated by the institution.

Coordinator: A faculty member appointed by the institution to coordinate the activities of the panel.

Member(s): Additional faculty members appointed by the institution to serve on the panel. The number of members can vary depending on the size and requirements of the institution.

The panel generally consists of at least four members: a chairperson, a coordinator, and two other faculty members.

Question 15
For a negatively skewed distribution, the median would be equal to which of the following measures?A. MeanB. ModeC. Second quartileD. Fifth quartileE. 50thpercentileChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.C and E only
  • D.A, B, C, D and E only
Correct Answer: C and E only

In a negatively skewed distribution, the tail of the distribution extends towards the lower end of the range of values, meaning that there are more extreme values on the lower side and fewer extreme values on the higher side.

The median is a measure of central tendency that represents the middle value of a dataset when it is arranged in ascending or descending order. It divides the dataset into two equal parts.

Since the median is robust to extreme values and represents the middle value of the dataset, it is equal to the second quartile (Q2) and also to the 50th percentile.

Question 16
For which of the following p-values of a test statistic a null hypothesis is likely to be acceptedA. 0.32 of 2%B. 32%C. 2%D. 0.42%Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.B and D only
  • D.A and C only
Correct Answer: B and D only

Option C is correct.

In hypothesis testing, the p-value represents the probability of obtaining the observed results, or more extreme results, if the null hypothesis is true. Typically, if the p-value is greater than the chosen significance level (α), often 0.05 or 0.01, then we fail to reject the null hypothesis.

0.32 or 2%: This p-value is equivalent to a significance level of 0.32, which is much larger than common significance levels like 0.05 or 0.01. Therefore, we would fail to reject the null hypothesis. However, the presentation of the percentage is not standard; it's likely that the intended value is 0.32, not 2%. If it's 0.32, then the answer would be (A) A and B only.

32%: This p-value is 0.32, which is significantly larger than common significance levels. Thus, we would fail to reject the null hypothesis.

2%: This p-value corresponds to a significance level of 0.02, which is smaller than common levels like 0.05. Therefore, we would reject the null hypothesis.

0.42%: This p-value is equivalent to a significance level of 0.0042, which is smaller than common levels like 0.05. Therefore, we would reject the null hypothesis.

Question 17
Sharing of meaning between two positions of thought within a person is called:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Selfish Communication
  • B.Intra-personal communication
  • C.Interpersonal communication
  • D.Spiritual communication
Correct Answer: Intra-personal communication

Option B is correct.

Intra-personal communication refers to the process of communication that occurs within an individual's own mind. It involves the sharing of meaning between different positions of thought within a person. In other words, it involves the internal dialogue, reflection, and interpretation that individuals engage in with themselves.

Selfish Communication does not accurately describe the sharing of meaning within an individual's own mind. Selfish communication typically refers to communication that is focused solely on one's own interests or needs, without consideration for others.

Intra-personal communication describes the process of communication within an individual's own mind. It involves the internal dialogue, reflection, and interpretation that individuals engage in with themselves.

Interpersonal communication refers to communication that occurs between two or more people. It involves the exchange of messages, ideas, and meaning between individuals.

Spiritual communication refers to communication that is related to spiritual or religious beliefs, practices, or experiences. It typically involves communication between individuals and a higher power or spiritual entity.

Question 18
In decision-making process, group communication helps in maintaining.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Status of top management
  • B.Policy of deviation
  • C.Ethnic prejudices
  • D.Equilibrium related socio-emotional concerns
Correct Answer: Equilibrium related socio-emotional concerns

Group communication in the decision-making process plays a significant role in maintaining equilibrium related socio-emotional concerns.

Status of top management: Group communication may indirectly impact the status of top management by influencing decision outcomes, but its primary role isn't to maintain the status of top management.

Policy of deviation: "Policy of deviation" doesn't typically relate to the function of group communication in decision-making. It seems to be an unrelated concept.

Ethnic prejudices: Group communication can indeed help address and mitigate ethnic prejudices through open dialogue and fostering understanding among group members. However, this is not the primary role of group communication in decision-making.

Equilibrium related socio-emotional concerns: Group communication is vital for managing socio-emotional dynamics within the group during decision-making. This includes maintaining equilibrium, managing conflicts, ensuring all voices are heard, and addressing the emotional needs of group members. Effective group communication fosters a supportive environment where individuals feel respected and valued, leading to more successful decision outcomes.

Question 19
Which of the following are emphasises in high-context cultures?A. Use of colloquialismB. Fractured sentencesC. Politeness in communicationD. Non-verbal communicationE. Indirect phrasingsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, D only
  • C.C, D, E and B only
  • D.A, B, E only
Correct Answer: A, B, E only

Option D is correct.

High-context cultures are those in which communication relies heavily on contextual cues, non-verbal cues, and implicit understanding among individuals.

Colloquialisms, or informal expressions and idioms specific to a particular region or group, are more commonly associated with low-context cultures where explicit verbal communication is emphasized. In high-context cultures, communication tends to be more formal and relies less on colloquialisms.

Fractured sentences, or incomplete sentences, are not typically emphasized in high-context cultures. Clear and complete sentences are often preferred to ensure mutual understanding, especially given the importance of implicit understanding in high-context communication.

Politeness is indeed emphasized in high-context cultures, as maintaining harmonious relationships and preserving social harmony are prioritized. However, this option is not specific to high-context cultures alone and can be relevant to both high-context and low-context cultures.

Non-verbal communication, including gestures, facial expressions, and body language, plays a significant role in high-context cultures. Individuals rely on non-verbal cues to convey meaning and understand messages within the context of the situation.

Indirect phrasings, such as using hints, implications, or vague language to communicate meaning indirectly, are commonly emphasized in high-context cultures. Direct and explicit communication may be perceived as rude or confrontational, so individuals in high-context cultures often prefer indirect communication styles to maintain harmony.

Question 20
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Perceptual time is related to the processing of non-verbal cues or signals by us.Statement II:Signalicor perceptual communication is related to the induction of others’ communication into our brains and this kind of communication is known as semiotics.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Both Statements are correct.

 

Statement I: Perceptual time refers to the subjective experience of time, which can be influenced by various factors including the processing of non-verbal cues or signals. Non-verbal cues such as body language, facial expressions, and tone of voice can affect how we perceive time in different situations. Therefore, Statement I is true.

Statement II: Semiotics is the study of signs and symbols and their interpretation, which is broader than just signalic communication. Therefore, Statement II is correct.

Question 21
Given below are two statements:Statement I: The Hindu view of communication considers language as atooltounderstand an illusionary world.Statement II: According to the Hindu view of communication, hearing and understanding of language are for realisation of some state of affairs.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is correct. The Hindu view of communication considers language as a tool to understand an illusionary world. In Hindu philosophy, particularly in Advaita Vedanta, the material world is often regarded as an illusion (maya) or as having a temporary and changing nature. Language, in this context, serves as a means to navigate through this illusionary world by conveying knowledge and insights that can lead to a deeper understanding of reality.

Statement II is correct. According to the Hindu view of communication, hearing and understanding of language are for the realization of some state of affairs. In Hindu philosophy, communication is not merely about conveying information but also about achieving spiritual or existential realization. Language, when used effectively, can help individuals comprehend deeper truths about existence, consciousness, and the nature of reality.

Question 22
Find the missing term in the following series 0, 6, 24, 60, 120,?,.336…….(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.180
  • B.210
  • C.272
  • D.316
Correct Answer: 210

Thus number in place of question mark = 120 + 90 = 210

Question 23
If ‘MALE’ is coded as 31 and ‘FEMALE’ is coded as 42, then how will ‘ADULT’ be coded in the same scheme?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.35
  • B.53
  • C.58
  • D.62
Correct Answer: 58

The words are coded as the sum of the letter's positional values. Hence, the correct answer is 58.

Question 24
A rectangular sports field has dimensions (150 m × 120 m). Its length is increased by 0.8% and width is reduced by 0.5%. What is the change in the area of field?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.≈ 0.3%
  • B.≈ 0.4%
  • C.≈ 1.3%
  • D.≈ 1.6%
Correct Answer: ≈ 1.3%

New length = 150 × (1.008) = 151.2

Width = 120 × (1.005) = 120.6

New Area = 18234.72

Area = 150 × 120 = 18000

Change in area = 18234.72 – 18000

= 234.72

Percentage change in area = 234.7218000 × 100

= 1.3%

Question 25
A and B can complete a work in 10 days, B and C in 12 days; C andAin 15 days. A alone can complete the work in:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.30 days
  • B.24 days
  • C.36 days
  • D.32 days
Correct Answer: 24 days

Let total work be 180 units.

A + B can do 18 units per day

B + C can do 15 units per day

And C + A can do 12 units per day

A + B + C can do 452 units per day

A can do 452 – 15 = 152 units per day

A can complete the work in 18015/2 = 24 days

Question 26
How many kilograms of sugar costingRs. 50 per kg should be mixed with 30 kg of sugar costingRs45 per kg so that the mixture isRs. 48 per kg?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.50 kg
  • B.48 kg
  • C.45 kg
  • D.42 kg
Correct Answer: 45 kg

Let x kg of Rs. 50 per kg sugar be added.

Then, 50x + 30 × 45 = 48 (x + 30)

or 45

Thus, weight of sugar = 45 kg

Question 27
Arrange the following group of terms in order of decreasing extension.A. MammalB. WildcatC. FelineD. AnimalE. VertebrateChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.C, B, E, A, D
  • B.B, C, A, E, D
  • C.D, E, A, B, C
  • D.D, E, A, C, B
Correct Answer: D, E, A, C, B

Option D is correct.

Extension refers to the breadth or inclusiveness of a term, with broader terms encompassing narrower ones.

Animal has the broadest extension as it includes all living organisms classified under the kingdom Animalia.

Vertebrate is more specific than "animal" as it refers to organisms possessing a backbone or spinal column.

Mammal is more specific than "vertebrate" as it refers to a class of animals characterized by mammary glands and typically having hair or fur.

Feline is even more specific than "mammal" as it refers to a family of mammals within the order Carnivora, including cats.

Wildcat is the most specific among the options as it refers to a particular species or subset of felines, specifically wild members of the cat family.

Question 28
Which fallacy is exemplified in the following statement “There is no such things as knowledge which cannot be carried into practice for knowledge is really no knowledge at all?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Begging the question
  • B.Hasty Generalisation
  • C.Red Herring
  • D.Slippery slope
Correct Answer: Begging the question

Begging the question fallacy occurs when the conclusion of the argument is assumed to be true within the premises themselves. The argument essentially restates the conclusion as part of the explanation.

 

The statement starts with the claim that "there is no such thing as knowledge which cannot be carried into practice." (This is the conclusion). It then justifies this claim by stating that "knowledge is really no knowledge at all" if it can't be practiced. This justification simply rephrases the initial claim using different words.

Question 29
Which normal fallacy is committed in the following agreement “if your pet is a cat, then it as atail.Your pet is not a cat, therefore your pet does not have a tail”?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Existential fallacy
  • B.Denying the antecedent
  • C.Exclusive premises
  • D.Affirming the consequent
Correct Answer: Denying the antecedent

The normal fallacy committed in the agreement “if your pet is a cat, then it has a tail. Your pet is not a cat, therefore your pet does not have a tail" is option (B) Denying the antecedent.

 

Denying the antecedent: This fallacy occurs when the argument denies the "if...then..." (antecedent) part of a conditional statement and incorrectly concludes that the "then..." (consequent) part must also be false.

 

The argument presents a conditional statement: "if your pet is a cat (antecedent), then it has a tail (consequent)".

 

The second premise "Your pet is not a cat" denies the antecedent.

The conclusion "therefore your pet does not have a tail" doesn't necessarily follow.

 

Just because your pet isn't a cat doesn't guarantee it doesn't have a tail. There could be other animals besides cats that have tails.

Question 30
Given below are two statements:Statement I:In deductive arguments, the claim is made that conclusions follow with certainly from their premises.Statement II:Any inductive argument, if it is good, brings to light in its conclusion what was already buried in its premises.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Both Statement I and Statement II are true.

Question 31
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.Assertion ‘A’:The argument that sound is eternal because it is produced, is fallacious.Reason ‘R’:In the argument sound is eternal because it is produced, the middle term is contradicted by some otherpramanaand not by inference.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both A and R are true but R is the correct explanation of A
  • B.Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
  • C.A is true but R is false
  • D.A is false but R is true
Correct Answer: A is true but R is false

Option C is the correct answer.

 

Assertion (A): "The argument that sound is eternal because it is produced, is fallacious."

This statement is true. The argument commits the fallacy of viruddha (contradictory middle term) according to Nyaya logic.

 

Reason (R): "In the argument sound is eternal because it is produced, the middle term is contradicted by some other pramana and not by inference."

 

This statement is false.

 

The fallacy of viruddha occurs when the middle term itself is inherently contradictory. In this case, "being produced" contradicts the idea of "eternal" because things that are produced eventually cease to exist. This contradiction is evident within the reasoning itself, not based on some external source of knowledge (pramana) as reason R suggests.

Question 32
What is the name of the computing term described below?Software that gives the user the chance to try it out free of charge before actually buying it. The software is subject to the usual copyright laws. As a rule, not all the features found in the full version are available at this stage.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Freeware
  • B.Shareware
  • C.Firmware
  • D.Malware
Correct Answer: Shareware

Option B is correct.

Shareware is a type of software distribution model where users are provided with the opportunity to try out the software for free before purchasing it. It is subject to copyright laws like any other software. Shareware typically offers limited features or functionality in the trial version, and users are encouraged to purchase the full version to access all features.

Freeware refers to software that is available for use at no cost. Unlike shareware, freeware typically does not require payment for any version, and there is no expectation for users to purchase a full version.

Firmware is a type of software that is embedded into hardware devices, such as computer peripherals, to control their operation. It is not directly related to the concept described in the question.

Malware refers to malicious software designed to harm or disrupt computer systems. It is not relevant to the concept described in the question, as the software described is intended for legitimate use.

Question 33
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Google Meet is a pure Cloud-based Video conferencing solution.Statement II: Google Meet provides clouds storage as well as the ability to open and modify documents online.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is true. Google Meet is indeed a pure cloud-based video conferencing solution. It operates entirely over the internet, allowing users to conduct virtual meetings without the need for dedicated hardware or software installations.

Statement II is false. Google Meet does not provide cloud storage or the ability to open and modify documents online. These features are typically associated with other Google services such as Google Drive, Google Docs, and Google Sheets. While Google Meet may integrate with these services for document sharing during meetings, it does not inherently offer cloud storage or document editing capabilities.

Question 34
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Solid State Drives (SSDs) are considerably faster than Hard Disk Drive (HDDs) when it comes to data access.Statement II: RAM is much faster to write to or read from in comparison to secondary memory such as hard disk, but its main drawback is its vulnerability.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is correct. Solid State Drives (SSDs) are indeed considerably faster than Hard Disk Drives (HDDs) when it comes to data access. SSDs use flash memory to store data, allowing for much faster read and write speeds compared to traditional HDDs, which use spinning disks and mechanical read/write heads.

Statement II is correct. RAM (Random Access Memory) is much faster to write to or read from compared to secondary memory such as hard disks. RAM provides rapid access to data for the CPU, enabling quick processing of instructions and data. However, its main drawback is its vulnerability to data loss in case of power failure or system shutdown since RAM is volatile memory, meaning it loses its data when power is turned off.

Question 35
You and your friend decided to go to Goa after you finish your finals, however your demanding parents set a couple of conditions to join your friends (see MS EXCEL spreadsheet below)ABCD1Category of conditionMinimal results neededActual resultsAllowed(Yes/No)2Hours spent on homework weekly02033Midterm score70684Final exam score7577Imagine your parents ask you to either meet the final exam score condition or both if the two remaining (homework and midterm) conditions. Which of the following formulas A-C can be used in the D2 to answer the questions: will you be able to join your friends with the results given?A. = IF(C4>=B4, “Yes”, IF(AND(C2>=B2, C3>=B3), “Yes”, “No”)B. = IF (AND(C2>=B2, C3>=B3), “Yes”, IF (C4>=B4, :“Yes”, “No”)C. = IF(OR(AND(C2>=B2, C3>=B3), C4>=B4), “Yes”, “No”)Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.A and C only
  • C.B and C only
  • D.A, B and C only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only

Option D is the correct answer.

Question 36
Match List I with the List IILIST I (Computer term)(a) Router(b) Firewall(c) CERT-In(d) Transmission control protocolLIST II (Definition)(i) The rules that govern the division of a file into packets and subsequent reassembly of the file from those packets.(ii) An organization assigned responsibility for reducing problems and incidents related to computer security.(iii) A device that provides perimeter security by filtering packets.(iv) A device that uses the Internet Protocol (IP) to send packets across network.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A-IV, B-II, C-III, D-I
  • B.A-IV, B-III. C-II, D-I
  • C.B-I, B-III, C-II, D-IV
  • D.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
Correct Answer: A-IV, B-III. C-II, D-I

Option B is correct.

Router - A device that uses the Internet Protocol (IP) to send packets across a network.

Firewall - A device that provides perimeter security by filtering packets.

CERT-In - An organization assigned responsibility for reducing problems and incidents related to computer security.

Transmission control protocol - The rules that govern the division of a file into packets and subsequent reassembly of the file from those packets.

Question 37
Whenwas the Environmental Protection Act (1986)last amended?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.1990
  • B.1991
  • C.1992
  • D.1993
Correct Answer: 1991

Option B is correct.

The Environmental Protection Act (1986) of India was last amended in 1991. This amendment aimed to enhance environmental protection measures and address evolving environmental challenges.

Question 38
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Stratospheric ozone is known as ‘good ozone’Statement II: Ozone at the surface level is a serious health hazard and known as pollutant.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is correct. The ozone layer in the stratosphere helps to protect life on Earth by absorbing the majority of the sun's harmful ultraviolet (UV) radiation.

Statement II is also correct. Ground-level ozone is a major component of smog and can cause respiratory issues, especially in vulnerable individuals such as children, the elderly, and those with respiratory conditions.

Question 39
Many nations blend petrol with ethanol to reduce the emission of CO. The mixture is known as:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Gasol
  • B.Petrohol
  • C.Gasohol
  • D.Ethopetrol
Correct Answer: Gasohol

Option C is correct.
