Gasohol is a blend of gasoline (petrol) and ethanol. Ethanol, which is produced from renewable sources such as sugarcane or corn, is mixed with gasoline to create gasohol. This blending is done to reduce emissions of carbon monoxide (CO) and other pollutants, as ethanol burns cleaner than pure gasoline. Gasohol is used as a fuel for vehicles and is considered a renewable and environmentally friendly alternative to pure gasoline. Therefore, option (C) Gasohol is the correct term for the mixture of petrol with ethanol.

Question 40
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Screen chamber in waste water treatment is used to remove small and heavy suspended solids.Statement II: Grit chamber in waste water treatment is used to remove large floating materials.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false

Option B is correct.

Statement I is correct. The screen chamber in wastewater treatment is typically used to remove large suspended solids such as sticks, leaves, plastics, and other debris. It is not specifically designed to remove small and heavy suspended solids.

Statement II is correct. The grit chamber in wastewater treatment is indeed used to remove heavy materials such as sand, gravel, and other inert solids. It is not used to remove large floating materials.

Both statements are false because they misrepresent the functions of the screen chamber and the grit chamber in wastewater treatment processes.

Question 41
Which one of the following gases has the maximum global warming potential (GWP)(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Methane (CH4)
  • B.Nitrous oxide (N2O)
  • C.Carbon dioxide (CO2)
  • D.Carbon monoxide (CO)
Correct Answer: Nitrous oxide (N2O)

Option B is correct.

Global Warming Potential (GWP) is a measure of how much heat a greenhouse gas traps in the atmosphere over a specific time period, usually 100 years, relative to carbon dioxide (CO2). GWP values are used to compare the impacts of different greenhouse gases on global warming.

Nitrous oxide (N2O) has a much higher GWP compared to other common greenhouse gases. It is approximately 298 times more effective at trapping heat in the atmosphere over a 100-year period compared to carbon dioxide (CO2). This high GWP contributes significantly to global warming despite its lower concentration in the atmosphere compared to carbon dioxide.

Question 42
The college that was exclusively meant for the education of Indian princes before independence was(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Reid college, Lucknow
  • B.Daly college, Indore
  • C.St.Xaviercollege, Kolkata
  • D.Forman college, Lahore
Correct Answer: Daly college, Indore

Option B is correct.

Daly College, located in Indore, Madhya Pradesh, was established in 1882 by Sir Henry Daly, the British Resident Agent at the princely state of Indore. It was originally founded as an exclusive institution for the education of the Indian princes and nobles. The college played a significant role in providing education to the royal families and aristocracy of various princely states before India gained independence in 1947.

Question 43
Which of the following institutions was established before Indian independence?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.ICSSR
  • B.AICTE
  • C.ICHR
  • D.ICPR
Correct Answer: AICTE

Option B is correct.

AICTE (All India Council for Technical Education) was established before Indian independence. It was formed in 1945 as an advisory body by the Government of India. Its main purpose was to promote and regulate technical education in the country. However, it was given statutory status in 1987 through an Act of Parliament.

ICSSR (Indian Council of Social Science Research), ICHR (Indian Council of Historical Research), and ICPR (Indian Council of Philosophical Research) were established after Indian independence. ICSSR was established in 1969, ICHR in 1972, and ICPR in 1977.

Question 44
Which of the following were the recommendations of theRadhakrishnanCommission regarding medium of instructions in higher education?A. The medium of higher education should be in regional languageB. Immediate steps should be taken to prepare scientific and technical technologies in federal languagesC. All the federal languages must be writtenDevanagriscriptD. International and scientific terminological words should be avoidedE. English should be banished from the higher education field in India immediatelyChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.A, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only

Option A is correct.

The recommendations of the Radhakrishnan Commission regarding the medium of instructions in higher education were:

The medium of higher education should be in regional languages aimed at promoting education in regional languages to ensure wider accessibility and to preserve linguistic diversity.

Immediate steps should be taken to prepare scientific and technical textbooks in federal languages emphasized the importance of translating scientific and technical materials into various regional languages to facilitate better understanding and dissemination of knowledge.

All the federal languages must be written in Devanagari script suggested standardizing the script for all federal languages to streamline the writing system and promote linguistic uniformity.

Question 45
Given below are two statements:Statement I: According to NEP 2020, value-based education shall include universal values and scientific temper.Statement II: Value based education did not include real life skills and constitutional values as per the NEP documentIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is correct. The NEP emphasizes the importance of instilling universal values such as empathy, respect for others, honesty, integrity, and scientific temper among students.

Statement II is incorrect. The NEP 2020 emphasizes holistic development and aims to integrate essential life skills and constitutional values into the education system. Real-life skills such as critical thinking, problem-solving, creativity, communication skills, digital literacy, and constitutional values such as justice, liberty, equality, fraternity, and democracy are integral components of the education system as per NEP 2020.

Question 46
Higher education in ancient India was based on an integrated system ofA. Ahimsa (Non-violence)B. Dharma (Religion)C.Darshan(Philosophy)D.Arthshastra(Economics)E.Niti(Ethics)Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.A, C and D only
  • C.A, D and E only
  • D.B, C, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C, D and E only

Option D is correct.

In ancient India, higher education was based on an integrated system that encompassed various aspects of life, including religion, philosophy, economics, and ethics.

Dharma (Religion): Religion, particularly Hinduism, played a significant role in ancient Indian education. Higher education often included the study of religious scriptures, rituals, and moral values.

Darshan (Philosophy): Philosophy was a fundamental component of ancient Indian education. Schools of philosophy such as Vedanta, Nyaya, Vaisheshika, Sankhya, Yoga, and Mimamsa were established, and students studied various philosophical concepts and theories.

Arthashastra (Economics): Ancient Indian education also included the study of economics. The Arthashastra, attributed to Chanakya (Kautilya), is an ancient Indian treatise on statecraft, economic policy, and military strategy. It provided guidelines for governance, economics, and administration.

Niti (Ethics): Ethics and moral values were integral to ancient Indian education. Students were taught principles of righteousness, ethical conduct, and virtues such as honesty, integrity, and compassion.

Ahimsa - Non-violence is not entirely accurate in the context of higher education in ancient India. While non-violence (ahimsa) was certainly emphasized in Indian philosophy and spiritual teachings, it was not specifically a foundational aspect of higher education in the same way as religion, philosophy, economics, and ethics.

Question 47
Read the following passage and answer the question that follows:Political freedom and economic justice are two sides of democracy; both are essential. We should lay stress on the improvements of the economic conditions of the people as well as on liberty and freedom. No society can claim to be democratic if it does not permit political liberty, freedom of conscience, freedom of choice between parties, and opportunities of peaceful and orderly changes of Government.In the context of the international situation, there are many misunderstandings. We can build peace even on the basis of misunderstandings. When once peace is built, misunderstandings will diminish.We, in our country, are now engaged in the enterprise of effecting a social and economic revolution. The word 'revolution' need not scare us. It does not mean barricades and bloodshed. It means only speedy and drastic changes. We are interested not only in our objectives but in our methods; not only in what we achieve but in how we achieve. Through peaceful, constitutional processes we won our independence and integrated our country; and now we are striving to raise the material standards of our people. Even if we meet defeat in our attempt to replace force by persuasion, the politics of power by the politics of brotherhood, we are convinced that the defeat will be only temporary, for goodness is rooted in the nature of things; kindness and love are as contagious as unkindness and hate.For a democratic society it is essential to haveA. Complete literacyB. Political freedomC. Freedom of individualD. Population controlE. Economic justiceChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B & E only
  • B.B, C & D only
  • C.C & E only
  • D.B, C & E only
Correct Answer: B, C & E only

Option D is correct.

As per the passage, for a democratic society it is essential to have political freedom, freedom of individual and economic justice.

Question 48
Read the following passage and answer the question that follows:Political freedom and economic justice are two sides of democracy; both are essential. We should lay stress on the improvements of the economic conditions of the people as well as on liberty and freedom. No society can claim to be democratic if it does not permit political liberty, freedom of conscience, freedom of choice between parties, and opportunities of peaceful and orderly changes of Government.In the context of the international situation, there are many misunderstandings. We can build peace even on the basis of misunderstandings. When once peace is built, misunderstandings will diminish.We, in our country, are now engaged in the enterprise of effecting a social and economic revolution. The word 'revolution' need not scare us. It does not mean barricades and bloodshed. It means only speedy and drastic changes. We are interested not only in our objectives but in our methods; not only in what we achieve but in how we achieve. Through peaceful, constitutional processes we won our independence and integrated our country; and now we are striving to raise the material standards of our people. Even if we meet defeat in our attempt to replace force by persuasion, the politics of power by the politics of brotherhood, we are convinced that the defeat will be only temporary, for goodness is rooted in the nature of things; kindness and love are as contagious as unkindness and hate.The word ‘revolution’ in the passage implies (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Bloodshed
  • B.Violent protests
  • C.Political transformation
  • D.Social and economic transformation
Correct Answer: Social and economic transformation

Option D is correct.

As per the passage, the word ‘revolution’ in the passage implies social and economic transformation.

Question 49
Read the following passage and answer the question that follows:Political freedom and economic justice are two sides of democracy; both are essential. We should lay stress on the improvements of the economic conditions of the people as well as on liberty and freedom. No society can claim to be democratic if it does not permit political liberty, freedom of conscience, freedom of choice between parties, and opportunities of peaceful and orderly changes of Government.In the context of the international situation, there are many misunderstandings. We can build peace even on the basis of misunderstandings. When once peace is built, misunderstandings will diminish.We, in our country, are now engaged in the enterprise of effecting a social and economic revolution. The word 'revolution' need not scare us. It does not mean barricades and bloodshed. It means only speedy and drastic changes. We are interested not only in our objectives but in our methods; not only in what we achieve but in how we achieve. Through peaceful, constitutional processes we won our independence and integrated our country; and now we are striving to raise the material standards of our people. Even if we meet defeat in our attempt to replace force by persuasion, the politics of power by the politics of brotherhood, we are convinced that the defeat will be only temporary, for goodness is rooted in the nature of things; kindness and love are as contagious as unkindness and hate.Which of the following traits of human nature are considered to be contagious?A. HonestyB. KindnessC. LoveD. HateE. IntegrityChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B & C only
  • B.B, C & D only

Question 50
Read the following passage and answer the question that follows:Political freedom and economic justice are two sides of democracy; both are essential. We should lay stress on the improvements of the economic conditions of the people as well as on liberty and freedom. No society can claim to be democratic if it does not permit political liberty, freedom of conscience, freedom of choice between parties, and opportunities of peaceful and orderly changes of Government.In the context of the international situation, there are many misunderstandings. We can build peace even on the basis of misunderstandings. When once peace is built, misunderstandings will diminish.We, in our country, are now engaged in the enterprise of effecting a social and economic revolution. The word 'revolution' need not scare us. It does not mean barricades and bloodshed. It means only speedy and drastic changes. We are interested not only in our objectives but in our methods; not only in what we achieve but in how we achieve. Through peaceful, constitutional processes we won our independence and integrated our country; and now we are striving to raise the material standards of our people. Even if we meet defeat in our attempt to replace force by persuasion, the politics of power by the politics of brotherhood, we are convinced that the defeat will be only temporary, for goodness is rooted in the nature of things; kindness and love are as contagious as unkindness and hate.Economic standards of people could be raised by:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Force
  • B.Politics of power
  • C.Politics of brotherhood
  • D.Politics of exclusion
Correct Answer: Politics of brotherhood

Option C is correct.

As per the passage, economic standards of people could be raised by politics of brotherhood.

Quiz Attempt #119754

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the number of employees working in five different companies A-E in December, 2021 along with the percentage distribution of Science, Commerce and Arts Graduates among them. Based on the data in the table answer the questions that follow:Company-wise Details of EmployeesCompanyNumber of EmployeesPercentage (%) Distribution of GraduatesScienceCommerceArtsA210032%--B1400-31%40%C-30%30%-D--40%20%E-35%50%-Note:(i)employeesof all the five companies can be categorized only in three types of Graduates, namely, Science, Commerce and Arts.(ii) Some values are missing in the table (indicated by ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if requiredQuestion: In company B, thedifference between the number of employees who are graduates in Arts and Scienceis:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.174
  • B.178
  • C.154
  • D.146
Correct Answer: 154

Science graduates = 100 – (31 + 40) = 29%

Thus, difference between the number of employees who are graduates in Arts and Science = (40 – 29) % of 1400 = 11% of 1400 = 154

Question 2
The following table shows the number of employees working in five different companies A-E in December, 2021 along with the percentage distribution of Science, Commerce and Arts Graduates among them. Based on the data in the table answer the questions that follow:Company-wise Details of EmployeesCompanyNumber of EmployeesPercentage (%) Distribution of GraduatesScienceCommerceArtsA210032%--B1400-31%40%C-30%30%-D--40%20%E-35%50%-Note:(i)employeesof all the five companies can be categorized only in three types of Graduates, namely, Science, Commerce and Arts.(ii) Some values are missing in the table (indicated by ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if requiredQuestion: In company E, if the average number of employees who are graduates in Arts and Commerce is 377, then the number of employees in company E is:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.1120
  • B.1160
  • C.1320
  • D.1360
Correct Answer: 1160

50%+15% of x2 = 377

or x = 2×377×10065

or x = 1160

Question 3
The following table shows the number of employees working in five different companies A-E in December, 2021 along with the percentage distribution of Science, Commerce and Arts Graduates among them. Based on the data in the table answer the questions that follow:Company-wise Details of EmployeesCompanyNumber of EmployeesPercentage (%) Distribution of GraduatesScienceCommerceArtsA210032%--B1400-31%40%C-30%30%-D--40%20%E-35%50%-Note:(i)employeesof all the five companies can be categorized only in three types of Graduates, namely, Science, Commerce and Arts.(ii) Some values are missing in the table (indicated by ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if requiredQuestion: In company A, the ratio between the number of employees who are graduates in commerce and Arts is 10 : 7, then the number of employees who are graduates in Arts in the same company is:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.532
  • B.588
  • C.560
  • D.616
Correct Answer: 588

Percentage employees in commerce and arts = 100 – 32 = 68%

Total commerce and arts graduates = 68% of 2100 = 1428

Now As the ratio between commerce and arts graduates is 10 : 7

Arts graduates = 717 × 1428 = 588

Question 4
The following table shows the number of employees working in five different companies A-E in December, 2021 along with the percentage distribution of Science, Commerce and Arts Graduates among them. Based on the data in the table answer the questions that follow:Company-wise Details of EmployeesCompanyNumber of EmployeesPercentage (%) Distribution of GraduatesScienceCommerceArtsA210032%--B1400-31%40%C-30%30%-D--40%20%E-35%50%-Note:(i)employeesof all the five companies can be categorized only in three types of Graduates, namely, Science, Commerce and Arts.(ii) Some values are missing in the table (indicated by ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if requiredQuestion: In company B, if the number of employees increased by 20% from December 2021 to December 2022 and 20% of the total number of employees in December 2022 are Science Graduates, then the number of employees who are Science Graduates in December 2022, is:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.588
  • B.532
  • C.336
  • D.504
Correct Answer: 336

Number of employees in 2022 = 1400 × 1.2 = 1680

Science graduates = 20% of 1680 = 336

Question 5
The following table shows the number of employees working in five different companies A-E in December, 2021 along with the percentage distribution of Science, Commerce and Arts Graduates among them. Based on the data in the table answer the questions that follow:Company-wise Details of EmployeesCompanyNumber of EmployeesPercentage (%) Distribution of GraduatesScienceCommerceArtsA210032%--B1400-31%40%C-30%30%-D--40%20%E-35%50%-Note:(i)employeesof all the five companies can be categorized only in three types of Graduates, namely, Science, Commerce and Arts.(ii) Some values are missing in the table (indicated by ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if requiredQuestion: If the number of employees in company D is 3 times the number of employees in Company C and the difference between the number of employees who are Arts Graduates in Company D and that in company C is 480, then the number of employees in company C is:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.2880
  • B.2640
  • C.1800
  • D.2400
Correct Answer: 2400

Arts graduates in company C = 100 – (30 + 30) = 40%

Let number of employees in company C and D are x and y respectively.

Then, y = 3x ----------(i)

20% of y – 40% of x = 480

or y – 2x = 2400 ----------(ii)

Solving equation (i) and (ii), we get

x = 2400 and y = 7200

Thus, number of employees in company C = 2400

Question 6
Which of the following assessment procedures tests skills abilities as they would be applied in real-life situations?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Formative assessment
  • B.Authentic assessment
  • C.Ipsativeassessment
  • D.Peer assessment
Correct Answer: Authentic assessment

Option B is correct.

Authentic assessment is a type of assessment procedure that evaluates students' skills and abilities by presenting them with tasks or activities that closely resemble real-life situations. These assessments are designed to measure how well students can apply their knowledge and skills in authentic or real-world contexts, rather than simply recalling facts or demonstrating memorized information. It involve tasks such as projects, presentations, case studies, simulations, or performance-based assessments. These tasks require students to demonstrate their understanding, problem-solving abilities, critical thinking skills, creativity, and other competencies in situations that mimic those they might encounter outside of the classroom.

Question 7
Ms.Smith wants to create a mind map for her students to understand the different parts of flowers. Which of the following tools would be most suitable?A.MiroB.CoggleC. PodcastD.MindmeisterE.EdpuzzleChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.C, D and E only
  • B.A and D only
  • C.A, B and D only
  • D.C and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only

Option C is correct.

A mind map is a visual representation of information, ideas, or concepts organized around a central theme. It is an effective tool for organizing and summarizing complex information in a structured and easily understandable format.

Miro is a collaborative online whiteboard platform that allows users to create and collaborate on various types of visualizations, including mind maps. It offers a range of templates and features suitable for creating visually appealing and interactive mind maps.

Coggle is a web-based tool specifically designed for creating mind maps and flowcharts. It offers a simple and intuitive interface, making it easy for users to create, share, and collaborate on mind maps.

Mindmeister is a popular online mind mapping tool that allows users to create, edit, and share mind maps collaboratively. It offers a range of features such as real-time collaboration, presentation mode, and integration with other tools.

Question 8
Which of the following are the elements of cooperative e-learning?A. Individual accountabilityB. Positive interdependenceC.PromotiveinteractionD. Social skillsE. Group processingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C and D only
  • B.B and E only
  • C.D and E only
  • D.A, B, C, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D and E

Option D is correct.

Cooperative e-learning, like traditional cooperative learning, emphasizes collaboration, interaction, and mutual support among learners. The elements of cooperative e-learning are:

Individual accountability: Each learner is responsible for their own learning and contributes actively to the group's success. This ensures that all members are engaged and accountable for their participation and performance.

Positive interdependence: Learners rely on each other to achieve common goals or complete tasks. Success is dependent on the collective effort of the group, fostering collaboration and teamwork.

Promotive interaction: Learners engage in meaningful interactions with each other to exchange ideas, provide support, and construct knowledge collaboratively. This interaction promotes learning and facilitates the sharing of diverse perspectives.

Social skills: Cooperative e-learning emphasizes the development of social skills such as communication, empathy, and conflict resolution. These skills are essential for effective collaboration and contribute to a positive learning environment.

Group processing: Learners reflect on their group dynamics, communication patterns, and problem-solving strategies to identify areas of improvement and enhance their collaborative skills. Group processing helps optimize the effectiveness of cooperative learning experiences.

Question 9
The brain system that provides temporary holding and processing of information to accomplish complex cognitive tasks such as language comprehension, learning and reasoning the information that you are focusing on at a given moment is concerned with(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Episodic memory
  • B.Working memory
  • C.Semantic memory
  • D.Short-term memory
Correct Answer: Working memory

Option B is correct.

Working memory is a cognitive system responsible for temporarily holding and processing information necessary for complex cognitive tasks such as language comprehension, learning, and reasoning. It allows individuals to maintain and manipulate information in their mind over short periods, typically ranging from a few seconds to a minute.

Working memory is a crucial component of executive function, as it involves the active manipulation and control of information. It plays a vital role in various cognitive processes, including problem-solving, decision-making, comprehension, and planning.

Question 10
Given below are two statements:Statement I: The goal of the reciprocal teaching is to help students understand and think deeply what they have read.Statement II: Adaptive teaching provides all students with challenging instructions and uses supports when needed but remove these supports as students become able to handle more on their own.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. Reciprocal teaching is a cooperative learning strategy where students take turns leading a dialogue about the text they are reading. The goal is to improve reading comprehension by actively engaging students in discussing and questioning the text, summarizing key points, clarifying uncertainties, and predicting outcomes. By engaging in these discussions, students deepen their understanding of the text and develop critical thinking skills.

Statement II is also true. Adaptive teaching involves adjusting instruction to meet the varying needs of students. It provides challenging tasks and supports to help students succeed, but these supports are gradually reduced as students demonstrate proficiency and become more independent learners. This approach ensures that all students are appropriately challenged and supported to reach their full potential.

Question 11
Which among the following is NOT a type of Longitudinal Research?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Cross-sectional study
  • B.Trend study
  • C.Prospective study
  • D.Cohort study
Correct Answer: Cross-sectional study

Option A is correct.

Longitudinal research involves studying the same group of individuals over an extended period to observe changes or trends in their behavior, characteristics, or outcomes. It aims to examine the development or progression of phenomena over time.

Cross-sectional study is not a type of longitudinal research. Cross-sectional studies involve collecting data from a population at a single point in time to understand characteristics or relationships at that specific moment. Unlike longitudinal studies, cross-sectional studies do not track changes over time but provide a snapshot of the population at one particular time.

A trend study is a type of longitudinal research where data is collected from different samples of the same population over multiple time points. This allows researchers to observe changes in trends or patterns within the population over time.

Prospective studies, also known as cohort studies, involve identifying a group of individuals (cohort) and following them over time to observe the development of outcomes or events. Researchers collect data on various factors and track participants' progress to determine associations or causality.

Cohort studies are a specific type of prospective study where individuals sharing a common characteristic or experience (such as birth year, exposure to a particular factor) are followed over time to assess outcomes or risks associated with that characteristic or exposure.

Question 12
Which among the following are correct statements about an independent variable?A. It can have at most two levelsB. It can have any number of levelsC. It can be qualitative variableD. It can be quantitative variableChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, C and D only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.B and D only
  • D.A, B and D only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only

Option B is correct.

The statement "It can have any number of levels" is correct. An independent variable can indeed have any number of levels. For example, in a study investigating the effect of dosage on a medication's efficacy, the independent variable (dosage) could have multiple levels (e.g., low, medium, high).

The statement "It can be a qualitative variable" is correct. An independent variable can be qualitative, meaning it represents categories or characteristics that are not numerical in nature. For example, gender (male, female) or type of treatment (drug A, drug B) can be independent variables.

The statement "It can be a quantitative variable" is correct. An independent variable can also be quantitative, meaning it represents numerical values or quantities. For example, age, temperature, or time can be independent variables in a research study.

Question 13
Identify the correct statements on handling of plagiarism as per UGC Regulations 2018 on plagiarisms?A. A higher education institution can initiate proceedings on the basis of findings of an examinerB. A higher education institution cannot takesuomotonotice of an act of plagiarismC. The Departmental Academics Integrity Panel will be headed by the Head of theDpartmentChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.A and C only
  • C.B and C only
  • D.A, B and C
Correct Answer: A and C only

Option B is correct.

The statement "A higher education institution can initiate proceedings on the basis of findings of an examiner" is correct. According to the UGC Regulations 2018 on plagiarism, higher education institutions have the authority to initiate proceedings against individuals accused of plagiarism based on the findings of an examiner. Plagiarism detection can be conducted using various tools and methods, and if plagiarism is detected, the institution can take appropriate action.

The statement "A higher education institution cannot take suo moto notice of an act of plagiarism" is incorrect. A higher education institution can take suo moto notice of an act of plagiarism. Suo moto action refers to action taken by an authority or organization on its own initiative, without a formal complaint or external prompting. If instances of plagiarism come to the attention of the institution through any means, including internal checks, faculty reports, or other sources, the institution has the responsibility to investigate and take action as per the regulations.

The statement "The Departmental Academic Integrity Panel will be headed by the Head of the Department" is correct. According to the UGC Regulations 2018 on plagiarism, each department or discipline within a higher education institution should establish an Academic Integrity Panel to address issues related to academic integrity, including cases of plagiarism. The panel is typically headed by the Head of the Department or an equivalent authority.

Question 14
Given below are two statements:Statement I: When selection procedure is biased, taking a large sample will help reduce a bias.Statement II: In a normally distributed data, the chances of individual observed values deviating more than 3 times the standard deviation from the mean value, are very less.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct

Option D is correct.

Statement I is incorrect. Taking a large sample size does not necessarily reduce bias in the selection procedure. If the selection procedure itself is biased, increasing the sample size may only lead to a larger representation of the biased population. Bias in selection procedures needs to be addressed by ensuring fairness, transparency, and adherence to standardized practices rather than relying solely on sample size.

Statement II is correct. In a normal distribution, approximately 99.7% of the observed values lie within three standard deviations of the mean. This property is known as the empirical rule or the 68-95-99.7 rule, which states that about 68% of the data falls within one standard deviation of the mean, about 95% falls within two standard deviations, and about 99.7% falls within three standard deviations. Therefore, the chances of individual observed values deviating more than 3 times the standard deviation from the mean are indeed very low.

Question 15
Given below are two statements:Statement I: The p-value of a test depends on sample sizeStatement II: An important difference may not be statistically significant if the sample size is too smallIn the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. In statistical hypothesis testing, the p-value is the probability of obtaining the observed results, or more extreme results, if the null hypothesis is true. The p-value is influenced by factors such as the sample size, the magnitude of the effect, and the variability of the data. Generally, larger sample sizes tend to yield smaller p-values, making it easier to reject the null hypothesis if there is a true effect.

Statement II is also true. In statistical hypothesis testing, statistical significance is determined based on both the size of the difference between groups (effect size) and the variability of the data (standard deviation), in addition to the sample size. If the sample size is too small, even a meaningful or important difference between groups may not be statistically significant. This is because small sample sizes have less statistical power to detect true effects, increasing the likelihood of type II errors (false negatives).

Question 16
In terms of communication, story-telling is like performing a(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Social act
  • B.Seasonal act
  • C.Confrontationist act
  • D.Corporate act
Correct Answer: Social act

Option A is correct.

Storytelling is a social act because it involves the exchange of narratives or stories between individuals or within a group. It is a means of communication that has been used throughout human history to convey experiences, values, emotions, and cultural knowledge from one generation to another. When someone tells a story, they are engaging in a form of social interaction, seeking to connect with their audience on an emotional or intellectual level.

Question 17
Subliminal communication is a part of(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Government notification
  • B.Political propaganda
  • C.Legal documentation
  • D.Research reports
Correct Answer: Political propaganda

Option B is correct.

Subliminal communication refers to the transmission of information or messages below the threshold of conscious awareness. It involves subtle cues or stimuli that influence individuals' thoughts, feelings, or behavior without their conscious realization. Subliminal messaging can be employed for various purposes, including advertising, persuasion, or manipulation.

Government notifications involve official announcements or notices issued by governmental authorities to inform the public about laws, regulations, policies, or other administrative matters. Subliminal communication is not typically associated with government notifications.

Political propaganda involves the dissemination of biased or misleading information, often with the intention of influencing public opinion, promoting a particular agenda, or gaining support for a political cause or candidate. Subliminal communication can be used as a tactic within political propaganda to subtly sway voters' opinions or perceptions without their explicit awareness.

Legal documentation refers to written records or documents that are legally binding and used to establish rights, obligations, or agreements between parties. Subliminal communication is not typically relevant within the context of legal documentation.

Research reports present the findings, analysis, and conclusions of research studies conducted in various fields. While research may explore topics related to communication, including subliminal messaging, the inclusion of subliminal communication within research reports would depend on the specific focus and methodology of the study.

Question 18
Which of the following are features of mass communication?A. Face to faceB. PrivateC. PublicD. RapidE. From a professional sourceChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, E only
  • C.C, D, E only
  • D.A, B, E only
Correct Answer: C, D, E only

Option C is correct.

The features of mass communication are:

Public is a key feature of mass communication. Mass communication involves delivering messages to a public audience rather than to individuals or small groups. The goal is to reach as many people as possible with the transmitted information.

Rapid dissemination of information is a feature of mass communication. With advancements in technology and the widespread availability of communication channels, messages can be transmitted quickly to a large audience across vast distances.

Mass communication involves information disseminated from professional sources such as journalists, media organizations, government agencies, or other authoritative sources. These sources produce and distribute content intended for mass consumption and are often associated with credibility and expertise.

Question 19
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Verbal communication becomes more powerful if accompanied by non-verbal messages.Statement II: Non-verbal communication does not reflect personal feelings, emotions and attitudes.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is true. Non-verbal communication, such as body language, facial expressions, gestures, tone of voice, and eye contact, often complements verbal communication and can enhance the effectiveness of the message. Non-verbal cues can provide additional context, emphasis, or emotional cues that support or reinforce the spoken words, making the communication more impactful and memorable.

Statement II is false. Non-verbal communication plays a significant role in expressing and conveying personal feelings, emotions, and attitudes. In fact, non-verbal cues are often more indicative of emotional states and attitudes than verbal expressions. For example, facial expressions, body posture, and gestures can communicate happiness, sadness, anger, confidence, or nervousness without the need for words. Non-verbal communication is a rich and complex system that conveys a wide range of emotional and interpersonal information.

Question 20
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Wilbur Schramm’s model of communication had interpreters acting as both encoders and deciders.Statement II: Wilbur’s Schramm was one of the first scholars to consider communication as an interactive process.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. Wilbur Schramm, a prominent communication theorist, proposed a model of communication that emphasized the role of interpreters as both encoders (those who send messages) and decoders (those who receive and interpret messages). In Schramm's model, communication is a dynamic process involving multiple actors who encode and decode messages, with interpreters playing a central role in facilitating understanding and meaning exchange.

Statement II is also true. Wilbur Schramm is recognized as one of the pioneers in conceptualizing communication as an interactive process. He emphasized the importance of feedback, mutual understanding, and interaction between communicators in the communication process. Schramm's work laid the foundation for the interactive model of communication, which views communication as a dynamic exchange of messages between senders and receivers, with feedback loops shaping the ongoing interaction.

Question 21
In the following letter series, find the next term:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)CCABD, DDBCE,EECDF, …..
  • A.FFDGE
  • B.FFDCE
  • C.FFDEG
  • D.FFDEF
Correct Answer: FFDEG

Next term will be FFDEG.

Question 22
In a certain coding scheme, the word ‘SCHOOL’ is coded as ‘TEKSTR’. How will the word ‘OFTEN’ be coded in the same scheme?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.PHWIS
  • B.PGUFO
  • C.PHVGP
  • D.PHUGO
Correct Answer: PHWIS

Question 23
If the radius of a circle is increased by 10%, its area will increase by:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.10%
  • B.100%
  • C.20%
  • D.21%
Correct Answer: 21%

Area of circle = π r2

New area of circle = π (1.1r)2 = 1.21 π r2

Percentage increase in area = 1.21 π r2- π r2 π r2 × 100 = 21%

Question 24
70% of the cost price of an article is equal to 50% of its selling price. The percentage of profit or loss on the cost price is:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.20% profit
  • B.20% Loss
  • C.40% profit
  • D.40% Loss
Correct Answer: 40% profit

70% CP = 50% SP

or SP = 75 CP

Profit = 75 CP – CP = 25 CP

Profit % = 25 CPCP × 100 = 40%

Question 25
A certain sum of money becomesRs. 1000 in 2 years andRs. 1100 in 4 years at simple rate of interest. The rate of interest per annum is:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.437%
  • B.559%
  • C.747%
  • D.649%
Correct Answer: 559%

1000 – P = P×R×2100

or PR50 = 1000 – P -------------(i)

Also, 1100 – P = P×R×4100

or PR50 = 1000 – P2 -------------(ii)

From equation (i) and (ii), we get

P = Rs. 900

Now, from equation (i)

900R50 = 1000 – 9002

or R = 5 59 %

Question 26
Arrange the following group of terms in order of decreasing intensionA. MammalB. WildcatC. FelineD. AnimalE. VertebrateChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, C, A, E, D
  • B.D, E, A, C, B
  • C.C, B, E, A, D
  • D.D, A, E, B, C
Correct Answer: B, C, A, E, D

Option A is correct.

 

Intension refers to the degree of specificity or the set of attributes or characteristics that define a concept or category. When arranging terms in order of decreasing intension, we're essentially moving from more specific terms to more general terms.

Wildcat is the most specific among the options provided. It refers to a particular type of cat that is wild rather than domesticated.

Feline is more general than "wildcat." It refers to the broader category of cats, encompassing both domestic and wild species.

Mammal is even more general than "feline." It refers to a larger category of animals characterized by features such as having fur or hair and giving birth to live young.

Vertebrate is broader than "mammal" as it refers to animals with a backbone or spinal column. While mammals are vertebrates, not all vertebrates are mammals.

Animal is the most general among the options provided. It encompasses all living organisms that are not plants. It includes mammals, vertebrates, and other categories.

Question 27
Which fallacy is exemplified in the following statements “Of course gun ownership should beprohibited.You can kill someone with a hockey stick but no one proposes to ban ownership of hockey sticks?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Slippery slope
  • B.Weak analogy
  • C.Red Herring
  • D.Straw man
Correct Answer: Weak analogy

Option B is correct answer.

 

The fallacy exemplified in the given statement is (B) Weak analogy.

 

The statement compares gun ownership to owning a hockey stick, suggesting that since both objects can potentially be used to harm others, they should be treated the same way. However, this analogy is weak because it ignores the significant differences between guns and hockey sticks in terms of their primary purposes, the ease and efficiency with which they can cause harm, and the regulations surrounding their use.

 

Therefore, the argument fails to provide a valid comparison and distracts from the real issues surrounding gun ownership by introducing an unrelated analogy. This is why it represents the Weak Analogy fallacy.

Question 28
“No poets are scientists. Some artists are poets. Therefore some artists are scientists.”.Which formal fallacy is committed in this argument?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Denying the antecedent
  • B.Exclusive premises
  • C.Fallacy of drawing an affirmative conclusion from a negative premise
  • D.Existential fallacy
Correct Answer: Fallacy of drawing an affirmative conclusion from a negative premise

The formal fallacy committed in the argument is (C) Fallacy of drawing an affirmative conclusion from a negative premise.

 

Let's break down the argument:

 

No poets are scientists. (Negative premise)

Some artists are poets. (Affirmative premise)

From these premises, the conclusion drawn is: Therefore, some artists are scientists. (Affirmative conclusion)

 

This argument commits the fallacy of drawing an affirmative conclusion from a negative premise because it attempts to conclude something positive (that some artists are scientists) from premises that contain a negative statement (that no poets are scientists). The conclusion goes beyond what can be logically deduced from the premises, making it invalid.

Question 29
Given below are two statements:Statement I:The form of inductive argument is evaluated in degrees of likelihood or probability.Statement II:A strong inductive argument that has all the true premises is called a ‘cogent’ argument.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct

Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.

Question 30
Which of the following arrangements involve fallacy of the irregular middle term?A. Sound is a quality because it is visibleB. Sound is eternal because it is audibleC. Sound is eternal because it is producedD. All things are non-external because they are knowableChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B and D only
  • C.B and C only
  • D.A, B and D only
Correct Answer: B and D only

Savyabhichära or Anaikäntika: This is the fallacy of the irregular middle. It is of three kinds:-

 

(a) Sädharana: Here the middle term is too wide. It is present in both the sapaksa (positive) and the vipaksa (negative) instances and violates the rule that the middle should not be present in the negative instances (vipaksäsattva); e.g., ‘the hill has fire because it is knowable’. Here ‘knowable is present in fiery as well as non-fiery objects.

(b) Asädhärana: Here the middle term is too narrow. It is present only in the paksa and neither in the sapaksa nor in the vipaksa. It violates the rule that the middle term should be present in the sapaksa (sapaksasattva); e.g., ‘sound is eternal, because it is audible. Here audibility belongs to sound only and is present nowhere else.

(c) Anupasamhäri : Here the middle term is non-exclusive. The minor term is all-inclusive and leaves nothing by way of sapaksa or vipaksa; e.g., 'all things are non-eternal, because they are knowable’.

Question 31
Clickjacking, a type ofcyber attackis(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A device that sends and receives data at every click in a bit per second
  • B.A device which counts clicks on internet
  • C.A malicious technique of tricking web users into revealing confidential information
  • D.A digital process that is used to display an image on mobile
Correct Answer: A malicious technique of tricking web users into revealing confidential information

Option C is correct.

Clickjacking is a type of cyber-attack where a malicious actor tricks web users into clicking on something different from what they perceive, potentially revealing confidential information, granting unauthorized permissions, or performing unintended actions.

Clickjacking involves hiding malicious content or buttons under seemingly innocuous elements, such as clickable images or invisible overlays, on a web page.

When users interact with the visible elements, they unintentionally perform actions on the hidden, malicious elements.

These actions can include clicking on buttons to authorize transactions, sharing sensitive information, installing malware, or hijacking the user's session.

Clickjacking attacks exploit the trust users have in legitimate websites by deceiving them into performing actions they did not intend to take.

Question 32
Given below are two statementsStatement I: Google Drive is an extension of Google docs and provides cloud storage services.Statement II:icloudis a cloud storage service provided by Apple.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. Google Drive is an extension of Google Docs, which allows users to store, synchronize, and share files and folders across devices via cloud storage. It is integrated with Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, and other Google Workspace applications, offering users a centralized platform for creating, editing, and collaborating on documents while also providing storage for various file types.

Statement II is also true. iCloud is Apple's cloud storage and computing service that enables users to store data such as documents, photos, videos, and music securely in the cloud and access them across Apple devices like iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Windows computers. iCloud also offers features such as device backup, synchronization of contacts, calendars, and reminders, and seamless integration with Apple's ecosystem of apps and services.

Question 33
Given below are two statementsStatement I: A cookie is a packet of information sent by a web browser to a web server.Statement II: Spam can ‘clog up’ a user’s inbox with unwanted emails, it can also lead to phishing attacks.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Option D is correct.

Statement I is false. Cookies are small pieces of data stored on the user's computer by websites they visit. They are primarily used to remember user-specific information such as login credentials, site preferences, shopping cart contents, and browsing history. Cookies are sent from the web server to the user's browser and stored locally on the user's device, not the other way around as stated in the statement.

Statement II is true. Spam refers to unsolicited, unwanted, or irrelevant messages sent in bulk via email. Spam emails can inundate a user's inbox, making it difficult to identify and manage legitimate messages. Moreover, spam emails often contain malicious links or attachments that may lead to phishing attacks, where attackers attempt to deceive users into revealing sensitive information such as passwords, financial details, or personal information.

Question 34
Which of the following accurately describes the COUNTIF function in Excel?
  • A.It counts the number of cells in a range that meet multiple criteria.
  • B.It counts the number of cells in a range that meet a single criterion.
  • C.It calculates the total sum of cells in a range that meet specific conditions.
  • D.It calculates the average value of cells in a range that meet certain criteria.
Correct Answer: It counts the number of cells in a range that meet a single criterion.

Option B is the correct answer.

It counts the number of cells in a range that meet a single criterion.

Question 35
Match List IwithList IILIST I (Computer terms)(a)Tweening(b) Morphing(c) Rendering(d) Virtual realityLIST II (Definition)(i) The procedure where one image is changed into another image in a smooth way (usestweeningto give the transition effect)(ii) Artificially created environment(iii) The generation of intermediate frames between images gives the impression that that first image evolves slowly into the second image(iv) The generation of an image from a model using softwareChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.(a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
  • B.(a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(iii)
  • C.(a)-(i), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
  • D.(a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)

Option D is correct.

Tweening - The generation of intermediate frames between images gives the impression that the first image evolves slowly into the second image. This is typically used in animation to create smooth transitions between keyframes.

Morphing - The procedure where one image is changed into another image in a smooth way. Morphing often uses tweening to give the transition effect, resulting in a seamless transformation between images.

Rendering - The generation of an image from a model using software. In computer graphics, rendering involves the process of creating a final image from a 3D model by calculating lighting, shading, texture mapping, and other visual effects.

Virtual reality - Artificially created environment that is experienced through sensory stimuli provided by a computer, typically through a headset or other immersive technology. Virtual reality environments are designed to simulate real-world experiences or create entirely fictional worlds.

Question 36
PyrolysisA. is a biochemical conversion processB. is useful for production of bio oilC. yields minimum wasteD. liquid is a good substitute of heating oilE. can produce EthanolChoose the correct answer from the options given below(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, C, D
  • C.B, C, D, E
  • D.A, D, E
Correct Answer: B, C, D

Option B is correct.

Pyrolysis is a thermal decomposition process that occurs in the absence of oxygen. It involves heating organic materials such as biomass, plastic, or rubber to high temperatures, causing them to break down into simpler molecules.

Pyrolysis is useful for the production of bio-oil. Bio-oil, also known as pyrolysis oil or bio-crude, is one of the main products of pyrolysis. It can be further refined into biofuels such as biodiesel or used directly as a fuel or feedstock for chemical processes.

Pyrolysis does not yield minimum waste. While it can be a relatively efficient process for converting biomass into useful products, it still generates solid residues such as char or ash, as well as gases and volatile compounds. Efforts are made to minimize waste generation and maximize product yields, but some waste is typically produced.

The liquid product of pyrolysis, bio-oil, can indeed be a good substitute for heating oil. Bio-oil has similar properties to fossil-based heating oils and can be used in boilers, furnaces, or other heating applications with minimal modifications.

Question 37
Electrostatic Precipitators are used to control(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Air pollution
  • B.Water pollution
  • C.Soil pollution
  • D.Noise pollution
Correct Answer: Air pollution

Option A is correct.

Electrostatic precipitators (ESPs) are devices used to control air pollution, particularly the emission of particulate matter (PM) into the atmosphere.

Particulate matter, such as dust, ash, smoke, or other fine particles, is generated from various industrial processes, combustion activities, or other sources.

These particulates are carried by the air and released into the atmosphere through chimneys or exhaust stacks.

Electrostatic precipitators are installed in the exhaust systems of industrial facilities, power plants, and other sources of air pollution.

Inside the ESP, electrically charged plates or electrodes are used to impart a negative charge to the particulate matter as it passes through the device.

The negatively charged particles are then attracted to positively charged collection plates or electrodes, causing them to adhere to the plates and be removed from the airflow.

Clean air exits the ESP, while the collected particulates are periodically removed from the collection plates and disposed of properly.

By effectively removing particulate matter from industrial emissions, electrostatic precipitators help to reduce air pollution and mitigate its adverse impacts on public health and the environment.

Question 38
Amongst the following Green House Gases (GHGs), whose Global Warming Potential (GWP) is considered as 1?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Chlorofluorocarbon (CFC)
  • B.Nitrous oxide (N2O)
  • C.Carbon dioxide (CO2)
  • D.Methane (CH4)
Correct Answer: Carbon dioxide (CO2)

Option C is correct.

Global Warming Potential (GWP) is a measure used to compare the potency of different greenhouse gases (GHGs) in terms of their ability to trap heat in the atmosphere relative to carbon dioxide (CO2), which is assigned a GWP of 1.

GWP quantifies the impact of a particular GHG on global warming over a specific time period, usually 100 years, relative to the impact of CO2 over the same period. For example, methane (CH4) has a GWP of around 28-36 over a 100-year period, meaning it is 28-36 times more potent than CO2 in terms of its heat-trapping ability. Nitrous oxide (N2O) has a GWP of about 265-298 over the same time frame.

Question 39
Given below are two statementsStatement I: Some people suffer from what is called as Sick Building Syndrome (SBS)Statement II: SBS is caused due to supply of polluted water in particular buildingIn the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect

Option C is correct.

Statement I is correct. Sick Building Syndrome (SBS) is a phenomenon where occupants of a building experience various non-specific symptoms of discomfort or illness, such as headaches, fatigue, irritation of the eyes, nose, or throat, and respiratory issues. These symptoms often occur when individuals spend time in a particular building but alleviate when they leave. SBS is typically attributed to poor indoor air quality, inadequate ventilation, high levels of indoor pollutants, or other environmental factors within the building.

Statement II is incorrect. Sick Building Syndrome (SBS) is primarily associated with indoor air quality issues rather than polluted water supply. While poor water quality can lead to health issues such as gastrointestinal problems, it is not considered a direct cause of Sick Building Syndrome. SBS symptoms are more commonly linked to factors such as inadequate ventilation, indoor pollutants from building materials, furnishings, or cleaning products, as well as biological contaminants such as mold or bacteria.

Question 40
United National Conference on Environment and Development that was held in 1992 at Rio de Janeiro is also known as:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Ozone Summit
  • B.Conference on human environment
  • C.Earth Summit
  • D.Conference on wetlands
Correct Answer: Earth Summit

Option C is correct.

The United Nations Conference on Environment and Development (UNCED), held in 1992 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, is commonly referred to as the Earth Summit. This significant event brought together world leaders, policymakers, scientists, environmentalists, and representatives from non-governmental organizations (NGOs) to address pressing environmental and sustainable development issues facing the planet.

Question 41
According to NEP 2020, as a response to contemporary global challenges ‘Global Citizenship Education’ will be provided to learners to become active promoters of _______ societies?A. tolerantB. peacefulC. inclusiveD. secureE. sustainableChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, C and E
  • B.A and C
  • C.A, B, C, D and E
  • D.B, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D and E

Option C is correct.

According to the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, Global Citizenship Education aims to equip learners with the knowledge, skills, and values necessary to address contemporary global challenges and become active promoters of tolerant, peaceful, inclusive, secure, and sustainable societies.

Global Citizenship Education seeks to foster tolerance and respect for diversity among learners, enabling them to appreciate and embrace differences in culture, religion, ethnicity, and worldview.

Learners are encouraged to understand the importance of peace building and conflict resolution at local, national, and international levels, promoting a culture of peace and non-violence.

The education provided under Global Citizenship Education promotes inclusivity and social cohesion, ensuring that all individuals, regardless of background or identity, have equal access to rights, opportunities, and resources.

Learners are educated about global challenges such as terrorism, extremism, and cyber threats, empowering them to contribute to efforts aimed at enhancing security and stability in their communities and beyond.

Global Citizenship Education emphasizes the importance of sustainability and environmental stewardship, encouraging learners to adopt lifestyles and practices that promote ecological balance, conservation of natural resources, and climate resilience.

Question 42
According to NEP 2020, assessments of educational approaches in undergraduate education integrating humanities and arts with which of the following disciplines have consistently shown positive learning outcomes?A. ScienceB. MathematicsC. TechnologyD. Mass mediaE. EngineeringChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C and D
  • B.B and C
  • C.A, D and E
  • D.C, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D

Option A is correct.

According to the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, assessments of educational approaches in undergraduate education that integrate humanities and arts with disciplines such as Science, Mathematics, Technology, and Mass media have consistently shown positive learning outcomes.

Integration of humanities and arts with science disciplines has shown positive learning outcomes. This interdisciplinary approach helps students develop critical thinking skills, creativity, and a deeper understanding of scientific concepts by exploring their social, cultural, and ethical dimensions.

Incorporating humanities and arts into mathematics education has been found to enhance students' problem-solving abilities, communication skills, and appreciation for the historical and cultural context of mathematical concepts.

Integrating humanities and arts with technology education can foster innovation, collaboration, and a holistic understanding of the societal impact of technological advancements. It encourages students to consider ethical, cultural, and humanistic perspectives in technology development and application.

Incorporating humanities and arts into mass media studies can provide students with a broader understanding of media's role in society, including its cultural, political, and ethical implications. It encourages critical analysis, media literacy, and creative expression.

Question 43
Which of the following are the encompassing principles underlying the successful implementations of value education?A. AptitudeB. EthicsC. Critical thinkingD. CommitmentE. CourageChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B and D only
  • B.B, C and E only
  • C.A, B, D and E only
  • D.A, B, C and E only
Correct Answer: B and D only

Option A is the correct answer.

Question 44
The Hunter Commission recommended the withdrawal of government support to :(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Collegiate education
  • B.Adult education
  • C.Moral education
  • D.Primary education
Correct Answer: Collegiate education

Option A is correct.

The Hunter Commission also known as the Indian Universities Commission, was appointed by the British Government in India in 1882 to review the state of higher education in India and make recommendations for its improvement.

One of the key recommendations made by the Hunter Commission was regarding collegiate education. The commission suggested that the government should gradually withdraw its support from collegiate education. This recommendation was based on the belief that the financial burden of collegiate education should be gradually shifted from the government to the private sector and local bodies.

The Hunter Commission's recommendation regarding collegiate education aimed to encourage greater autonomy and accountability among educational institutions, as well as to promote private investment and philanthropy in the development of higher education.

Question 45
Given below are two statementsStatement I: In ancient times,Nalandaattained greatest and most brilliant achievements in thefiledof logicStatement II: Each professor inNalandahad charge of one subject onlyIn the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct

Option A is correct.

Statement I is correct. Nalanda University, located in present-day Bihar, India, was one of the world's earliest universities and was renowned for its contributions to various fields of knowledge, including logic, philosophy, mathematics, astronomy, and medicine. Nalanda was a center of learning and scholarship from around the 5th century CE to the 12th century CE, and it attracted students and scholars from various parts of the world.

Statement II is also correct. Nalanda University had a unique organizational structure where each professor (often referred to as Acharya) specialized in one particular subject or field of study. This specialization allowed for in-depth teaching and research within specific disciplines and contributed to the university's reputation for excellence in various areas of knowledge.

Question 46
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions given below:Firefighters are often asked to speak to school and community groups about the importance of fire safety, particularly fire prevention and detection. Because smoke detectors reduce the risk of dying in a fire by half, firefighters often provide audiences with information on how to install these protective devices in their homes. Specifically, they tell them these things: A smoke detector should be placed emergent fire, and there must be a detector outside each sleeping area. A good site for a detector would be a hallway that runs between living spaces and bedrooms. Because of the dead-air space that might be missed by turbulent hot air bouncing around above a fire, smoke detectors should be installed either on the ceiling at least four inches from the nearest wall, or high on a wall at least four, but no further than twelve, inches from the ceiling.Detectors should not be mounted near windows, exterior doors, or other places where drafts might direct the smoke away from the unit. Nor should they be placed in kitchens and garages, where cooking and gas fumes are likely to cause false alarms.What is the main focus of this passage? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.How firefighters carry out their responsibilities
  • B.The proper installation of home smoke detectors
  • C.The detection of dead-air space on walls and ceiling
  • D.How smoke detectors prevent fires in homes
Correct Answer: The proper installation of home smoke detectors

Option B is correct.

As per the passage, the main focus is on the proper installation of home smoke detectors.

Question 47
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions given below:Firefighters are often asked to speak to school and community groups about the importance of fire safety, particularly fire prevention and detection. Because smoke detectors reduce the risk of dying in a fire by half, firefighters often provide audiences with information on how to install these protective devices in their homes. Specifically, they tell them these things: A smoke detector should be placed emergent fire, and there must be a detector outside each sleeping area. A good site for a detector would be a hallway that runs between living spaces and bedrooms. Because of the dead-air space that might be missed by turbulent hot air bouncing around above a fire, smoke detectors should be installed either on the ceiling at least four inches from the nearest wall, or high on a wall at least four, but no further than twelve, inches from the ceiling.Detectors should not be mounted near windows, exterior doors, or other places where drafts might direct the smoke away from the unit. Nor should they be placed in kitchens and garages, where cooking and gas fumes are likely to cause false alarms.The passage indicates that one of the responsibilities of a firefighter is to: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.install smoke detectors in the homes of residents in the community
  • B.check homes to see if smoke detectors have been properly installed
  • C.develop fire safety programmes for community leaders and school, teachers
  • D.speak to school groups about the importance of preventing fires
Correct Answer: speak to school groups about the importance of preventing fires

Option D is correct.

As per the passage, one of the responsibilities of a firefighter is to speak to school groups about the importance of preventing fires

Question 48
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions given below:Firefighters are often asked to speak to school and community groups about the importance of fire safety, particularly fire prevention and detection. Because smoke detectors reduce the risk of dying in a fire by half, firefighters often provide audiences with information on how to install these protective devices in their homes. Specifically, they tell them these things: A smoke detector should be placed emergent fire, and there must be a detector outside each sleeping area. A good site for a detector would be a hallway that runs between living spaces and bedrooms. Because of the dead-air space that might be missed by turbulent hot air bouncing around above a fire, smoke detectors should be installed either on the ceiling at least four inches from the nearest wall, or high on a wall at least four, but no further than twelve, inches from the ceiling.Detectors should not be mounted near windows, exterior doors, or other places where drafts might direct the smoke away from the unit. Nor should they be placed in kitchens and garages, where cooking and gas fumes are likely to cause false alarms.The passage states that, compared with people who do not have smoke detectors, persons who live in homes with smoke detectors have a (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.50% better chance of surviving a fire
  • B.50% better chance of preventing a fire
  • C.75% better chance of detecting a hidden fire
  • D.100% better chance of not getting injured in a fire
Correct Answer: 50% better chance of surviving a fire

Option A is correct.

As per the passage, the passage states that, compared with people who do not have smoke detectors, persons who live in homes with smoke detectors have a 50% better chance of surviving a fire.

Question 49
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions given below:Firefighters are often asked to speak to school and community groups about the importance of fire safety, particularly fire prevention and detection. Because smoke detectors reduce the risk of dying in a fire by half, firefighters often provide audiences with information on how to install these protective devices in their homes. Specifically, they tell them these things: A smoke detector should be placed emergent fire, and there must be a detector outside each sleeping area. A good site for a detector would be a hallway that runs between living spaces and bedrooms. Because of the dead-air space that might be missed by turbulent hot air bouncing around above a fire, smoke detectors should be installed either on the ceiling at least four inches from the nearest wall, or high on a wall at least four, but no further than twelve, inches from the ceiling.Detectors should not be mounted near windows, exterior doors, or other places where drafts might direct the smoke away from the unit. Nor should they be placed in kitchens and garages, where cooking and gas fumes are likely to cause false alarms.A smoke detector should not be installed near a window because (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Outside fumes may trigger a false alarm
  • B.A draft may create dead-air space
  • C.A draft may pull smoke away from the detector
  • D.Outside noise may muffle the sound of detector
Correct Answer: A draft may pull smoke away from the detector

Option C is correct.

As per the passage, a smoke detector should not be installed near a window because a draft may pull smoke away from the detector.

Question 50
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions given below:Firefighters are often asked to speak to school and community groups about the importance of fire safety, particularly fire prevention and detection. Because smoke detectors reduce the risk of dying in a fire by half, firefighters often provide audiences with information on how to install these protective devices in their homes. Specifically, they tell them these things: A smoke detector should be placed emergent fire, and there must be a detector outside each sleeping area. A good site for a detector would be a hallway that runs between living spaces and bedrooms. Because of the dead-air space that might be missed by turbulent hot air bouncing around above a fire, smoke detectors should be installed either on the ceiling at least four inches from the nearest wall, or high on a wall at least four, but no further than twelve, inches from the ceiling.Detectors should not be mounted near windows, exterior doors, or other places where drafts might direct the smoke away from the unit. Nor should they be placed in kitchens and garages, where cooking and gas fumes are likely to cause false alarms.A smoke detector must always be placed (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.outside at least one of the bedroom on any levels of the home
  • B.outside all bedrooms in a home
  • C.in all hallways of a home
  • D.in kitchens where fires are mostly likely to start
Correct Answer: outside all bedrooms in a home

Option B is correct.

As per the passage, a smoke detector must always be placed outside all bedrooms in a home
