Question 1
Consider the following table which contains number of newspapers printed (within bracket) in each printing press and number of newspaper distributed in a day in a particular city. Question 3
Consider the following table which contains number of newspapers printed (within bracket) in each printing press and number of newspaper distributed in a day in a particular city. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follows:Newspaper CityNewspaper (W) (5000)Newspaper (X) (10000)Newspaper (Y) (10000)Newspaper (Z) (5000)City 11500300035001000City 21000350030001000City 350015001500500City 450010005001500Question: Which newspaper has highest percentage of distribution?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Newspaper Z
  • B.Newspaper W
  • C.Newspaper Y
  • D.Newspaper X
Correct Answer: Newspaper X

Percentage distribution of Newspaper W = 35005000 × 100 = 70%

Percentage distribution of Newspaper X = 900010000 × 100 = 90%

Percentage distribution of Newspaper Y = 850010000 × 100 = 85%

Percentage distribution of Newspaper W = 40005000 × 100 = 80%

Thus, newspaper X has highest percentage of distribution.

Question 5

Question 6
Teachers use Mnemonics strategies for students to engage in(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Scientific inquiry
  • B.Memorizing and assimilating information
  • C.Testing of hypothesis
  • D.Problem solving and writing activities
Correct Answer: Memorizing and assimilating information

Option B is correct.

Mnemonics strategies are memory aids or techniques that help individuals remember information more effectively. These strategies involve encoding information in a way that is easier to remember, such as through the use of acronyms, rhymes etc.

Teachers often use mnemonics strategies to help students memorize and assimilate information more efficiently. By providing mnemonic devices, educators can assist students in retaining and recalling facts, concepts, and procedures, thereby enhancing their learning experience.

While mnemonics may indirectly support other cognitive processes such as problem-solving and writing activities by aiding in the recall of relevant information, their primary purpose is to facilitate memorization and assimilation of information.

Question 7
Given below are two statementsStatement I: To teach a concept to students, its defining attributes have to be very clearStatement II: Concepts defined by the presence of one or more attributes are called disjunctive conceptsIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is true. When teaching a concept, clarity regarding its defining attributes is essential for effective instruction. Clear understanding of the attributes helps students grasp the concept more easily and apply it accurately in different contexts.

Statement II is false. Concepts defined by the presence of one or more attributes are actually referred to as conjunctive concepts. Disjunctive concepts, on the other hand, are defined by the presence of one or more alternative attributes.

Question 8
In the context of Special Needs Education identify the ICT tools from the followingA. BrailleB. Flash discsC. Head wandsD. Text magnifierE.PoppletChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, C, E only
  • B.A, C, E only
  • C.A, B, E only
  • D.A, C, D only
Correct Answer: A, C, D only

Option D is correct.

Braille is a tactile writing system used by individuals with visual impairments. It allows them to read and write through touch. Braille materials can be created using various ICT tools such as Braille embossers or refreshable Braille displays.

Head wands are assistive devices used by individuals with physical disabilities, particularly those who have limited mobility in their hands or arms. They enable users to interact with computers or communication devices by moving their heads to control a pointer or make selections. Head wands are a type of ICT tool designed to enhance accessibility for students with physical challenges.

Text magnifiers, also known as screen magnification software or devices, are ICT tools used to enlarge text and images displayed on a computer screen. They are beneficial for individuals with visual impairments or those who have difficulty reading small print. Text magnifiers help students with visual challenges to access digital content more effectively.

Question 9
In a learner centred teaching environment studentsA. actively participate in their own learningB. are passive listenersC. are considered as having similar abilitiesD. make decisions about what and how they will learnChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and C only
  • B.A, B and C only
  • C.A, C and D only
  • D.A and D only
Correct Answer: A and D only

Option D is correct.

In a learner-centered teaching environment, the focus is on facilitating active engagement and autonomy among students.

Actively participate in their own learning is a fundamental principle of learner-centered teaching. In such an environment, students are encouraged to actively engage in their learning process through various activities, discussions, projects, and collaborative tasks. They take ownership of their learning and are actively involved in exploring concepts, asking questions, and seeking understanding.

In a learner-centered teaching environment, students are empowered to make decisions regarding their learning. They have opportunities to choose topics of interest, set learning goals, select learning resources, and determine the strategies they will use to achieve their objectives. This autonomy fosters intrinsic motivation and a sense of ownership over the learning process.

Question 10
According to UGC guidelines on structure and implementations of Choice Based Credit System (CBCS), the letter grade ‘B’ obtained by a student in a course corresponds to ‘grade point’ of(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.4
  • B.5
  • C.6
  • D.7
Correct Answer: 6

Option C is correct.

In the CBCS framework, grades are assigned to students based on their performance in courses, and each grade corresponds to a specific grade point. The letter grades typically range from A+ to E, with A+ being the highest and E being the lowest.

According to UGC guidelines on structure and implementations of Choice Based Credit System (CBCS), the letter grade ‘B’ obtained by a student in a course corresponds to ‘grade point’ of 6.

Question 11
Which research method is used to identify cause-effect relations and test possible explanations for effects?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Correlational
  • B.Ethnography
  • C.Case studies
  • D.Experimental
Correct Answer: Experimental

Option D is correct.

Experimental research is the method used to identify cause-effect relations and test possible explanations for effects. In experimental research, the researcher manipulates one or more independent variables to observe the effect on one or more dependent variables, while controlling for extraneous variables. This manipulation allows researchers to establish a cause-and-effect relationship between variables.

Question 12
To conduct a research based on an in-depth of ten classrooms, select the classes with fewest behaviour problems, then expose low teachers in those classes established a positive learning climate by interviewing teachers and students and analysing video made at the beginning of school session, which research method is to be selected for this purpose?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Correlational
  • B.Ethnography
  • C.Case studies
  • D.Experimental
Correct Answer: Ethnography

Option B is correct.

Ethnography is a qualitative research method that involves the in-depth study of a particular culture or social group through participant observation and interviews. It focuses on understanding the complex interactions, behaviors, and beliefs within a specific context.

Ethnography involves conducting detailed, immersive research within a specific setting or community. In this scenario, the researcher aims to conduct an in-depth study of ten classrooms to understand the dynamics of behavior problems and the establishment of a positive learning climate.

Ethnography involves the researcher spending significant time in the field, observing and interacting with participants in their natural environment. In this scenario, the researcher would observe classroom interactions, behaviors, and the learning environment firsthand to gain a comprehensive understanding.

Ethnographic research includes conducting interviews with key stakeholders, such as teachers and students, to gather their perspectives, experiences, and insights. The researcher would interview teachers and students to understand their views on behavior problems, classroom climate, teaching strategies, and the impact of interventions.

Ethnography involve analyzing various artifacts, such as videos, photographs, documents, and other materials, to complement observations and interviews. In this scenario, analyzing videos made at the beginning of the school session can provide valuable insights into classroom dynamics and changes over time.

Ethnography emphasizes understanding social phenomena within their cultural and contextual contexts. By immersing themselves in the classroom environment, the researcher can gain a rich, nuanced understanding of behavior problems and the establishment of a positive learning climate.

Question 13
Which among the following are the forms of realism in the context of research?A. EmpiricalB. CriticalC. SemioticsD. OrdinalChoose the correct answer from the given options below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.C and D only
  • D.A and C only
Correct Answer: A and B only

Option A is correct.

Realism is a philosophical perspective that emphasizes the existence of an objective reality independent of human perception or interpretation. In the context of research, realism can manifest in various forms.

Empirical realism refers to the belief that reality exists independently of human perception and can be observed and studied through empirical methods. Empirical research relies on evidence gathered from direct observation or experimentation to support or refute hypotheses. This form of realism aligns with the scientific method and emphasizes the importance of empirical evidence in understanding reality.

Critical realism goes beyond mere observation of phenomena and seeks to uncover deeper underlying structures and mechanisms that shape reality. It acknowledges that reality may be influenced by social, cultural, and historical contexts and aims to critically analyze these influences. Critical realism encourages researchers to question assumptions, challenge power dynamics, and explore the complexities of social phenomena.

Question 14
Given below are two statementsStatement I: The ethics committee does not ask the researchers to indicate whether their research entails certain procedures or activities which are often derived from professional guidelines.Statement II: Ethical issues can and do not arise at all stages of a research process.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect

Option B is correct.

Statement I is incorrect. Ethics committees or Institutional Review Boards (IRBs) do indeed require researchers to provide detailed information about the procedures and activities involved in their research. This includes indicating whether the research follows professional guidelines and ethical standards. Ethics committees play a crucial role in ensuring that research involving human participants adheres to ethical principles and guidelines.

Statement II is also incorrect. Ethical issues can indeed arise at various stages of the research process, including during the planning, data collection, analysis, and dissemination phases. Researchers must be vigilant and proactive in identifying and addressing ethical concerns to protect the rights and well-being of participants and ensure the integrity of the research.

Question 15
Which among the following software are used for data analysis in research?A. SPSSB. Microsoft TeamsC. Microsoft ExcelD.PreziE. PSPPChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.A, C, E only
  • C.B, D, E only
  • D.C, D, E only
Correct Answer: A, C, E only

Option B is correct.

Data analysis in research often requires specialized software tools designed to handle and analyze large datasets efficiently.

SPSS (Statistical Package for the Social Sciences) is a widely used software package for statistical analysis in social sciences and other fields. It provides a range of statistical procedures and techniques for data manipulation, exploration, and presentation. Researchers often use SPSS for tasks such as descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and data visualization

Microsoft Excel is a spreadsheet software that is commonly used for data entry, organization, and basic analysis. While Excel offers some basic statistical functions and data visualization capabilities, it is not as robust as dedicated statistical software like SPSS. Nonetheless, Excel can be useful for simple data analysis tasks or preliminary data exploration.

PSPP is a free and open-source alternative to SPSS, providing similar functionality for statistical analysis. It offers a range of statistical procedures and data manipulation tools, making it suitable for researchers who require statistical analysis capabilities but prefer open-source software solutions.

Question 16
In communication, personal meaning of information tends to be(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Critical
  • B.Passive
  • C.Objective
  • D.Subjective
Correct Answer: Subjective

Option D is correct.

Subjective refers to personal opinions, feelings, or interpretations that are influenced by individual experiences, beliefs, and biases. In communication, personal meaning is often subjective because it is shaped by the unique perspectives and interpretations of individuals. Different people may derive different meanings from the same information based on their subjective experiences and perceptions.

Question 17
Which of the following are essential for successful classroom communication?A. Define the purposeB. Opt for pretensionsC. Use un-risky humourD. Avoid rehearsalsE. Repeat speech-tagsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, C and E only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.A, B and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and E only

Option A is correct.

For successful classroom communication, the following are essential:

Defining the purpose of communication is crucial for successful classroom communication. When teachers clearly articulate the objectives, goals, and expectations of a lesson or activity, students understand the relevance and focus of the communication. This clarity helps students engage more effectively and facilitates learning outcomes.

Humor can be an effective tool for building rapport, reducing tension, and enhancing engagement in the classroom. However, it's essential to use humor that is safe, inoffensive, and unlikely to cause discomfort or offense to students. "Un-risky humor" refers to humor that is appropriate for the classroom environment and respects the diversity of students' backgrounds and sensitivities.

In classroom communication, particularly during discussions or presentations, it can be helpful to attribute speech to specific individuals using speech-tags or dialogue tags. This attribution enhances clarity and comprehension, ensuring that students understand who is speaking. Repetition of speech-tags can aid in tracking dialogue and following the conversation, especially in larger classroom settings or when multiple voices are involved.

Question 18
Given below are two statementsStatement I: Sometimes effects of communication are simple and directStatement II: Depending upon the context, effects of communication many times are complex and controlledIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. In certain situations, the effects of communication can indeed be straightforward and easy to understand. For example, a clear instruction or a simple message may lead to a direct response from the recipient without much complexity.

Statement II is also true. The effects of communication can vary significantly depending on various factors such as the context, the individuals involved, the message content, and the communication channels used. In some contexts, the effects of communication may be complex, influenced by multiple factors, and difficult to predict. Additionally, communication may be intentionally controlled or manipulated in certain situations to achieve specific outcomes.

Question 19
The correct sequence of following models of communication isA. Linear modelB. Helical modelC. Aristotelian modelD. Circular modelChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.C, A, D, B
  • C.B, D, A, C
  • D.D, A, C, B
Correct Answer: C, A, D, B

Option B is correct.

Aristotelian model is also known as the classical model, originates from the work of the Greek philosopher Aristotle. It conceptualizes communication as consisting of three key elements: the speaker (orator), the message, and the audience. In this model, communication is seen as a linear process where the speaker delivers a message to the audience. This model is foundational in understanding the basic elements of communication.

The linear model of communication, also known as the transmission model, depicts communication as a one-way process where a sender sends a message through a channel to a receiver. It emphasizes the flow of information from the sender to the receiver, with little emphasis on feedback or interaction. This model is simplistic and does not fully capture the complexities of communication dynamics.

The circular model of communication, also known as the transactional model, views communication as an ongoing and dynamic process where both the sender and receiver simultaneously act as senders and receivers. Communication is seen as circular rather than linear, with continuous feedback and interaction between the parties involved. This model recognizes the role of context, feedback, and mutual influence in communication exchanges.

The helical model of communication, proposed by Frank Dance, builds upon the linear and circular models by introducing the concept of spiraling communication. It acknowledges that communication interactions may initially follow a linear path but gradually spiral outward as participants gain mutual understanding and develop deeper levels of engagement. The helical model emphasizes the importance of context, culture, and relationship dynamics in shaping communication outcomes.

Question 20
Match List I with the List IILIST I (Communication context)(a) Physical(b) Cultural(c) Socio-Psychological(d) TemporalLIST II (Characteristic)(i) Deals with status relationship(ii) Messages position within a sequence of events(iii) Tangible environment(iv) Involves valuesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.(a)-(i), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
  • B.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
  • D.(a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)

Option C is correct.

Physical refers to the tangible environment in which communication takes place, such as the physical surroundings, setting, or location correctly matches with tangible environment which refers to communication within the physical context involves the immediate surroundings and the physical elements present.

Cultural pertains to the shared values, beliefs, norms, and practices of a particular group or society and it involves values. Cultural context influences communication by shaping individuals' values and cultural norms, which impact how messages are perceived and interpreted.

Socio-Psychological focuses on the interpersonal relationships, dynamics, and psychological factors that influence communication interactions and it deals with status relationship. Communication within the socio-psychological context involves considerations of status, power dynamics, and interpersonal relationships.

Temporal relates to the timing, sequence, and historical aspects of communication events and it correctly matches with messages position within a sequence of events. Temporal context considers the timing and sequence of communication events, including how messages unfold over time and their relationship to past or future events.

Question 21
Consider the following sums of fractions:A.1619+14B.1114+15C.1921+13Choose the correct ascending order of above sums of fractions from the following options:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A < B < C
  • B.B < A < C
  • C.A < C < B
  • D.C < A < B
Correct Answer: B < A < C

Solving it, we get the order as:

B < A < C

Question 22
Given below are two statements:Statement I: The sum of integers from 110 to 630 is over 3,00,000.Statement II: The ratio of the circumference of a circle with its areas is inversely proportional to its diameter.In the light of above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement II is correct but Statement I is incorrect
Correct Answer: Statement II is correct but Statement I is incorrect

Statement I: Required sum = 630×6312 - 109×1102 = 198765

Thus, statement I is incorrect.

 

Statement II: Ratio = 2πrπr2 = 2r

Thus, statement II is correct.

Question 23
Which letter completes this sequence?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A, B, D, O, P, Q, ?
  • A.T
  • B.S
  • C.Z
  • D.R
Correct Answer: R

Only letters with an enclosed area are printed. Thus, next letter will be R.

Question 24
A watch, which gains 5 seconds every 3 minutes, is set right at 8 AM. In the afternoon, the same day, when the faulty watch indicates 5 : 15, the actual time is:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.6 PM
  • B.5:30 PM
  • C.5:00 PM
  • D.5:05 PM
Correct Answer: 5:00 PM

Time from 8 AM to 5:15 = 374 hrs

Let x be the actual time.

Then, x + gain = 374

or x + x36 = 374

or 37x36 = 374

or x = 9

Actual time will be 5:00 PM

Question 25
A bus takes two hours less for a journey of 300 km, if its speed is increased by 5 km/hrfrom its normal speed. The normal speed is:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.20 km/hr
  • B.25 km/hr
  • C.35 km/hr
  • D.50 km/hr
Correct Answer: 25 km/hr

Let normal speed be x.

Then, 300x - 300x+5 = 2

or x = 25

Thus, normal speed = 25 km/hr

Question 26
Given below are two statementsStatement I:According toNyayaphilosophy, the middle term (hetuorlinga) must be found in the minor term (paksa) in a case of interference.Statement II:According toNyayaphilosophy, the middle term should not be found anywhere whereSadhyaor major term is not foundIn the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct

Option A is correct.

Statement I correctly reflects the Nyaya philosophy regarding the middle term (hetu or linga) in inference. According to Nyaya, the middle term must be found in the minor term (paksa) for a valid inference to be made.

Statement II also accurately represents Nyaya philosophy. It states that the middle term should not be found anywhere where the Sadhya or major term is not found. This aligns with the Nyaya view that the middle term connects the minor term to the major term and should not appear elsewhere in the inference.

Question 27
“Ms Quintal has agreed that logic is not the most important thing in life. ApparentlyMs.Quintal advocates irrationality. It has taken two million years for the human race to achieve the position that it has andMs.Quintal would throw the whole thing into garbage”. Identify the fallacy.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Slippery slope
  • B.Strawman
  • C.Red Herring
  • D.Hasty Generalization
Correct Answer: Strawman

The fallacy in the given argument is option (B) - Strawman.

The argument misrepresents Ms. Quintal's position by exaggerating it to the point of absurdity. Ms. Quintal's acknowledgment that logic is not the most important thing in life is taken out of context and distorted to suggest that she advocates for irrationality and wants to throw away the achievements of the human race. This misrepresentation of her position creates a "strawman" argument, as it sets up a distorted version of her viewpoint that is easier to attack or refute.

Question 28
Given below are two statementsStatement I: Formal fallacies are those that can be detected only through analysis of the context of the argumentsStatement II: Formal fallacies pertain to deductive arguments that have identifiable forms.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct

The most appropriate answer is option (D) - Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

Statement I suggests that formal fallacies can only be detected through analysis of the context of the arguments. However, this is incorrect. Formal fallacies are errors in the structure of an argument and can be identified by examining the logical form of the argument rather than its content or context.

Statement II correctly identifies that formal fallacies pertain to deductive arguments that have identifiable forms. This is accurate because formal fallacies occur when there is a flaw in the logical structure of an argument, such as affirming the consequent or denying the antecedent. These flaws can be identified by analyzing the form of the argument rather than its content.

Question 29
The collection of all the objects to which a term may correctly be applied is calledA. The intension of that termB. Connotation of that termC. The extension of that termD. Denotation of that termChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.A and D only
  • C.B and C only
  • D.C and D only
Correct Answer: C and D only

The correct answer is option (D) - C and D only.

In logic, the collection of all the objects to which a term may correctly be applied is called the extension of that term. This corresponds to option (C).

Additionally, the denotation of a term is the same concept, representing the objects to which the term applies. Therefore, option (D) is correct as well.

Question 30
A farmer sees the water levels of river rising rapidly from that he concludes that it must have rained heavily upon the hill. Which of the instruments of knowledge is used in the example?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Perception (Pratyaksha)
  • B.Inference (Anumana)
  • C.Comparison (Upanmana)
  • D.Extra-ordinary perception (aulaaukikapratyaksha)
Correct Answer: Inference (Anumana)

The instrument of knowledge used in the example is option (B) – Inference (Anumana).

Inference, or Anumana, involves drawing conclusions based on observed evidence or patterns. In the given example, the farmer observes the rapidly rising water levels of the river and infers that it must have rained heavily upon the hill. This inference is based on the farmer's understanding of the causal relationship between heavy rainfall and rising water levels in the river.

Question 31
Which of the following are strengths of a computer?A. SpeedB. AccuracyC. ReliabilityD. Policy makingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B and D only
  • B.B, C only
  • C.A, B, C only
  • D.B, C, D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C only

Option C is correct.

Computers are known for their speed in processing data and executing tasks. They can perform calculations and operations much faster than humans, making them highly efficient for various applications.

Computers are accurate in executing tasks once programmed correctly. They can perform repetitive tasks with precision, minimizing errors that may occur due to human factors such as fatigue or oversight.

Computers are reliable when properly maintained and operated. They can perform tasks consistently and predictably, delivering reliable results over time. They are less prone to errors compared to human operators and can operate continuously without experiencing fatigue.

Question 32
MIDI stands for:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Multimedia Interface Data Interchange
  • B.Musical Instrument Digital Interface
  • C.Multi Interface Data Input
  • D.Media Interchange for Data Interface
Correct Answer: Musical Instrument Digital Interface

Option B is correct.

MIDI stands for Musical Instrument Digital Interface. It is a technical standard that describes a protocol, digital interface, and connectors that allow a wide variety of electronic musical instruments, computers, and related devices to communicate and synchronize with each other. MIDI enables devices such as keyboards, synthesizers, drum machines, and computers to control and exchange musical information, such as note-on and note-off commands, pitch, velocity, and other parameters.

Question 33
Given below are two statementsStatement I: A hardware engineer is responsible for the planning, implementation, configuration and administration of database management system.Statement II: A network administrator is responsible for managing and maintaining an organization’s Local area Network (LAN).In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Option D is correct.

Statement I is incorrect. A hardware engineer focuses on designing, developing, and maintaining computer hardware components such as processors, memory modules, storage devices, and peripheral devices. They are not typically responsible for database management system (DBMS) tasks, which are usually handled by database administrators (DBAs) or database engineers.

Statement II is true. A network administrator is responsible for overseeing the operation, configuration, maintenance, and security of an organization's Local Area Network (LAN). Their duties may include installing and configuring network devices, troubleshooting network issues, implementing security measures, and ensuring network performance and reliability.

Question 34
Which of the following statements are true?A. The CPU can store the data for a long timeB. Increasing the amount of RAM will increase the performance of computerC. RAM is known as ‘volatile’ memoryD. ROM is processing unitE. CPU is known as the brain of the computerChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, C and E only
  • B.A, C and D only
  • C.A, D and E only
  • D.A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: B, C and E only

Option A is correct.

The statement "Increasing the amount of RAM will increase the performance of the computer" is true. RAM (Random Access Memory) is a type of volatile memory that temporarily stores data and instructions that are actively being used or processed by the CPU. Increasing the amount of RAM in a computer can improve its performance by allowing it to handle larger amounts of data and run more programs simultaneously without slowing down due to excessive swapping of data between RAM and storage devices.

The statement "RAM is known as ‘volatile’ memory" is true. Volatile memory refers to memory that loses its stored data when the power is turned off or lost. RAM is considered volatile because it requires continuous power to retain the data stored in it. When the power is turned off, the data stored in RAM is lost.

The statement "CPU is known as the brain of the computer" is true. The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is often referred to as the brain of the computer because it is responsible for executing instructions, performing calculations, and coordinating the operations of other hardware components. The CPU is the primary component that carries out the computational tasks of a computer system.

Question 35
Which of the following is a correct definition of volatile memory?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.It does not lose its contents on failure of power supply
  • B.The contents in the memory evaporates
  • C.Due to heat the data is lost
  • D.It loses its contents on failure of power supply
Correct Answer: It loses its contents on failure of power supply

Option D is correct.

Volatile memory refers to memory that loses its stored data when the power supply is interrupted or turned off. This means that the data stored in volatile memory is temporary and requires continuous power to maintain its integrity. When the power supply is disrupted, the contents of volatile memory are lost, hence the term "volatile”.

Question 36
The total power output in a hydroelectric installation depends upon:A. the total water flowB. the electrical conductivity of waterC. atmospheric temperatureD. artificial distance through which water fallsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.A and D only
  • D.A, B and D only
Correct Answer: A and D only

The correct answer is (C) A and D only.

 

Total power output in a hydroelectric installation primarily depends on:

 

Statement A: the total water flow: This is crucial because the power generated by a hydroelectric installation is directly proportional to the volume of water flowing and the height (or distance) through which it falls.

 

Statement D: artificial distance through which water falls: The height through which water falls (also known as the head) is a key factor in determining the potential energy available to generate electricity. The greater the distance the water falls, the more potential energy it possesses, and hence, more power can be generated.

 

Statement B: The electrical conductivity of water and Statement C: atmospheric temperature are not directly related to the total power output of a hydroelectric installation. Therefore, they are not factors upon which the total power output depends.

 

So, the correct option is (C) A and D only.

Question 37
In the context of climate change which of the following observations are correct for 20th century with reference to 1750?A. the global average surface temperature has increased by 0.6℃B. Greater increase in daytime temperature than night time has been observedC. Global average sea level rose 0.1m largely due to thermal expansionD. The atmosphere concentration of Carbon dioxide (CO2) increased by 31%E. Precipitation in the northern hemisphere has decreased by 1% per decadeChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, D and E only
  • B.A, C and D only
  • C.B, C and D only
  • D.A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only

Option B is correct.

The statement "The global average surface temperature has increased by 0.6℃" is correct. Over the 20th century, the global average surface temperature has increased by approximately 0.6 degrees Celsius compared to the temperatures in the mid-18th century (around 1750). This increase is primarily attributed to human activities such as the burning of fossil fuels and deforestation, which release greenhouse gases into the atmosphere.

The statement "Global average sea level rose 0.1m largely due to thermal expansion" is correct. The global average sea level has risen by approximately 0.1 meters (or 10 centimeters) over the 20th century, primarily due to thermal expansion of seawater as it absorbs heat from the warming atmosphere. Melting of glaciers and ice caps also contribute to the rise in sea level.

The statement "The atmospheric concentration of Carbon dioxide (CO2) increased by 31%" is correct. The atmospheric concentration of carbon dioxide (CO2) has increased by approximately 31% since the mid-18th century (around 1750), largely due to human activities such as the burning of fossil fuels, deforestation, and industrial processes. This increase in CO2 concentration is a significant driver of global warming and climate change.

Question 38
At pH values above 7.5, the disinfectant capability of chlorine is(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.greatly reduced
  • B.greatly enhanced
  • C.slightly enhanced
  • D.not changed
Correct Answer: greatly reduced

Option A is correct.

Chlorine is commonly used as a disinfectant in water treatment processes due to its ability to kill or inactivate pathogens such as bacteria, viruses, and protozoans. However, the effectiveness of chlorine as a disinfectant can be influenced by various factors, including pH levels.

At higher pH levels, typically above 7.5, the disinfectant capability of chlorine is greatly reduced. This reduction in effectiveness occurs because chlorine exists predominantly in the form of hypochlorite ions (OCl in alkaline conditions. Hypochlorite ions are less reactive and have weaker disinfectant properties compared to the more reactive hypochlorous acid (HOCl) form of chlorine, which predominates at lower pH levels.

In alkaline conditions, the equilibrium between hypochlorous acid (HOCl) and hypochlorite ions (OCl shifts towards the latter. Since hypochlorite ions are less effective at disinfection, the overall disinfectant capability of chlorine is greatly diminished at higher pH values.

Question 39
Match List I with the List IILIST I (Hazardous substance)(a) Neurotoxins(b) Mutagens(c) Teratogens(d) CarcinogensLIST II (Specific effect)(i) substances that cause cancer(ii) substances that attack nerve cells(iii) substances that damage or alter genetic material (DNA) in cells(iv) substance that cause abnormality during embryonic growth and developmentChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.(a)-(i), (b)-(iv), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)
  • B.(a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
  • D.(a)-(iii), (b)-(ii), (c)-(i), (d)-(iv)
Correct Answer: (a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)

Option C is correct.

Neurotoxins are substances that specifically target nerve cells, causing damage or dysfunction. They are substances that attack nerve cells.

Mutagens are substances that induce genetic mutations or alter the DNA sequence in cells. They are substances that damage or alter genetic material (DNA) in cells.

Teratogens are substances that can interfere with embryonic development, leading to abnormalities or defects in the developing fetus during pregnancy. They are substances that cause abnormality during embryonic growth and development.

Carcinogens are substances that can cause cancer by promoting the development of malignant tumors. They are substances that cause cancer.

Question 40
Given below are two statementsStatement I: Fuel oxides of nitrogen is created when nitrogen (NOx) and oxygen in the combustion chamber are heated to as high as 1000℃ temperatureStatement II: ThermalNOxis often the dominant source in the totalNOxemissions.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false

Option B is correct.

Statement I is incorrect. Fuel oxides of nitrogen, or NOx, are formed during combustion processes where nitrogen and oxygen are present at high temperatures. However, the specific temperature mentioned (1000℃) is not necessarily required for NOx formation. NOx can form at various temperatures depending on factors such as fuel composition, combustion conditions, and the presence of catalysts. NOx emissions can occur at temperatures lower than 1000℃.

Statement II is incorrect. While thermal NOx, which is formed from nitrogen and oxygen at high temperatures in combustion processes, can contribute significantly to NOx emissions, it is not always the dominant source. NOx emissions can also come from other sources such as fuel-bound nitrogen and prompt NOx, which is formed at lower temperatures and shorter residence times in the combustion process. Therefore, thermal NOx may not always be the dominant source of NOx emissions.

Question 41
Which among the following measures do not help students from disadvantaged communities to feel comfortable in the classroom?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Encouraging them to participate in the cultural activities
  • B.Asking them to concentrate on study only
  • C.Inviting successful persons from disadvantaged communities
  • D.Trying to understand their struggles and difficulties genuinely
Correct Answer: Asking them to concentrate on study only

Option B is correct.

Asking them to concentrate on study only approach may create additional pressure and stress for students from disadvantaged communities. It overlooks the importance of addressing their socio-emotional needs and unique challenges. It can also perpetuate a sense of exclusion or inadequacy if their struggles and difficulties are not acknowledged and supported.

Question 42
As per NEP 2020, curbing of commercialization of education will be effected by the following measureA. Making all transaction onlineB. Ensuring that educational institutions will be held to similar standards of auditC. Making disclosure as a ‘not for profit’ entityD. Ensuring that private institutions should donate fund for charityChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.A, C and D only
  • D.B, C and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and E only

Option D is correct.

Ensuring that educational institutions will be held to similar standards of audit: This measure ensures accountability and transparency in the financial operations of educational institutions, thereby curbing commercialization.

Making disclosure as a ‘not for profit’ entity: Requiring educational institutions to disclose their non-profit status helps in distinguishing them from commercial ventures, discouraging commercialization.

Ensuring that private institutions should donate fund for charity: This measure promotes social responsibility among private institutions and redirects resources towards charitable causes rather than purely profit-oriented ventures, thereby contributing to the reduction of commercialization.

Question 43
Given below are two statementsStatement I: Increasing level of environmental pollution can be labelled by creating awareness among common people about its fallouts.Statement II: There should be research to identify those behaviours which are responsible for pollution.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. Creating awareness among the general public about the consequences of environmental pollution can indeed help in addressing the issue. When people are aware of the impacts of their actions on the environment, they are more likely to adopt behaviors that reduce pollution and promote sustainability.

Statement II is also true. Conducting research to identify the behaviors and activities that contribute to environmental pollution is crucial for developing effective strategies to mitigate pollution. By understanding the root causes of pollution, policymakers, scientists, and organizations can design targeted interventions to address them and prevent further environmental degradation.

Question 44
Which of the following research areas is associated with Oriental Research Institute of Mysore?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Folk literature
  • B.Palm leaf manuscripts
  • C.Painting
  • D.Visual Arts
Correct Answer: Palm leaf manuscripts

Option B is correct.

The Oriental Research Institute (ORI) in Mysore is renowned for its extensive collection and research on palm leaf manuscripts. Palm leaf manuscripts are ancient texts that were traditionally written on dried palm leaves. These manuscripts contain valuable information about various subjects including literature, philosophy, religion, science, and more, offering insights into the cultural heritage and intellectual traditions of different regions.

The ORI in Mysore specializes in the preservation, study, and dissemination of these palm leaf manuscripts, making it a significant center for Oriental studies. Researchers and scholars visit the institute to access its vast collection of manuscripts for academic research and study.

Question 45
Which of the following types of Universities is the least in number in India?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.State Universities
  • B.Private Universities
  • C.Deemed Universities
  • D.Central Universities
Correct Answer: Central Universities

Option D is correct.

Central Universities are established by an Act of Parliament and are under the purview of the central government. These universities are relatively fewer in number compared to State Universities and Private Universities. Central Universities often have a national character and cater to specific areas of study or research with a broader mandate.

Due to the stringent process of establishing a Central University and the limited number of such institutions sanctioned by the government, they are the least in number among the different types of universities in India.

Question 46
Read the passage and answer the question given below:To deal with issues of democracy and authoritarian rules we have to pay particular attention to both the context what can be called development and to the interpretation of democracy, in particular to the respective roles of voting and public reasoning. The assessment of development cannot be divorced from the lives that people can lead and the real freedom that they enjoy. Development can scarcely be seen mere in terms of enhancement of inanimate objects of convenience, such as a rise in GNP or in personal incomes, or industrialization important as they may be as means to the real ends. Their value must depend upon what they do to the lives and freedom of the people involved, which must be central to the idea of development. If development is understood in a broader way with a focus on human lives.thenit becomes immediately clear that the relation between development and democracy has to be seen partly in terms of their constitutive connection.ratherthan only through their external links. Even though the question has often been asked whether political freedom is 'conducive to development', we must not miss the crucial recognition that political liberties and democratic rights are among the constituent components of development. Their relevance for development does not have to be established indirectly through their contribution to the growth of GNP. However, after acknowledging this central connection.wealso have to subject democracy to consequential analysis since there are other kinds of freedoms as well.otherthan political liberties and civil rights.towhich attention mu be paid. We must be concerned, for example, with economic poverty.Question: The interpretation of democracy depends upon:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.political convenience
  • B.issues other than development
  • C.the exercise of franchise as linked to public reasoning
  • D.development as asperateentity
Correct Answer: the exercise of franchise as linked to public reasoning

Option C is correct.

As per the passage, the interpretation of democracy depends upon the exercise of franchise as linked to public reasoning.

Question 47
Read the passage and answer the question given below:To deal with issues of democracy and authoritarian rules we have to pay particular attention to both the context what can be called development and to the interpretation of democracy, in particular to the respective roles of voting and public reasoning. The assessment of development cannot be divorced from the lives that people can lead and the real freedom that they enjoy. Development can scarcely be seen mere in terms of enhancement of inanimate objects of convenience, such as a rise in GNP or in personal incomes, or industrialization important as they may be as means to the real ends. Their value must depend upon what they do to the lives and freedom of the people involved, which must be central to the idea of development. If development is understood in a broader way with a focus on human lives.thenit becomes immediately clear that the relation between development and democracy has to be seen partly in terms of their constitutive connection.ratherthan only through their external links. Even though the question has often been asked whether political freedom is 'conducive to development', we must not miss the crucial recognition that political liberties and democratic rights are among the constituent components of development. Their relevance for development does not have to be established indirectly through their contribution to the growth of GNP. However, after acknowledging this central connection.wealso have to subject democracy to consequential analysis since there are other kinds of freedoms as well.otherthan political liberties and civil rights.towhich attention mu be paid. We must be concerned, for example, with economic poverty.Question: Development should be comprehensively measured in terms of:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.increase in inanimate objects
  • B.rise in personal incomes
  • C.industrialisation
  • D.the freedom of the people involved
Correct Answer: the freedom of the people involved

Option D is correct.

A per the passage, development should be comprehensively measured in terms of the freedom of the people involved.

Question 48
Read the passage and answer the question given below:To deal with issues of democracy and authoritarian rules we have to pay particular attention to both the context what can be called development and to the interpretation of democracy, in particular to the respective roles of voting and public reasoning. The assessment of development cannot be divorced from the lives that people can lead and the real freedom that they enjoy. Development can scarcely be seen mere in terms of enhancement of inanimate objects of convenience, such as a rise in GNP or in personal incomes, or industrialization important as they may be as means to the real ends. Their value must depend upon what they do to the lives and freedom of the people involved, which must be central to the idea of development. If development is understood in a broader way with a focus on human lives.thenit becomes immediately clear that the relation between development and democracy has to be seen partly in terms of their constitutive connection.ratherthan only through their external links. Even though the question has often been asked whether political freedom is 'conducive to development', we must not miss the crucial recognition that political liberties and democratic rights are among the constituent components of development. Their relevance for development does not have to be established indirectly through their contribution to the growth of GNP. However, after acknowledging this central connection.wealso have to subject democracy to consequential analysis since there are other kinds of freedoms as well.otherthan political liberties and civil rights.towhich attention mu be paid. We must be concerned, for example, with economic poverty.Question: The relation between democracy and development can be seen through their:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.External links
  • B.Constitutive connection
  • C.Indirect relation
  • D.Abstract Assessment
Correct Answer: Constitutive connection

Option B is correct.

As per the passage, the relation between democracy and development can be seen through their constitutive connection.

Question 49
Read the passage and answer the question given below:To deal with issues of democracy and authoritarian rules we have to pay particular attention to both the context what can be called development and to the interpretation of democracy, in particular to the respective roles of voting and public reasoning. The assessment of development cannot be divorced from the lives that people can lead and the real freedom that they enjoy. Development can scarcely be seen mere in terms of enhancement of inanimate objects of convenience, such as a rise in GNP or in personal incomes, or industrialization important as they may be as means to the real ends. Their value must depend upon what they do to the lives and freedom of the people involved, which must be central to the idea of development. If development is understood in a broader way with a focus on human lives.thenit becomes immediately clear that the relation between development and democracy has to be seen partly in terms of their constitutive connection.ratherthan only through their external links. Even though the question has often been asked whether political freedom is 'conducive to development', we must not miss the crucial recognition that political liberties and democratic rights are among the constituent components of development. Their relevance for development does not have to be established indirectly through their contribution to the growth of GNP. However, after acknowledging this central connection.wealso have to subject democracy to consequential analysis since there are other kinds of freedoms as well.otherthan political liberties and civil rights.towhich attention mu be paid. We must be concerned, for example, with economic poverty.Question: The consequential analysis of democracy as related to development should take into account:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Political rights only
  • B.Civil rights
  • C.Freedom from poverty
  • D.Policy initiatives
Correct Answer: Freedom from poverty

Option C is correct.

As per the passage, the consequential analysis of democracy as related to development should take into account freedom from poverty.

Question 50
Read the passage and answer the question given below:To deal with issues of democracy and authoritarian rules we have to pay particular attention to both the context what can be called development and to the interpretation of democracy, in particular to the respective roles of voting and public reasoning. The assessment of development cannot be divorced from the lives that people can lead and the real freedom that they enjoy. Development can scarcely be seen mere in terms of enhancement of inanimate objects of convenience, such as a rise in GNP or in personal incomes, or industrialization important as they may be as means to the real ends. Their value must depend upon what they do to the lives and freedom of the people involved, which must be central to the idea of development. If development is understood in a broader way with a focus on human lives.thenit becomes immediately clear that the relation between development and democracy has to be seen partly in terms of their constitutive connection.ratherthan only through their external links. Even though the question has often been asked whether political freedom is 'conducive to development', we must not miss the crucial recognition that political liberties and democratic rights are among the constituent components of development. Their relevance for development does not have to be established indirectly through their contribution to the growth of GNP. However, after acknowledging this central connection.wealso have to subject democracy to consequential analysis since there are other kinds of freedoms as well.otherthan political liberties and civil rights.towhich attention mu be paid. We must be concerned, for example, with economic poverty.Question: The central theme of the passage is:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023
  • A.Development and freedom are inter-related
  • B.Industrialization is essential for political freedom
  • C.Development and Human lives are not linked
  • D.Development is purely an economic proposition
Correct Answer: Development and freedom are inter-related

Option A is correct.

As per the passage, the central theme of the passage is development and freedom are inter-related.

Quiz Attempt #119756

Total Questions: 14
Question 1
Use of theory in social science research is important as it provides: (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • A.Contrasting framework
  • B.Excess literature
  • C.Justification for research
  • D.Quantitative data
Correct Answer: Justification for research

Theoretical frameworks help researchers establish the rationale and reasoning behind their research questions, hypotheses, and methodology. Theory guides the research process and provides a foundation for understanding and interpreting the research findings. It helps researchers justify why their study is relevant and important within the broader context of the field.

Question 2
A researcher wants the research question to be (UGC NET 06 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • A.Secretive
  • B.Implicit
  • C.Explicit
  • D.Ambiguous
Correct Answer: Explicit

An explicit research question is one that is clearly stated, specific, and unambiguous. It leaves no room for confusion or misinterpretation and provides a clear focus for the research study. Researchers aim for explicit research questions to guide their investigations effectively and efficiently.

Question 3
Methods of social research are directly linked to different visions of (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • A.Social reality
  • B.Laboratory experiments
  • C.Simulations
  • D.Virtual reality
Correct Answer: Social reality

The methods of social research are directly tied to different views of social reality. Researchers' beliefs about what constitutes social reality shape their choice of research methods. For instance, positivists prefer quantitative methods like surveys and experiments to uncover objective facts, while interpretivists opt for qualitative methods like interviews and participant observation to explore subjective meanings and experiences. These methodological choices are intimately linked to how researchers perceive and approach the social world.

Question 4
Which among the following is the best field of study to improve the ability of students to experiment and analyse? (UGC NET Dec 2018)
  • A.History
  • B.Science
  • C.Languages
  • D.Economics
Correct Answer: Science

The best field of study to improve students' ability to experiment and analyze is Science. Science involves the systematic pursuit and application of knowledge and understanding of the natural and social world. It follows a methodology based on evidence, making it an ideal discipline for honing skills in experimentation and analysis. Students engaging with scientific principles and methods develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills, which are essential for understanding and exploring the complexities of the world around us.

Question 5
Research is (UGC NET Jun 2010)
  • A.Searching again and again
  • B.Finding solution to any problem
  • C.Working in a scientific way to search for truth of any problem
  • D.None of the above
Correct Answer: Working in a scientific way to search for truth of any problem

Research is a systematic and organized process that involves using scientific methods to investigate and analyze a specific topic or problem. The main objective of research is to gain new knowledge, verify existing theories, or challenge established facts in a rigorous and methodical manner.

Researchers follow a structured approach to gather relevant data, analyze it, and draw meaningful conclusions. They formulate research questions or hypotheses, design experiments or surveys, collect data, and then apply various statistical and analytical techniques to interpret the results

Question 6
Which is the main objective of research? (UGC NET Dec 2013)
  • A.To review the literature
  • B.To summarize what is already known
  • C.To get an academic degree
  • D.To discover new facts or to make fresh interpretation of known facts
Correct Answer: To discover new facts or to make fresh interpretation of known facts

Research is a systematic and planned process that seeks to answer questions and challenges existing facts and theories. It involves the collection, analysis, and interpretation of data to arrive at reliable solutions to problems. Ultimately, research leads to the enhancement of knowledge by expanding our understanding of various phenomena and contributing to the development of new insights and discoveries.

Question 7
Which of the following statements regarding the meaning of research are correct? (UGC NET Jun 2015)(a) Research refers to a series of systematic activity or activities undertaken to find out the solution of a problem.(b) It is a systematic, logical and an unbiased process wherein verification of hypothesis, data analysis, interpretation and formation of principles can be done.(c) It is an intellectual enquiry or quest towards truth.(d) It leads to enhancement of knowledge.Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
  • A.(a), (b) and (c)
  • B.(b), (c) and (d)
  • C.(a), (c) and (d)
  • D.(a), (b), (c) and (d)
Correct Answer: (a), (b), (c) and (d)

Research refers to a series of systematic activities undertaken to find solutions to problems. It is a systematic, logical, and unbiased process that involves verification of hypotheses, data analysis, interpretation, and formulation of principles. Research is also considered an intellectual inquiry or quest for truth. Moreover, research leads to the enhancement of knowledge by seeking answers to unanswered questions and challenging existing facts and theories

Question 8
In the list of statements given below which of them offer a suitable definition of research? (UGC NET 18 Dec 2018 Morning)Give your answer by selecting from the code.(a) Research means a repeated search(b) Research is basically an answer to a question.(c) Research provides an authentic solution to a problem.(d) Research is an Endeavour to prove one’s hypothesis.(e) Research is a meaning- giving process(f) Research means drawing a sample from a defined population.
  • A.(b), (c) and (e)
  • B.(b), (c) and (f)
  • C.(a), (d) and (f)
  • D.(a), (b) and (c)
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (c)

(a) Research is a systematic process that involves planning and carefully conducting data collection, analysis, and interpretation. It aims to arrive at dependable and well-supported solutions or findings related to a specific problem or question. Researchers follow a structured approach, adhering to established methodologies and techniques, to ensure the reliability and validity of their results. The systematic nature of research allows for the replication of studies and contributes to the advancement of knowledge in various fields.

 

(b) Research is not a one-time endeavor but entails repeated searches and observations. It involves a continuous and thorough investigation to discover new insights and knowledge from existing facts or phenomena. Through repeated examinations and data gathering, researchers deepen their understanding of the subject matter and identify patterns or trends that may have been overlooked initially. This iterative process contributes to the development of comprehensive and well-informed conclusions.

 

(c) The primary goal of research is to provide authentic and reliable solutions to identified problems. Researchers use rigorous methods and critical analysis to generate evidence-based findings. The authenticity of research lies in its adherence to established scientific principles and the use of objective and verifiable data. Reliable research outcomes serve as a valuable basis for decision-making, problem-solving, and policymaking, as they are based on robust evidence and contribute to the advancement of knowledge in various disciplines

Question 9
Which of the following statements best reflect the meaning and characteristics of research? (UGC NET 08 Jul 2018)(a) Research means challenging the status quo.(b) Research is an endeavour to collect facts and information.(c) Research is a synthesis of deductive and inductive processes.(d) Research means proving one’s assertions and beliefs.(e) Research is a careful review of reported studies.(f) Research is a critical and passionate search for knowledge
  • A.(a), (b) and (c)
  • B.(b), (d) and (e)
  • C.(a), (e) and (f)
  • D.(a), (c) and (f)
Correct Answer: (a), (c) and (f)

Research involves seeking answers to unanswered questions or challenging existing facts and theories. It is a systematic and planned process that aims to gather new knowledge or data from primary sources. The emphasis in research is on discovering general principles through accurate and exact investigation.

Key characteristics of research include using valid data gathering devices, being logical and objective, resisting bias and the temptation to seek only data that supports preconceived notions, and eliminating personal feelings and preferences.

 

Research involves both deductive and inductive processes, combining reasoning from general principles to specific conclusions and vice versa. It requires the researcher to be willing to follow procedures that may lead to unpopular or socially disapproved conclusions.

Throughout the research process, data is carefully recorded and reported. Conclusions and generalizations are drawn cautiously based on the collected data and analysis.

Question 10
Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R: (UGC NET 29 Nov Evening)Assertion ‘A’:One of the important aims of research is the development of a theory.Reason ‘R’:Both facts and theory are important for doing the research.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:Codes
  • A.Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • B.Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • C.A is correct but R is not correct.
  • D.A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.

Assertion 'A' is correct: One of the important aims of research is indeed the development of a theory. Research often involves the systematic investigation of a subject to establish principles or facts and to develop or refine theories or hypotheses.

 

Reason 'R' is correct: Both facts and theory are indeed important for doing research. Research involves gathering facts and evidence through observation, experiments, or data analysis. Theories, on the other hand, provide the framework for organizing and explaining these facts and observations.

 

While both statements are correct, the reason does not directly explain the assertion. While theories and facts are important for research, the development of a theory doesn't necessarily depend solely on the presence of facts. It can also be based on logical reasoning, creativity, and intuition.

Question 11
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 24 Nov Evening)Statement I: Researchers in history are myth makers.Statement II: Various movements in social history‐ new history ‐ have provided new narratives for history researchers.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.

Statement I: "Researchers in history are myth makers." This statement suggests that historians, while studying history and interpreting historical events, often construct narratives and explanations that may not fully align with the absolute truth but are shaped by their perspectives, biases, and interpretations. History is not just a collection of indisputable facts but is often subject to interpretation and storytelling.

 

Statement II: "Various movements in social history - new history - have provided new narratives for history researchers." This statement implies that different approaches and movements in the field of history, such as new history or social history, have offered alternative perspectives and narratives to historians. These movements have challenged traditional historical accounts and opened up new avenues for research and understanding of the past.

Question 12
Which of the following are categories of participants in research? (UGC NET 06Mar 2023 Morning)A. Good participantsB. Negative participantsC. Faithful participantsD. Apprehensive participantsE. Traditional participantsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, D Only
  • B.B, C, E Only
  • C.A, B, D, E Only
  • D.A, C, D, E Only
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D Only

The categories of participants in research typically include:

a. Good participants: Participants who actively and cooperatively engage in the research process.

b. Negative participants: Participants who may exhibit resistance or reluctance to participate in the research or may provide unhelpful or uncooperative responses.

c. Faithful participants: Participants who are committed to the research and provide accurate and reliable information.

d. Apprehensive participants: Participants who may have concerns, fears, or anxieties about the research process.

Question 13
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 11 Mar 2023 Evening)Statement I:In case, a research study leads to generation of more research, then we will say it contain heuristic value.Statement II:The discussion section does not allow freedom and flexibility in writing to the researcher.In the light of the above statement, choose the correct answer from the option given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.

Statement I: This statement is correct. Heuristic value in research refers to the idea that a study generates new questions, insights, or areas of inquiry. If a research study leads to the generation of more research questions or prompts further exploration, it is said to have heuristic value.

 

Statement II: This statement is incorrect. The discussion section of a research paper is where researchers have the freedom and flexibility to interpret their findings, discuss implications, and suggest avenues for future research. It is a section where researchers can express their thoughts, ideas, and insights related to their study's results. Therefore, the discussion section does allow for freedom and flexibility in writing.

Question 14
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 24 Dec Morning 2021)Statement I: Only phenomena and hence knowledge confirmed by the senses cannot genuinely be warranted as knowledge.Statement II: Science must (and presumably can) be conducted in a way that is value free.In light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

Statement I: "Only phenomena and hence knowledge confirmed by the senses cannot genuinely be warranted as knowledge."

This statement is often associated with empiricism, which argues that knowledge is primarily derived from sensory experience. However, this statement is not universally accepted. There are forms of knowledge that go beyond sensory experience, such as abstract mathematical concepts or philosophical ideas. Many philosophers and scholars argue that knowledge can be acquired through reason and intellect, not just sensory perception.

 

Statement II: "Science must (and presumably can) be conducted in a way that is value-free."

This statement pertains to the idea that scientific inquiry should strive to be objective and free from personal values, biases, or preferences. It is a widely accepted principle in the philosophy of science that scientific research should aim for objectivity and minimize the influence of personal values to maintain the credibility and reliability of scientific findings.

Quiz Attempts 791-800 of 849
